en:
What is a one-sentence summary of the following article?
You could go directly into the confessional (provided there's no one else in there or waiting outside), but sometimes it's nice to take a minute in the pew by yourself beforehand. You have this beautiful church probably almost all to yourself. Can you feel its energy resonating through you? Can you feel the majesty of the Lord's kingdom and how you're a part of it? Take a moment to kneel and pray with your head down and hands clasped together. Reflect on your faith and how you feel currently. Think about how you've been responding to God's call and how you've been living in the light of his love. When the priest is ready for you, of course. You'll probably see him there by his lonesome or someone else walk out just before you. Sit down either across from him or behind the screen -- it's totally up to you whether or not you prefer to remain anonymous. He won't treat you any differently either way. Make the sign of the cross upon his prompt, saying, "Bless me, Father, for I have sinned.  It has been (blank) since my last confession." This is your standard, traditional phrasing. However, if you just sit down and say hello, that's fine, too. The priest knows what he's doing. The Byzantine Rite is a bit different. The priest may sit to your side and put his epitrachelion on your head. He may then also do the Prayer of Absolution. But the idea remains the exact same -- just go wherever he takes you. Once you sit down and you've made the sign of the cross, just sit back and follow the priest's lead. He'll ask you how long it's been since your last confession (if you don't voluntarily offer that information), how you are feeling, maybe how your faith is going, and then ask you what sins you would like to talk about with him and God. It's just a casual conversation! Do not fret. There is absolutely zero pressure on your part. Again, as long as you come there with the intention of leaving with a clean heart, you're more than welcome in the church. There is no wrong way to go about confession! This part is intimidating, but think about it this way: the priest you're talking to has probably heard just about everything before. Whatever you have to say will not blow his mind. So when he asks, start rattling them off, from the most serious to the least. If he asks any questions, answer them, but do not feel the need to go into detail. A simple, "I did so and so," will suffice. Your priest is going to be very understanding. If you don't remember the exact timeframe, that's fine. If you don't remember your motivation, that's fine. All your priest cares about is that you're being as honest as possible and that your heart is in the right place. He'll talk you through everything, possibly asking about your intentions, but mainly just letting you know that God loves you, sin and all. If he has any ideas to bring you closer to God, he may suggest them at this juncture. He's there to help, after all. He will then ask you to make an Act of Contrition. That goes like this:  My God, I am sorry for my sins with all my heart.In choosing to do wrong and failing to do good,I have sinned against You whom I should loveabove all things. I firmly intend, with your help,to do penance, to sin no more, andto avoid whatever leads me to sin.Our Savior Jesus Christ suffered and died for us.In his name, my God, have mercy  (If you are a Roman Catholic, your act of contrition will go like this: Oh my God, I am very sorry for having offended thee. I detest all of my sins because of thy just punishment. But most of all, because they offend you, my God, who is all good and deserving of all my love. I firmly resolve with the help of thy grace, to sin no more, and to avoid the near occasion of sin. Amen. Don't worry! It won't be anything huge. You may even walk away just having to say a few meaningful prayers. Take the absolution to heart -- you now have a brand new, clean slate to work with. It'll feel so uplifting! Just to clarify, "absolution" means your sins are washed away. "Penance" is your expression of regret and repentance, showing God that you're truly sorry for what you've done and that you wish for nothing more than to be forgiven.

Summary:
The article provides guidance on the process of confession in a church, emphasizing the importance of reflection, honest conversation with the priest, and the act of contrition for a meaningful and pressure-free experience, ultimately leading to absolution and spiritual growth.
google-ko:
다음 기사를 한 문장으로 요약하면 무엇입니까?
고해소에 직접 들어갈 수도 있지만(그 안에 다른 사람이 없거나 밖에서 기다리고 있는 경우) 때로는 미리 혼자 신도석에 잠시 시간을 내는 것도 좋습니다. 당신은 아마도 이 아름다운 교회를 거의 혼자 소유하고 있을 것입니다. 그 에너지가 당신을 통해 공명하는 것을 느낄 수 있습니까? 주님 왕국의 위대함과 여러분이 그 왕국의 일부라는 것을 느낄 수 있습니까? 잠시 무릎을 꿇고 머리를 숙이고 두 손을 모으고 기도하는 시간을 가지십시오. 당신의 믿음과 현재의 느낌을 생각해보십시오. 당신이 하나님의 부르심에 어떻게 응답해 왔는지, 그분의 사랑의 빛 가운데 어떻게 살아왔는지 생각해 보십시오. 물론, 신부님이 당신을 맞이할 준비가 되어 있을 때 말이죠. 당신은 아마도 그가 혼자 있는 모습을 보거나 다른 사람이 당신보다 먼저 걸어 나가는 것을 보게 될 것입니다. 그 사람의 맞은편이나 화면 뒤에 앉으십시오. 익명을 유지하고 싶은지 여부는 전적으로 귀하에게 달려 있습니다. 그는 어느 쪽이든 당신을 다르게 대하지 않을 것입니다. 그의 재촉에 따라 “아버지, 제가 죄를 지었사오니 저를 축복해 주십시오. 제가 마지막으로 고백한 이후로 그 자리는 비어 있었습니다.”라고 말하면서 십자 성호를 그으십시오. 이것은 귀하의 표준적이고 전통적인 표현입니다. 하지만 그냥 앉아서 인사만 하면 그것도 괜찮습니다. 목사님은 자기가 무슨 일을 하고 있는지 알고 계십니다. 비잔틴 의식은 조금 다릅니다. 신부는 당신 옆에 앉아서 그의 상피를 당신의 머리에 올려 놓을 수 있습니다. 그런 다음 그는 또한 사죄의 기도를 바칠 수도 있습니다. 그러나 아이디어는 여전히 동일합니다. 그가 데려가는 곳이면 어디든 가십시오. 일단 자리에 앉아 십자성호를 긋고 나면, 그냥 앉아서 사제의 인도를 따르십시오. 그는 당신이 마지막 고백을 한 지 얼마나 됐는지(자발적으로 그 정보를 제공하지 않는 경우), 기분이 어떤지, 어쩌면 당신의 믿음이 어떻게 진행되고 있는지 묻고, 어떤 죄에 대해 이야기하고 싶은지 물어볼 것입니다. 그와 신. 그냥 일상적인 대화에요! 걱정하지 마세요. 귀하의 입장에서는 전혀 압력이 없습니다. 다시 한 번 말하지만, 깨끗한 마음으로 떠나려는 의도를 갖고 그곳에 오는 한, 교회에서는 여러분을 더욱 환영할 것입니다. 고백에는 잘못된 방법이 없습니다! 이 부분은 두렵지만 이렇게 생각해보세요. 당신이 대화하고 있는 신부는 아마도 이전에 모든 것에 대해 들어봤을 것입니다. 당신이 무슨 말을 하든 그의 마음을 사로잡지는 못할 것이다. 따라서 그가 물으면 가장 심각한 것부터 가장 적은 것까지 덜컥 덜컥 울리기 시작하십시오. 그가 질문을 하면 대답하되 자세히 설명할 필요는 없습니다. 간단히 말해서, "나는 그렇게 했다"고 충분할 것입니다. 신부님께서 매우 이해해 주실 것입니다. 정확한 기간을 기억하지 못하더라도 괜찮습니다. 동기를 기억하지 못한다면 괜찮습니다. 당신의 신부가 관심을 갖는 것은 당신이 가능한 한 정직하고 당신의 마음이 올바른 곳에 있는지입니다. 그분은 당신의 의도에 대해 물으시면서 모든 것에 대해 말씀하실 것입니다. 그러나 주로 하나님은 당신과 죄와 모든 것을 사랑하신다는 것을 알려 주실 것입니다. 만약 그 사람이 당신을 하나님께 더 가까이 데려갈 아이디어가 있다면 이 시점에 제안할 수도 있습니다. 결국 그는 도움을 주기 위해 거기 있는 것입니다. 그런 다음 그는 당신에게 통회 행위를 하도록 요청할 것입니다. 그 내용은 이렇습니다. 나의 하나님, 나는 온 마음을 다해 나의 죄를 후회합니다. 나는 잘못된 일을 선택하고 선을 행하지 않음으로 무엇보다도 사랑해야 할 당신께 죄를 지었습니다. 나는 당신의 도우심으로 참회하고 더 이상 죄를 짓지 아니하며 나를 죄에 빠지게 하는 모든 것을 멀리하기로 굳게 작정하였나이다 우리 구주 예수 그리스도께서 우리를 위하여 고난을 받으시고 죽으셨으니 나의 하나님 그의 이름으로 자비를 베푸소서 (만일 로마 사람이거든 가톨릭인이여, 당신의 통회 행위는 다음과 같을 것입니다: 오 하느님, 당신을 화나게 해서 매우 죄송합니다. 나는 당신의 정당한 형벌로 인해 나의 모든 죄를 미워합니다. 그러나 무엇보다도, 나의 하느님, 모든 것이 선하고 나의 모든 사랑을 받기에 합당하오니 주의 은혜로 굳게 결심하오니 더 이상 죄를 짓지 아니하며 죄의 기회를 면하게 되리이다 아멘 걱정하지 마 큰 일이 아니리이다 몇 가지 의미 있는 기도만 하고 떠날 수도 있습니다. 사죄를 마음에 새기세요. 이제 작업할 수 있는 완전히 새롭고 깨끗한 상태가 되었습니다. 정말 기분이 좋아질 것입니다! 명확히 말하면, "사죄"는 당신의 죄를 의미합니다. "참회"는 후회와 회개의 표현으로, 자신이 행한 일에 대해 진심으로 뉘우치고 용서받는 것 외에는 아무것도 원하지 않는다는 것을 하나님께 보여드리는 것입니다.

요약:
이 기사는 교회에서 고백하는 과정에 대한 지침을 제공하며, 성찰의 중요성, 신부와의 솔직한 대화, 의미 있고 압력 없는 경험을 위한 통회 행위를 강조하여 궁극적으로 사죄와 영적 성장으로 이어진다.

en:
What is a one-sentence summary of the following article?
One of the first complaints presented to doctors by many people later diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease is an involuntary tremor or shaking of the hands, fingers, arms, legs, jaw, and face. You’re most likely to notice this tremor when your hands are at rest rather than when you’re using them, although you may see more tremors while your hands and arms are in use as the disease progresses.  There are many causes of tremors. Parkinson's Disease is one of the most common causes, and tremors are often the first sign of the disease. The tremor and other symptoms may initially appear only on one side of the body, or they may appear worse on one side than the other. A repetitive “pill-rolling" movement between the thumb and finger—named because it looks as though the person is rolling a pill between their fingers—is characteristic of a Parkinsonian tremor. Some symptoms of Parkinson's are caused by the larger symptom of slowed movements (also known as bradykinesia). This primarily affects motor functions from walking and balance to writing and even motor functions that are often considered reflexive or spontaneous.  These slowed movements are a very common early sign of Parkinson’s, and may show up at the onset of the disease in 80% of patients. Some people might have a hard time describing what they are feeling and use words like “weakness,” “tiredness,” or “incoordination” when talking about these symptoms. Look for distortions in voluntary movements. In addition to involuntary movements, those with Parkinson’s may experience disturbances in their voluntary movements beyond just slowness. Some of the treatments used for Parkinson's disease may cause abnormal involuntary movements, or an increase in movement, referred to as dyskinesia. These distortions (dyskinesias) can be similar to a “tic” in appearance and worsen with psychological stress. Advanced dyskinesia is most often seen in patients who have been on the medication Levodopa for some time. A common symptom of Parkinson’s is a shuffling gait with short steps and a tendency to lean forward. People with Parkinson's often have difficulty with their balance, and there is sometimes a tendency to fall forward, causing the person to walk faster and faster to keep from falling over. This pattern is called a "festinating gait," and it is very common in Parkinson's disease. This symptom typically shows up in the later stages of the disease. Those with Parkinson’s Disease often lean forward at the waist when standing or walking. This is because Parkinson's can cause posture and balance problems, including rigidity. There is a tendency to flex the arms and the head so that the person appears bent over with the elbows flexed and the head down.  Rigidity can affect the whole body, and might you feel stiff or sore. Check for postural rigidity. Also referred to as “cog-wheeling,” this symptom presents as a hallmark, rigid motion when an examiner moves the arm of a patient through basic flexion and extension motions. The rigidity and resistance to movement is most obvious with passive movement of the wrists and elbow. Cog-wheeling may happen when the increased muscle tone related to rigidity is combined with a tremor. Some cognitive impairment is common, but usually not until late in the course of the disease. Around 90% of those with PD will show signs of speech disturbances at some point. These can present as quieter speech, breathy or hoarse qualities to the voice, and reduced precision with language. The voice often becomes soft or whispery because the vocal muscles lack mobility. Up to 60% of those with PD may show signs or anxiety or depression. PD affects some of the mood-stabilizing portions of the brain, which leads to this increased chance for depression, especially paired with the quality of life for patients in late stages of the disease. The muscles used to push food through the digestive system are also affected by PD. This can lead to a variety of gastrointestinal issues from incontinence to constipation. These same symptoms often present along with difficulty swallowing food as well. Many of the involuntary movements associated with Parkinson’s make it increasingly difficult for those with the disease to get a full night of sleep. Other symptoms—such as muscle rigidity making it difficult to roll over at night or bladder issues leading to getting up at night to urinate frequently—compound the sleep disruptions experienced by those with PD.

google-ko:
다음 기사를 한 문장으로 요약하면 무엇입니까?
나중에 파킨슨병 진단을 받은 많은 사람들이 의사에게 제기하는 첫 번째 불만 사항 중 하나는 손, 손가락, 팔, 다리, 턱, 얼굴의 비자발적인 떨림 또는 떨림입니다. 질병이 진행됨에 따라 손과 팔을 사용하는 동안 더 많은 떨림이 나타날 수 있지만, 손을 사용할 때보다 손을 쉬고 있을 때 이 떨림을 느낄 가능성이 가장 높습니다. 떨림의 원인은 다양합니다. 파킨슨병은 가장 흔한 원인 중 하나이며 떨림은 종종 질병의 첫 징후입니다. 떨림 및 기타 증상은 처음에는 신체의 한쪽에만 나타날 수도 있고 한쪽에서 다른 쪽보다 더 심하게 나타날 수도 있습니다. 엄지손가락과 손가락 사이의 반복적인 "알약 굴리기" 움직임(손가락 사이에서 알약을 굴리는 것처럼 보인다고 해서 이름 붙여짐)은 파킨슨병 진전의 특징입니다. 파킨슨병의 일부 증상은 느린 움직임의 더 큰 증상으로 인해 발생합니다. 운동완서증(bradykinesia)이라고도 함. 이는 주로 걷기와 균형에서 쓰기에 이르기까지 운동 기능에 영향을 미치며 반사적이거나 자발적인 것으로 간주되는 운동 기능에도 영향을 미칩니다. 이러한 느린 움직임은 파킨슨병의 매우 흔한 초기 징후이며 파킨슨병이 시작될 때 나타날 수 있습니다. 환자의 80%가 이 질병을 앓고 있습니다. 어떤 사람들은 자신이 느끼는 감정을 설명하는 데 어려움을 겪고 이러한 증상에 대해 말할 때 "약함", "피곤함" 또는 "부조화"와 같은 단어를 사용하기도 합니다. 자발적인 움직임의 왜곡을 찾아보세요. 불수의 운동 외에도 파킨슨병 환자는 단순히 느린 속도를 넘어 자발적인 움직임에 장애를 경험할 수 있습니다. 파킨슨병에 사용되는 일부 치료법은 비정상적인 불수의 운동 또는 운동 증가를 유발할 수 있습니다. 이러한 왜곡(운동이상증)은 외관상 "틱"과 유사할 수 있으며 심리적 스트레스로 인해 악화될 수 있습니다. 진행성 운동이상증은 한동안 레보도파 약물을 복용한 환자에게서 가장 흔히 나타납니다. 파킨슨병의 흔한 증상은 걸음걸이가 짧고 앞으로 몸을 기울이는 경향이 있는 것입니다. 파킨슨병 환자는 균형을 잡는 데 어려움을 겪는 경우가 많으며 때로는 앞으로 넘어지는 경향이 있어 넘어지지 않도록 점점 더 빨리 걷는 경향이 있습니다. 이러한 패턴을 "축제적인 보행"이라고 하며 파킨슨병에서 매우 흔합니다. 이 증상은 일반적으로 질병의 후기 단계에 나타납니다. 파킨슨병 환자는 서거나 걸을 때 허리가 앞으로 굽는 경우가 많습니다. 이는 파킨슨병이 경직을 포함하여 자세와 균형 문제를 일으킬 수 있기 때문입니다. 팔과 머리를 구부리는 경향이 있어서 사람은 팔꿈치를 구부리고 머리를 아래로 한 채 몸을 굽힌 것처럼 보입니다. 경직은 몸 전체에 영향을 미칠 수 있으며, 뻣뻣하거나 아픈 느낌을 받을 수도 있습니다. 자세 강성을 확인하십시오. "톱니바퀴 회전"이라고도 하는 이 증상은 검사자가 기본적인 굴곡 및 확장 동작을 통해 환자의 팔을 움직일 때 특징적인 경직된 동작으로 나타납니다. 움직임에 대한 강성과 저항은 손목과 팔꿈치의 수동적 움직임에서 가장 분명하게 나타납니다. 톱니바퀴 현상은 경직과 관련된 근육긴장 증가와 떨림이 결합될 때 발생할 수 있습니다. 일부 인지 장애는 흔하지만 일반적으로 질병이 진행되는 후반기에야 발생합니다. PD 환자의 약 90%는 어느 시점에서 언어 장애의 징후를 보입니다. 이는 말이 더 조용해지고, 목소리가 숨이 막히거나 쉰 느낌이 들며, 언어의 정확성이 떨어지는 것으로 나타날 수 있습니다. 성대 근육의 이동성이 부족하기 때문에 목소리가 부드러워지거나 속삭이는 경우가 많습니다. PD 환자 중 최대 60%가 징후나 불안 또는 우울증을 나타낼 수 있습니다. PD는 뇌의 기분을 안정시키는 부분 중 일부에 영향을 미치며, 이는 특히 질병 말기 환자의 삶의 질과 함께 우울증 가능성을 증가시킵니다. 소화 시스템을 통해 음식을 밀어내는 데 사용되는 근육도 PD의 영향을 받습니다. 이로 인해 요실금부터 변비까지 다양한 위장 문제가 발생할 수 있습니다. 이와 같은 증상은 종종 음식을 삼키는 데 어려움을 겪으면서도 나타납니다. 파킨슨병과 관련된 많은 비자발적 움직임으로 인해 이 질병을 앓고 있는 사람들이 밤새도록 잠을 자는 것이 점점 더 어려워지고 있습니다. 근육 경직으로 인해 밤에 몸을 뒤집기가 어려워지거나 방광 문제로 인해 밤에 일어나서 소변을 자주 보는 등의 기타 증상은 PD 환자가 경험하는 수면 장애를 가중시킵니다.

google-en:
How would you summarize the following article in one sentence?
One of the first complaints many people who are later diagnosed with Parkinson's disease make to their doctor is involuntary tremors or tremors of the hands, fingers, arms, legs, jaw, and face. As the disease progresses, more tremors may occur while using the hands and arms, but you are most likely to feel these tremors when your hands are at rest rather than when you are using them. There are many causes of tremor. Parkinson's disease is one of the most common causes, and tremors are often the first sign of the disease. Tremors and other symptoms may initially appear on only one side of the body or may be worse on one side than the other. Repetitive “pill rolling” movements between the thumb and fingers (so named because they look like rolling a pill between the fingers) are a hallmark of Parkinson's disease tremor. Some symptoms of Parkinson's disease are caused by larger symptoms of slow movement. Also called bradykinesia. It mainly affects motor functions, from walking and balance to writing, but also affects motor functions that are considered reflex or voluntary. These slow movements are a very common early sign of Parkinson's disease and may appear at the onset of Parkinson's disease. 80% of patients suffer from this disease. Some people have difficulty describing how they feel and may use words such as "weakness," "tiredness" or "disharmony" when talking about these symptoms. Look for distortions in voluntary movements. In addition to involuntary movements, people with Parkinson's disease may experience impairments in voluntary movements that go beyond simply slowness. Some treatments used for Parkinson's disease may cause abnormal involuntary movements or increased movements. These distortions (dyskinesias) may resemble “tics” in appearance and may be worsened by psychological stress. Progressive dyskinesias most commonly occur in patients who have been taking the drug levodopa for some time. A common symptom of Parkinson's disease is a short gait and a tendency to lean forward. People with Parkinson's disease often have difficulty with balance and sometimes tend to fall forward, so they tend to walk faster and faster to avoid falling. This pattern is called a “festive gait” and is very common in Parkinson’s disease. This symptom usually appears in the later stages of the disease. Patients with Parkinson's disease often bend forward at the waist when standing or walking. This is because Parkinson's disease can cause posture and balance problems, including stiffness. There is a tendency to bend the arms and head, making the person appear hunched over with the elbows bent and the head down. Spasticity can affect your entire body and may make you feel stiff or sore. Check postural rigidity. This condition, also known as “cogwheeling,” manifests itself as a characteristic stiff motion as the examiner moves the patient's arm through basic flexion and extension movements. Stiffness and resistance to movement are most evident in passive movements of the wrist and elbow. Cogwheeling can occur when tremors combine with increased muscle tension associated with spasticity. Some cognitive impairments are common, but usually occur only late in the course of the disease. Approximately 90% of PD patients show signs of language impairment at some point. This may manifest itself as quieter speech, a breathy or hoarse feeling in the voice, and decreased accuracy of speech. Because the vocal cord muscles lack mobility, the voice is often soft or whispery. Up to 60% of people with PD may present with signs, anxiety, or depression. PD affects some of the mood-stabilizing parts of the brain, which increases the likelihood of depression along with quality of life, especially in patients in the later stages of the disease. The muscles used to push food through the digestive system are also affected by PD. This can cause a variety of gastrointestinal problems, from urinary incontinence to constipation. These symptoms are often accompanied by difficulty swallowing food. The many involuntary movements associated with Parkinson's disease make it increasingly difficult for people with the disease to sleep through the night. Other symptoms, such as difficulty turning over at night due to muscle stiffness or having bladder problems that require waking up at night to urinate frequently, add to the sleep difficulties experienced by people with PD.

en:
What is a one-sentence summary of the following article?
One of the first complaints presented to doctors by many people later diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease is an involuntary tremor or shaking of the hands, fingers, arms, legs, jaw, and face. You’re most likely to notice this tremor when your hands are at rest rather than when you’re using them, although you may see more tremors while your hands and arms are in use as the disease progresses.  There are many causes of tremors. Parkinson's Disease is one of the most common causes, and tremors are often the first sign of the disease. The tremor and other symptoms may initially appear only on one side of the body, or they may appear worse on one side than the other. A repetitive “pill-rolling" movement between the thumb and finger—named because it looks as though the person is rolling a pill between their fingers—is characteristic of a Parkinsonian tremor. Some symptoms of Parkinson's are caused by the larger symptom of slowed movements (also known as bradykinesia). This primarily affects motor functions from walking and balance to writing and even motor functions that are often considered reflexive or spontaneous.  These slowed movements are a very common early sign of Parkinson’s, and may show up at the onset of the disease in 80% of patients. Some people might have a hard time describing what they are feeling and use words like “weakness,” “tiredness,” or “incoordination” when talking about these symptoms. Look for distortions in voluntary movements. In addition to involuntary movements, those with Parkinson’s may experience disturbances in their voluntary movements beyond just slowness. Some of the treatments used for Parkinson's disease may cause abnormal involuntary movements, or an increase in movement, referred to as dyskinesia. These distortions (dyskinesias) can be similar to a “tic” in appearance and worsen with psychological stress. Advanced dyskinesia is most often seen in patients who have been on the medication Levodopa for some time. A common symptom of Parkinson’s is a shuffling gait with short steps and a tendency to lean forward. People with Parkinson's often have difficulty with their balance, and there is sometimes a tendency to fall forward, causing the person to walk faster and faster to keep from falling over. This pattern is called a "festinating gait," and it is very common in Parkinson's disease. This symptom typically shows up in the later stages of the disease. Those with Parkinson’s Disease often lean forward at the waist when standing or walking. This is because Parkinson's can cause posture and balance problems, including rigidity. There is a tendency to flex the arms and the head so that the person appears bent over with the elbows flexed and the head down.  Rigidity can affect the whole body, and might you feel stiff or sore. Check for postural rigidity. Also referred to as “cog-wheeling,” this symptom presents as a hallmark, rigid motion when an examiner moves the arm of a patient through basic flexion and extension motions. The rigidity and resistance to movement is most obvious with passive movement of the wrists and elbow. Cog-wheeling may happen when the increased muscle tone related to rigidity is combined with a tremor. Some cognitive impairment is common, but usually not until late in the course of the disease. Around 90% of those with PD will show signs of speech disturbances at some point. These can present as quieter speech, breathy or hoarse qualities to the voice, and reduced precision with language. The voice often becomes soft or whispery because the vocal muscles lack mobility. Up to 60% of those with PD may show signs or anxiety or depression. PD affects some of the mood-stabilizing portions of the brain, which leads to this increased chance for depression, especially paired with the quality of life for patients in late stages of the disease. The muscles used to push food through the digestive system are also affected by PD. This can lead to a variety of gastrointestinal issues from incontinence to constipation. These same symptoms often present along with difficulty swallowing food as well. Many of the involuntary movements associated with Parkinson’s make it increasingly difficult for those with the disease to get a full night of sleep. Other symptoms—such as muscle rigidity making it difficult to roll over at night or bladder issues leading to getting up at night to urinate frequently—compound the sleep disruptions experienced by those with PD.

Summary:
Involuntary tremors, slowed movements, and posture and balance issues are common early symptoms of Parkinson's Disease, often accompanied by disturbances in voluntary movements, speech, mood, and gastrointestinal issues as the disease progresses.

PD는 뇌의 기분을 안정시키는 부분 중 일부에 영향을 미치며, 이는 특히 질병 말기 환자의 삶의 질과 함께 우울증 가능성을 증가시킵니다. 소화 시스템을 통해 음식을 밀어내는 데 사용되는 근육도 PD의 영향을 받습니다. 이로 인해 요실금부터 변비까지 다양한 위장 문제가 발생할 수 있습니다. 이와 같은 증상은 종종 음식을 삼키는 데 어려움을 겪으면서도 나타납니다. 파킨슨병과 관련된 많은 비자발적 움직임으로 인해 이 질병을 앓고 있는 사람들이 밤새도록 잠을 자는 것이 점점 더 어려워지고 있습니다. 근육 경직으로 인해 밤에 몸을 뒤집기가 어려워지거나 방광 문제로 인해 밤에 일어나서 소변을 자주 보는 등의 기타 증상은 PD 환자가 경험하는 수면 장애를 가중시킵니다.

요약:
비자발적인 떨림, 느린 움직임, 자세 및 균형 문제는 파킨슨병의 일반적인 초기 증상이며, 종종 질병이 진행됨에 따라 자발적인 움직임, 언어, 기분 및 위장 문제의 장애를 동반합니다.
google-en:
How would you summarize the following article in one sentence?
One of the first complaints many people who are later diagnosed with Parkinson's disease make to their doctor is involuntary tremors or tremors of the hands, fingers, arms, legs, jaw, and face. As the disease progresses, more tremors may occur while using the hands and arms, but you are most likely to feel these tremors when your hands are at rest rather than when you are using them. There are many causes of tremor. Parkinson's disease is one of the most common causes, and tremors are often the first sign of the disease. Tremors and other symptoms may initially appear on only one side of the body or may be worse on one side than the other. Repetitive “pill rolling” movements between the thumb and fingers (so named because they look like rolling a pill between the fingers) are a hallmark of Parkinson's disease tremor. Some symptoms of Parkinson's disease are caused by larger symptoms of slow movement. Also called bradykinesia. It mainly affects motor functions, from walking and balance to writing, but also affects motor functions that are considered reflex or voluntary. These slow movements are a very common early sign of Parkinson's disease and may appear at the onset of Parkinson's disease. 80% of patients suffer from this disease. Some people have difficulty describing how they feel and may use words such as "weakness," "tiredness" or "disharmony" when talking about these symptoms. Look for distortions in voluntary movements. In addition to involuntary movements, people with Parkinson's disease may experience impairments in voluntary movements that go beyond simply slowness. Some treatments used for Parkinson's disease may cause abnormal involuntary movements or increased movements. These distortions (dyskinesias) may resemble “tics” in appearance and may be worsened by psychological stress. Progressive dyskinesias most commonly occur in patients who have been taking the drug levodopa for some time. A common symptom of Parkinson's disease is a short gait and a tendency to lean forward. People with Parkinson's disease often have difficulty with balance and sometimes tend to fall forward, so they tend to walk faster and faster to avoid falling. This pattern is called a “festive gait” and is very common in Parkinson’s disease. This symptom usually appears in the later stages of the disease. Patients with Parkinson's disease often bend forward at the waist when standing or walking. This is because Parkinson's disease can cause posture and balance problems, including stiffness. There is a tendency to bend the arms and head, making the person appear hunched over with the elbows bent and the head down. Spasticity can affect your entire body and may make you feel stiff or sore. Check postural rigidity. This condition, also known as “cogwheeling,” manifests itself as a characteristic stiff motion as the examiner moves the patient's arm through basic flexion and extension movements. Stiffness and resistance to movement are most evident in passive movements of the wrist and elbow. Cogwheeling can occur when tremors combine with increased muscle tension associated with spasticity. Some cognitive impairments are common, but usually occur only late in the course of the disease. Approximately 90% of PD patients show signs of language impairment at some point. This may manifest itself as quieter speech, a breathy or hoarse feeling in the voice, and decreased accuracy of speech. Because the vocal cord muscles lack mobility, the voice is often soft or whispery. Up to 60% of people with PD may present with signs, anxiety, or depression. PD affects some of the mood-stabilizing parts of the brain, which increases the likelihood of depression along with quality of life, especially in patients in the later stages of the disease. The muscles used to push food through the digestive system are also affected by PD. This can cause a variety of gastrointestinal problems, from urinary incontinence to constipation. These symptoms are often accompanied by difficulty swallowing food. The many involuntary movements associated with Parkinson's disease make it increasingly difficult for people with the disease to sleep through the night. Other symptoms, such as difficulty turning over at night due to muscle stiffness or having bladder problems that require waking up at night to urinate frequently, add to the sleep difficulties experienced by people with PD.

summary:
Involuntary tremors, slow movements, and problems with posture and balance are common early symptoms of Parkinson's disease, often accompanied by disturbances in voluntary movement, speech, mood, and gastrointestinal problems as the disease progresses.

en:
Write an article based on this summary:

– After a thief walked out of a New York gallery with a Salvador Dali drawing only to later return it by mail, observers were scratching their heads—but now they have an explanation, via prosecutors. Authorities arrested Greek fashion publicist Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou, 29, in the case; he has pleaded not guilty, the Wall Street Journal reports. The back story: At the gallery, Istavrioglou realized the $150,000 drawing was unprotected and removed it, taking it with him back to Athens, prosecutors say. Once he arrived, prosecutors say he had second thoughts. "When he realized the hunt was on, the defendant blinked" and sent it back, rolling it up "in a manner befitting a college dorm-room poster." Among the evidence detectives are said to have uncovered in the case: Istavriglou's fingerprint on the mailing tube, relevant Web searches made from his Google account before the story broke, and a photo of the drawing in the gallery that he posted to his Facebook page. Istavrioglou was caught after an undercover cop posed as a New York art gallery manager and offered him a job, returning him to the Big Apple. He's due back in court today, the New York Times notes.
Title: An Unlikely Heist: The Tale of Salvador Dali Art Theft and its Intriguing Resolution

After a thief casually strolled into a New York gallery, walked out with a Salvador Dali drawing, and then promptly returned the stolen art via mail, numerous observers were left puzzled. However, an explanation has emerged through the justice system. Authorities recently arrested Greek fashion publicist Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou, 29, in connection with the theft. Istavrioglou pleaded not guilty.

The backstory of this unusual crime starts at the New York gallery, where Istavrioglou noticed that a $150,000 Salvador Dali drawing was not properly protected. He seized the opportunity and took the drawing. He transported the artwork from New York City, to Athens, Greece, where he resides. However, upon arriving in Athens, Istavrioglou experienced a change of heart. In fear of being caught, prosecutors say Istavrioglou decided to return the precious art piece.

"When he realized the hunt was on, the defendant blinked," the prosecutor stated. In a hasty move to avoid any ramifications, Istavrioglou rolled up the Salvador Dali drawing and sent it back to the gallery. His method of rolling can be best described as "a manner befitting a college dorm-room poster," reflecting a naive approach rather than a heist expert's precision.

Detectives have managed to uncover several pieces of evidence that point to Istavrioglou's involvement in the peculiar crime. Among these pieces of evidence is his fingerprint found on the mailing tube used to return the drawing. Additional information implicating Istavrioglou includes relevant web searches made on his Google account in the period leading up to the story breaking. Furthermore, a picture of the drawing, as it hung in the gallery, was featured on Istavrioglou's Facebook profile.

The Greek fashion publicist was apprehended in New York City, following communication with an undercover cop who posed as an art gallery manager. The undercover officer lured Istavrioglou back to the Big Apple by offering him a lucrative job opportunity. Once in New York, officers closed in and arrested him without incident. Istavrioglou appeared in court soon after and pleaded not guilty.

Now that the Salvador Dali drawing has been safely returned, the consequences faced by Istavrioglou remain uncertain. As a high-profile suspect in an art theft turned intriguing global case, the enigmatic nature of the criminal act and its intriguing resolution will leave many captivated and puzzled in the world of art galleries and beyond. This unusual case serves as a testament to the unpredictability of human nature, coupled with the ability for even the unlikeliest of individuals to become involved in an art heist.

– 도둑이 살바도르 달리의 그림을 들고 뉴욕 갤러리에서 나갔다가 나중에 그것을 우편으로 돌려준 후, 관찰자들은 머리를 긁적였지만 이제는 검찰을 통해 설명을 듣게 되었습니다. 당국은 이 사건에서 그리스 패션 홍보인 Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou(29세)를 체포했습니다. 그는 무죄를 주장했다고 ​​월스트리트 저널이 보도했다. 뒷이야기: 갤러리에서 Istavrioglou는 150,000달러짜리 그림이 보호되지 않았음을 깨닫고 그것을 제거하여 아테네로 가져갔다고 검찰은 말했습니다. 그가 도착하자 검찰은 그가 생각이 바뀌었다고 말했습니다. "사냥이 시작되었음을 알았을 때 피고인은 눈을 깜박이고" "대학 기숙사 포스터에 걸맞는 방식으로" 말아서 돌려보냈습니다. 이 사건에서 수사관들이 발견한 증거 중에는 메일링 튜브에 있는 Istavriglou의 지문, 이야기가 터지기 전에 그의 Google 계정에서 수행한 관련 웹 검색, 그가 자신의 Facebook 페이지에 게시한 갤러리의 그림 사진 등이 있습니다. Istavrioglou는 잠복 경찰이 뉴욕 미술관 매니저로 행세하고 그에게 일자리를 제안한 후 체포되어 그를 뉴욕으로 돌려보냈습니다. 뉴욕타임즈는 그가 오늘 법정에 다시 출석할 예정이라고 전했다.
제목: 있을 법하지 않은 강도: 살바도르 달리 미술품 절도 이야기와 흥미로운 해결 방법

도둑이 우연히 뉴욕 갤러리에 들어와 살바도르 달리의 그림을 들고 나갔다가 훔친 미술품을 우편으로 즉시 돌려준 후, 많은 관찰자들은 어리둥절해했습니다. 그러나 사법제도를 통해 설명이 나왔다. 당국은 최근 절도 혐의로 그리스 패션 홍보인 Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou(29세)를 체포했습니다. Istavrioglou는 무죄를 주장했습니다.

이 특이한 범죄의 뒷이야기는 뉴욕 갤러리에서 시작됩니다. 그곳에서 Istavrioglou는 150,000달러짜리 Salvador Dali 그림이 제대로 보호되지 않았음을 발견했습니다. 그는 기회를 포착하고 그림을 그렸습니다. 그는 뉴욕에서 자신이 거주하는 그리스 아테네로 작품을 운반했습니다. 하지만 아테네에 도착하자마자 Istavrioglou는 마음의 변화를 경험했습니다. 검찰은 체포될 것을 두려워하여 Istavrioglou가 귀중한 예술 작품을 반환하기로 결정했다고 말했습니다.

검찰은 "피고인은 사냥이 시작됐다는 사실을 깨닫고 눈을 깜박였다"고 말했다. Istavrioglou는 어떤 결과도 피하기 위해 서둘러 살바도르 달리 그림을 말아 갤러리로 다시 보냈습니다. 그의 롤링 방법은 강도 전문가의 정확성보다는 순진한 접근 방식을 반영하는 "대학 기숙사 포스터에 어울리는 방식"으로 가장 잘 설명 될 수 있습니다.

형사들은 Istavrioglou가 특이한 범죄에 연루되었음을 가리키는 몇 가지 증거를 찾아냈습니다. 이러한 증거 중에는 그림을 반환하는 데 사용된 우편물 튜브에서 발견된 그의 지문이 있습니다. Istavrioglou와 관련된 추가 정보에는 기사가 나오기 전까지 그의 Google 계정에서 수행된 관련 웹 검색이 포함됩니다. 게다가 갤러리에 걸린 그림 사진이 Istavrioglou의 Facebook 프로필에 게재되었습니다.

그리스의 패션 홍보 담당자는 미술관 매니저로 위장한 잠복 경찰과 연락을 취한 뒤 뉴욕에서 체포됐다. 잠복 경찰관은 수익성이 좋은 직업 기회를 제공하여 Istavrioglou를 뉴욕으로 다시 유인했습니다. 한번은 뉴욕에 도착했을 때 경찰이 문을 닫아 무사히 그를 체포했습니다. Istavrioglou는 곧 법정에 출두하여 무죄를 주장했습니다.

이제 살바도르 달리의 그림이 안전하게 반환되었으므로 Istavrioglou가 직면한 결과는 여전히 불확실합니다. 미술품 절도 사건의 세간의 이목을 끄는 용의자가 전 세계적인 흥미로운 사건으로 변하면서, 범죄 행위의 불가사의한 성격과 흥미로운 해결 방법은 미술관과 그 너머의 세계에서 많은 사람들을 매료시키고 어리둥절하게 만들 것입니다. 이 특이한 사례는 인간 본성의 예측 불가능성과 전혀 예상치 못한 개인도 미술품 강탈에 연루될 수 있다는 사실을 입증하는 역할을 합니다.

Title: An Unlikely Heist: The Story of the Salvador Dali Art Theft and the Interesting Solution

Many observers were left bewildered after a thief accidentally walked into a New York gallery, walked out with a Salvador Dali painting, and promptly returned the stolen art by mail. However, an explanation was provided through the judicial system. Authorities recently arrested Greek fashion publicist Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou, 29, on suspicion of theft. Istavrioglou has pleaded not guilty.

The story behind this unusual crime begins in a New York gallery. There, Istavrioglou discovered that a $150,000 Salvador Dali painting was not properly protected. He seized the opportunity and painted. He transported his work from New York to Athens, Greece, where he resides. But as soon as he arrived in Athens, Istavrioglou experienced a change of heart. Prosecutors said that fearing arrest, Istavrioglou decided to return his priceless works of art.

“The defendant blinked his eyes as he realized the hunt had begun,” the prosecutor said. To avoid any consequences, Istavrioglou hastily rolled up the Salvador Dali painting and sent it back to the gallery. His rolling method can best be described as "a way worthy of a college dorm poster," reflecting the naive approach rather than the precision of a heist expert.

Detectives uncovered several pieces of evidence pointing to Istavrioglou's involvement in the unusual crime. Among this evidence were his fingerprints found on the mail tube used to return the painting. Additional information related to Istavrioglou includes relevant web searches conducted on his Google account leading up to the publication of the article. Additionally, a photo of the painting hanging in the gallery was posted on Istavrioglou's Facebook profile.

A Greek fashion publicist was arrested in New York after being contacted by an undercover police officer posing as an art gallery manager. The undercover police officer lured Istavrioglou back to New York by offering him a lucrative job opportunity. He once arrived in New York and the police arrested him without incident after closing the gates. Istavrioglou soon appeared in court and pleaded not guilty.

Now that Salvador Dali's painting has been safely returned, the consequences facing Istavrioglou remain uncertain. As the high-profile suspect in the art theft turns into a case of global interest, the mysterious nature of the crime and its intriguing solution will fascinate and puzzle many in the museum and beyond. This unusual case serves to demonstrate the unpredictability of human nature and the fact that even the most unexpected individuals can become involved in art theft.

News article:

Amy Winehouse has finally released a new single: A cover of Lesley Gore's 1963 hit "It's My Party" for the Quincy Jones tribute album Q: Soul Bossa Nostra. Our expectations for Amy's upcoming album of "jukebox stuff" have been raised. ||||| When it was announced that the first bit of music the world would hear from Amy Winehouse after all that tabloid trouble would be a cover of Lesley Gore's "It's My Party” for a Quincy Jones tribute album, Vulture found it just a touch uninspiring. But now the cover is actually here, and it's tough not to get carried away. Winehouse lets it fly on the Mark Ronson–produced do-over — turning in a dialed-in, muscular vocal performance that moves effortlessly from louche to anguished — and sounds not even a tiny bit horribly addicted to drugs while doing so. No word on an official Back to Black follow-up or anything, of course, but there is one other potentially positive sign: Winehouse has gone from tweeting stuff like “ronson you're dead to me; one album i write an you take half the credit — make a career out of it? don't think so BRUV” to things like “can't find me bleedin notebooks — theyve done a runsies xxxxxxxx LOVE YOU RONSON XXXXXXxxxxxxxxx.” ||||| Image Credit: Samir Hussein/Getty ImagesIf there’s something we know our beloved little wayward beehive enjoys, it’s a good party. And apparently, this one ends in tears. 
  
 The 27-year-old Grammy winner returned to the studio recently for the star-strewn Quincy Jones release Q: Soul Bossa Nostra, due November 9, with her Back to Black producer (and recent subject of a Wino tweet-spanking) Mark Ronson. 
  
 You can hear their recording of Lesley Gore’s 1963 teenage cri de coeur “It’s My Party” 
  
 over at NYmag.com (via Soundcloud). The RonHouse pairing proves as Spector-esquely fruitful as ever—though frankly, whether the reasons are stylistic or substance-related, Amy’s penchant for slurring her vocals yields something closer to “Ish My Parrry.” 
  
 What do you think? Tell us in the comments section below. 
  
 (Follow The Music Mix on Twitter: @EWMusicMix.) 
  
 More on Amy Winehouse: 
  
 Amy Winehouse to Mark Ronson: ‘You’re dead to me’ 
  
 Amy Winehouse to sing ‘It’s My Party’ for Quincy Jones |||||  
  
 In April we reported that Amy Winehouse and Mark Ronson were working together again, on three tracks for a Quincy Jones tribute album. Well, this is apparently a leaked version of one of their tracks, a cover of It's My Party (Jones's first big hit when he produced the Lesley Gore original in 1963). 
  
 It's not – how can we say this? – the most coherent vocal ever laid to tape, although if there's ever a song where you can let it all go a bit runny-mascara-and-10-Bacardi-Breezers then this is it. Having said that, if you really wanted to hear the original sung in this style you could just stagger into any random hen night at 3am, right? |||||
What is a shorter version of the above article?

 27세의 그래미상 우승자는 최근 11월 9일 출시 예정인 스타 퀸시 존스(Quincy Jones)의 Q: Soul Bossa Nostra 출시를 위해 스튜디오로 돌아왔습니다. 그녀의 Back to Black 프로듀서(그리고 최근 Wino 트윗 스팽킹의 주제) Mark Ronson과 함께 말이죠. .
  
 Lesley Gore의 1963년 10대 크리 드 쿠르 "It's My Party" 녹음을 들을 수 있습니다.
  
 NYmag.com(Soundcloud를 통해)을 방문하세요. RonHouse 페어링은 그 어느 때보다 Spector와 같은 결실을 맺는 것으로 입증되었습니다. 솔직히 그 이유가 문체적이든 물질적이든 관계없이 Amy의 보컬을 불명료하게 처리하는 경향은 "Ish My Parrry"에 더 가까운 것을 만들어냅니다.
  
 어떻게 생각하나요? 아래 댓글 섹션에서 알려주십시오.
  
 (트위터에서 The Music Mix를 팔로우하세요: @EWMusicMix.)
  
 에이미 와인하우스에 대한 추가 정보:
  
 에이미 와인하우스가 마크 론슨에게 '당신은 나에게 죽은 사람입니다'
  
 에이미 와인하우스가 퀸시 존스를 위해 'It's My Party'를 부를 예정 |||||
  
 4월에 우리는 Amy Winehouse와 Mark Ronson이 Quincy Jones 추모 앨범의 3개 트랙을 다시 함께 작업한다고 보도했습니다. 음, 이것은 명백히 그들의 트랙 중 하나인 It's My Party의 커버 버전입니다(Jones가 1963년 Lesley Gore 원본을 프로듀스했을 때 첫 번째 빅 히트).
  
 그렇지 않습니다. 어떻게 이것을 말할 수 있습니까? – 지금까지 테이프에 녹음된 것 중 가장 일관적인 보컬이지만, 약간 콧물이 흐르는 마스카라와 10개의 바카디 브리저를 가미할 수 있는 노래가 있다면 이것이 바로 그것입니다. 그렇긴 하지만, 정말로 이 스타일로 부른 원곡을 듣고 싶다면 그냥 비틀거리며 새벽 3시에 아무데나 가서 암탉의 밤을 보내면 됩니다. 그렇죠? |||||
위 기사의 단축 버전은 무엇입니까?

en:
Title: An Unlikely Heist: The Tale of Salvador Dali Art Theft and its Intriguing Resolution

After a thief casually strolled into a New York gallery, walked out with a Salvador Dali drawing, and then promptly returned the stolen art via mail, numerous observers were left puzzled. However, an explanation has emerged through the justice system. Authorities recently arrested Greek fashion publicist Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou, 29, in connection with the theft. Istavrioglou pleaded not guilty.

The backstory of this unusual crime starts at the New York gallery, where Istavrioglou noticed that a $150,000 Salvador Dali drawing was not properly protected. He seized the opportunity and took the drawing. He transported the artwork from New York City, to Athens, Greece, where he resides. However, upon arriving in Athens, Istavrioglou experienced a change of heart. In fear of being caught, prosecutors say Istavrioglou decided to return the precious art piece.

"When he realized the hunt was on, the defendant blinked," the prosecutor stated. In a hasty move to avoid any ramifications, Istavrioglou rolled up the Salvador Dali drawing and sent it back to the gallery. His method of rolling can be best described as "a manner befitting a college dorm-room poster," reflecting a naive approach rather than a heist expert's precision.

Detectives have managed to uncover several pieces of evidence that point to Istavrioglou's involvement in the peculiar crime. Among these pieces of evidence is his fingerprint found on the mailing tube used to return the drawing. Additional information implicating Istavrioglou includes relevant web searches made on his Google account in the period leading up to the story breaking. Furthermore, a picture of the drawing, as it hung in the gallery, was featured on Istavrioglou's Facebook profile.

The Greek fashion publicist was apprehended in New York City, following communication with an undercover cop who posed as an art gallery manager. The undercover officer lured Istavrioglou back to the Big Apple by offering him a lucrative job opportunity. Once in New York, officers closed in and arrested him without incident. Istavrioglou appeared in court soon after and pleaded not guilty.

Now that the Salvador Dali drawing has been safely returned, the consequences faced by Istavrioglou remain uncertain. As a high-profile suspect in an art theft turned intriguing global case, the enigmatic nature of the criminal act and its intriguing resolution will leave many captivated and puzzled in the world of art galleries and beyond. This unusual case serves as a testament to the unpredictability of human nature, coupled with the ability for even the unlikeliest of individuals to become involved in an art heist.

형사들은 Istavrioglou가 특이한 범죄에 연루되었음을 가리키는 몇 가지 증거를 찾아냈습니다. 이러한 증거 중에는 그림을 반환하는 데 사용된 우편물 튜브에서 발견된 그의 지문이 있습니다. Istavrioglou와 관련된 추가 정보에는 기사가 나오기 전까지 그의 Google 계정에서 수행된 관련 웹 검색이 포함됩니다. 게다가 갤러리에 걸린 그림 사진이 Istavrioglou의 Facebook 프로필에 게재되었습니다.

그리스의 패션 홍보 담당자는 미술관 매니저로 위장한 잠복 경찰과 연락을 취한 뒤 뉴욕에서 체포됐다. 잠복 경찰관은 수익성이 좋은 직업 기회를 제공하여 Istavrioglou를 뉴욕으로 다시 유인했습니다. 한번은 뉴욕에 도착했을 때 경찰이 문을 닫아 무사히 그를 체포했습니다. Istavrioglou는 곧 법정에 출두하여 무죄를 주장했습니다.

이제 살바도르 달리의 그림이 안전하게 반환되었으므로 Istavrioglou가 직면한 결과는 여전히 불확실합니다. 미술품 절도 사건의 세간의 이목을 끄는 용의자가 전 세계적인 흥미로운 사건으로 변하면서, 범죄 행위의 불가사의한 성격과 흥미로운 해결 방법은 미술관과 그 너머의 세계에서 많은 사람들을 매료시키고 어리둥절하게 만들 것입니다. 이 특이한 사례는 인간 본성의 예측 불가능성과 전혀 예상치 못한 개인도 미술품 강탈에 연루될 수 있다는 사실을 입증하는 역할을 합니다.

Title: An Unlikely Heist: The Story of the Salvador Dali Art Theft and the Interesting Solution

Many observers were left bewildered after a thief accidentally walked into a New York gallery, walked out with a Salvador Dali painting, and promptly returned the stolen art by mail. However, an explanation was provided through the judicial system. Authorities recently arrested Greek fashion publicist Phivos Lampros Istavrioglou, 29, on suspicion of theft. Istavrioglou has pleaded not guilty.

The story behind this unusual crime begins in a New York gallery. There, Istavrioglou discovered that a $150,000 Salvador Dali painting was not properly protected. He seized the opportunity and painted. He transported his work from New York to Athens, Greece, where he resides. But as soon as he arrived in Athens, Istavrioglou experienced a change of heart. Prosecutors said that fearing arrest, Istavrioglou decided to return the priceless works of art.

“The defendant blinked when he realized the hunt had begun,” the prosecutor said. To avoid any consequences, Istavrioglou hastily rolled up the Salvador Dali painting and sent it back to the gallery. His rolling method can best be described as "a way worthy of a college dorm poster," reflecting the naive approach rather than the precision of a heist expert.

Detectives uncovered several pieces of evidence pointing to Istavrioglou's involvement in the unusual crime. Among this evidence were his fingerprints found on the mail tube used to return the painting. Additional information related to Istavrioglou includes relevant web searches conducted on his Google account leading up to the publication of the article. Additionally, a photo of the painting hanging in the gallery was posted on Istavrioglou's Facebook profile.

A Greek fashion publicist was arrested in New York after being contacted by an undercover police officer posing as an art gallery manager. The undercover police officer lured Istavrioglou back to New York by offering him a lucrative job opportunity. He once arrived in New York and the police arrested him without incident after closing the gates. Istavrioglou soon appeared in court and pleaded not guilty.

Now that Salvador Dali's painting has been safely returned, the consequences facing Istavrioglou remain uncertain. As the high-profile suspect in the art theft turns into a case of global interest, the mysterious nature of the crime and its intriguing solution will fascinate and puzzle many in the museum and beyond. This unusual case serves to demonstrate the unpredictability of human nature and the fact that even the most unexpected individuals can become involved in art theft.

en:
News article:

Amy Winehouse has finally released a new single: A cover of Lesley Gore's 1963 hit "It's My Party" for the Quincy Jones tribute album Q: Soul Bossa Nostra. Our expectations for Amy's upcoming album of "jukebox stuff" have been raised. ||||| When it was announced that the first bit of music the world would hear from Amy Winehouse after all that tabloid trouble would be a cover of Lesley Gore's "It's My Party” for a Quincy Jones tribute album, Vulture found it just a touch uninspiring. But now the cover is actually here, and it's tough not to get carried away. Winehouse lets it fly on the Mark Ronson–produced do-over — turning in a dialed-in, muscular vocal performance that moves effortlessly from louche to anguished — and sounds not even a tiny bit horribly addicted to drugs while doing so. No word on an official Back to Black follow-up or anything, of course, but there is one other potentially positive sign: Winehouse has gone from tweeting stuff like “ronson you're dead to me; one album i write an you take half the credit — make a career out of it? don't think so BRUV” to things like “can't find me bleedin notebooks — theyve done a runsies xxxxxxxx LOVE YOU RONSON XXXXXXxxxxxxxxx.” ||||| Image Credit: Samir Hussein/Getty ImagesIf there’s something we know our beloved little wayward beehive enjoys, it’s a good party. And apparently, this one ends in tears. 
  
 The 27-year-old Grammy winner returned to the studio recently for the star-strewn Quincy Jones release Q: Soul Bossa Nostra, due November 9, with her Back to Black producer (and recent subject of a Wino tweet-spanking) Mark Ronson. 
  
 You can hear their recording of Lesley Gore’s 1963 teenage cri de coeur “It’s My Party” 
  
 over at NYmag.com (via Soundcloud). The RonHouse pairing proves as Spector-esquely fruitful as ever—though frankly, whether the reasons are stylistic or substance-related, Amy’s penchant for slurring her vocals yields something closer to “Ish My Parrry.” 
  
 What do you think? Tell us in the comments section below. 
  
 (Follow The Music Mix on Twitter: @EWMusicMix.) 
  
 More on Amy Winehouse: 
  
 Amy Winehouse to Mark Ronson: ‘You’re dead to me’ 
  
 Amy Winehouse to sing ‘It’s My Party’ for Quincy Jones |||||  
  
 In April we reported that Amy Winehouse and Mark Ronson were working together again, on three tracks for a Quincy Jones tribute album. Well, this is apparently a leaked version of one of their tracks, a cover of It's My Party (Jones's first big hit when he produced the Lesley Gore original in 1963). 
  
 It's not – how can we say this? – the most coherent vocal ever laid to tape, although if there's ever a song where you can let it all go a bit runny-mascara-and-10-Bacardi-Breezers then this is it. Having said that, if you really wanted to hear the original sung in this style you could just stagger into any random hen night at 3am, right? |||||
What is a shorter version of the above article?
Amy Winehouse, a famous singer, has released a new song called "It's My Party." This song is her version of an older song from 1963 by Lesley Gore. She worked with another music person, Mark Ronson, to make this. People are excited to hear more new music from Amy Winehouse after she had some trouble in her life.

뉴스 기사:

Amy Winehouse가 마침내 새로운 싱글을 발표했습니다. Quincy Jones 추모 앨범 Q: Soul Bossa Nostra의 Lesley Gore의 1963년 히트곡 "It's My Party" 커버입니다. 에이미의 '주크박스 스터프' 앨범에 대한 기대감이 더욱 높아졌다. ||||| 그 모든 타블로이드 문제 이후 세계가 Amy Winehouse의 첫 번째 음악을 듣게 될 음악은 Lesley Gore의 "It's My Party"를 Quincy Jones 헌정 앨범으로 리메이크하는 것이라고 발표했을 때 Vulture는 그 음악이 별로 영감을 주지 못했다고 생각했습니다. 이제 커버가 실제로 여기에 있으며, 흥분하지 않는 것이 어렵습니다. Winehouse는 Mark Ronson이 프로듀스한 do-over를 통해 날아갈 수 있게 합니다. 물론 그렇게 하는 동안 끔찍하게 마약에 중독되지도 않았습니다. 물론 공식적인 Back to Black 후속 조치에 대해서는 아무런 언급도 없지만 잠재적으로 긍정적인 신호가 하나 더 있습니다. Winehouse는 "ronson you"와 같은 트윗을 중단했습니다. 나한테는 죽었어. 내가 쓴 앨범 하나를 너가 절반만 가져갔어 — 그것으로 경력을 쌓았어? 그렇게 생각하지 마, "내가 노트북에 피를 흘리는 걸 찾을 수 없어 — 그들은 런을 xxxxxxxx 했어 론슨 사랑해" XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.” ||||| 이미지 제공: Samir Hussein/Getty Images 우리의 사랑하는 작고 고집 센 벌집이 즐기는 것이 있다면 그것은 좋은 파티입니다. 그리고 분명히 이 파티는 눈물로 끝납니다.
  
 27세의 그래미상 우승자는 최근 11월 9일 출시 예정인 스타 퀸시 존스(Quincy Jones)의 Q: Soul Bossa Nostra 출시를 위해 스튜디오로 돌아왔습니다. 그녀의 Back to Black 프로듀서(그리고 최근 Wino 트윗 스팽킹의 주제) Mark Ronson과 함께 말이죠. .
  
 Lesley Gore의 1963년 10대 크리 드 쿠르 "It's My Party" 녹음을 들을 수 있습니다.
  
 NYmag.com(Soundcloud를 통해)을 방문하세요. RonHouse 페어링은 그 어느 때보다 Spector와 같은 결실을 맺는 것으로 입증되었습니다. 솔직히 그 이유가 문체적이든 물질적이든 관계없이 Amy의 보컬을 불명료하게 처리하는 경향은 "Ish My Parrry"에 더 가까운 것을 만들어냅니다.
  
 어떻게 생각하나요? 아래 댓글 섹션에서 알려주십시오.
  
 (트위터에서 The Music Mix를 팔로우하세요: @EWMusicMix.)
  
 에이미 와인하우스에 대한 추가 정보:
  
 에이미 와인하우스가 마크 론슨에게 '당신은 나에게 죽은 사람입니다'
  
 에이미 와인하우스가 퀸시 존스를 위해 'It's My Party'를 부를 예정 |||||
  
 4월에 우리는 Amy Winehouse와 Mark Ronson이 Quincy Jones 추모 앨범의 3개 트랙을 다시 함께 작업한다고 보도했습니다. 음, 이것은 명백히 그들의 트랙 중 하나인 It's My Party의 커버 버전입니다(Jones가 1963년 Lesley Gore 원본을 프로듀스했을 때 첫 번째 빅 히트).
  
 그렇지 않습니다. 어떻게 이것을 말할 수 있습니까? – 지금까지 테이프에 녹음된 것 중 가장 일관적인 보컬이지만, 약간 콧물이 흐르는 마스카라와 10개의 바카디 브리저를 가미할 수 있는 노래가 있다면 이것이 바로 그것입니다. 그렇긴 하지만, 정말로 이 스타일로 부른 원곡을 듣고 싶다면 그냥 비틀거리며 새벽 3시에 아무데나 가서 암탉의 밤을 보내면 됩니다. 그렇죠? |||||
위 기사의 단축 버전은 무엇입니까?
유명 가수 에이미 와인하우스(Amy Winehouse)가 'It's My Party'라는 신곡을 발표했다. 이 노래는 Lesley Gore의 1963년 이전 노래를 그녀의 버전으로 만든 것입니다. 그녀는 이것을 만들기 위해 다른 음악인인 Mark Ronson과 함께 작업했습니다. 사람들은 인생에서 어려움을 겪은 에이미 와인하우스의 새로운 음악을 더 많이 듣고 싶어합니다.

Teacher:This task involves annotating the answer type to a given question that involve some kind of complex reasoning (including numerical reasoning). Note that the questions require looking at more than one part of the passage to answer. There are 3 possible answer types (i) spans, (ii) numbers and (iii) dates. If the answer can be found in the passage, label it as "span". If the answer is a number, label as "number". Similarly, label "date" if you think the answer to the given question is a date.
Teacher: Now, understand the problem? Solve this instance: Passage: Hoping to snap a four-game losing streak, the Bills flew to Arrowhead Stadium for a Week 12 duel with the Kansas City Chiefs.  In the first quarter, Buffalo trailed early as Chiefs QB Tyler Thigpen completed a 36-yard TD pass to RB Jamaal Charles.  The Bills responded with RB Marshawn Lynch getting a 1-yard TD run.  In the second quarter, Buffalo took the lead as kicker Rian Lindell made a 21-yard field goal.  Kansas City answered with Thigpen completing a 2-yard TD pass to TE Tony Gonzalez.  Buffalo regained the lead as Lindell got a 39-yard field goal, while rookie CB Leodis McKelvin returned an interception 64 yards for a touchdown.  The Chiefs struck back with kicker Connor Barth getting a 45-yard field goal, yet the Bills continued their offensive explosion as Lindell got a 34-yard field goal, along with QB Trent Edwards getting a 15-yard TD run. In the third quarter, Buffalo continued its poundings with Edwards getting a 5-yard TD run, while Lindell got himself a 38-yard field goal.  Kansas City tried to rally as Thigpen completed a 45-yard TD pass to WR Mark Bradley, yet the Bills replied with Edwards completing an 8-yard TD pass to WR Josh Reed.  In the fourth quarter, Buffalo pulled away as Edwards completed a 17-yard TD pass to TE Derek Schouman.  The Chiefs tried to come back as QB Quinn Gray completed a 3-yard TD pass to WR Dwayne Bowe, yet the Bills' lead was too much for Kansas City to overcome. This marked the first time the Bills scored 50+ points on an opponent since Sept. 1991 against the Pittsburgh Steelers (52-34).
Question: How many yards long was the shortest touchdown in the first 2 quarters?
Student:
To answer this question, I will check the passage for the touchdowns scored in the first 2 quarters and find the shortest one by comparing the yards mentioned.

1. First quarter:
   - 36-yard TD pass to RB Jamaal Charles
   - 1-yard TD run by RB Marshawn Lynch

2. Second quarter:
   - 2-yard TD pass to TE Tony Gonzalez
   - 64-yard interception return for a touchdown by CB Leodis McKelvin

The shortest touchdown in the first 2 quarters was the 1-yard TD run by RB Marshawn Lynch.

Answer type: number

교사: 이제 문제가 이해됐나요? 다음 사례를 해결하세요. 통행: 4연패를 노리고 Bills는 Kansas City Chiefs와의 12주차 결투를 위해 Arrowhead Stadium으로 날아갔습니다. 1 쿼터에 Buffalo는 Chiefs QB Tyler Thigpen이 RB Jamaal Charles에게 36야드 TD 패스를 완료하면서 일찍 뒤처졌습니다. Bills는 RB Marshawn Lynch가 1야드 TD를 실행하는 것으로 응답했습니다. 2쿼터에서는 키커 Rian Lindell이 21야드 필드 골을 넣으며 Buffalo가 선두를 차지했습니다. Kansas City는 Thigpen이 TE Tony Gonzalez에게 2야드 TD 패스를 완료하면서 응답했습니다. Buffalo는 Lindell이 39야드 필드 골을 기록하면서 선두를 되찾았고, 신인 CB Leodis McKelvin은 터치다운을 위해 64야드 인터셉션을 반환했습니다. Chiefs는 키커 Connor Barth가 45야드 필드 골을 기록하면서 반격했지만 Bills는 Lindell이 34야드 필드 골을 기록하고 QB Trent Edwards가 15야드 TD를 기록하면서 공격 폭발을 계속했습니다. 3쿼터에도 Buffalo는 Edwards가 5야드 TD를 기록했고 Lindell은 38야드 필드 골을 기록하면서 계속해서 두들겨 패었습니다. Kansas City는 Thigpen이 WR Mark Bradley에게 45야드 TD 패스를 완료하면서 랠리를 시도했지만 Bills는 Edwards가 WR Josh Reed에게 8야드 TD 패스를 완료하면서 응답했습니다. 4쿼터에 Buffalo는 Edwards가 TE Derek Schouman에게 17야드 TD 패스를 완료하자 철수했습니다. Chiefs는 QB Quinn Gray가 WR Dwayne Bowe에게 3야드 TD 패스를 완료하면서 돌아오려고 했지만 Bills의 리드는 Kansas City가 극복하기에는 너무 컸습니다. 이것은 Bills가 Pittsburgh Steelers(52-34)를 상대로 1991년 9월 이후 처음으로 상대에게 50점 이상을 득점한 기록입니다.
질문: 첫 2쿼터 동안 가장 짧은 터치다운 길이는 몇 야드였나요?
학생:
이 질문에 답하기 위해 처음 2쿼터에 득점한 터치다운에 대한 통과를 확인하고 언급된 야드를 비교하여 가장 짧은 것을 찾아보겠습니다.

1. 1분기:
   - RB Jamaal Charles에게 36야드 TD 패스
   - RB Marshawn Lynch가 운영하는 1야드 구축 전차

2. 2분기:
   - TE Tony Gonzalez에게 2야드 TD 패스
   - CB Leodis McKelvin의 터치다운을 위한 64야드 가로채기 리턴

처음 2쿼터 동안 가장 짧은 터치다운은 RB Marshawn Lynch가 운영한 1야드 구축전차였습니다.

답변 유형: 숫자

Please answer the following question: Information:  - The National Hockey League (NHL) is a professional ice hockey league currently composed of 31 member clubs. Of the 30 clubs currently playing, 23 are in the United States and 7 in Canada. Headquartered in New York City, the NHL is considered to be the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. The Stanley Cup, the oldest professional sports trophy in North America, is awarded annually to the league playoff champion at the end of each season.  - William Walton `` Bill '' Sharman ( May 25 , 1926 -- October 25 , 2013 ) was an American professional basketball player and coach . He is mostly known for his time with the Boston Celtics in the 1950s , partnering with Bob Cousy in what some consider the greatest backcourt duo of all time . As a coach , Sharman won titles in the ABL , ABA , and NBA , and is credited with introducing the morning shootaround . He was a 10 - time NBA Champion ( having won four titles as a player with the Celtics , one as head coach of the Los Angeles Lakers , and five as a Lakers executive ) , and a 12 - time World Champion in basketball overall counting his ABL and ABA titles . Sharman is also a two - time Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame inductee , having been being inducted in 1976 as a player , and in 2004 as a coach . Only John Wooden , Lenny Wilkens and Tommy Heinsohn share this double honor .  - The TD Garden (previously the Shawmut Center, the FleetCenter, and the TD Banknorth Garden; nicknamed the Boston Garden and The Garden) is a multi-purpose arena in Boston. It is named after its sponsor, TD Bank, a subsidiary of Canada's Toronto-Dominion Bank.  - Robert Joseph "Bob" Cousy (born August 9, 1928) is an American retired professional basketball player and member of the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. Cousy played point guard with the Boston Celtics from 1950 to 1963 and briefly with the Cincinnati Royals in the 196970 season. Making his high school varsity squad as a junior, he went on to earn a scholarship to the College of the Holy Cross, where he led the Crusaders to berths in the 1948 NCAA Tournament and 1950 NCAA Tournament and was named an NCAA All-American for 3 seasons.   - The Boston Celtics are an American professional basketball team based in Boston, Massachusetts. The Celtics compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member club of the league's Eastern Conference Atlantic Division. Founded in 1946 and one of eight NBA teams (out of 23 total teams) to survive the league's first decade, the team is owned by Boston Basketball Partners LLC. The Celtics play their home games at the TD Garden, which they share with the National Hockey League (NHL)'s Boston Bruins. The franchise's 17 championships are the most of any NBA franchise, and account for 24.3 percent of all NBA championships since the league's founding in 1946. As a percentage of championships won, the Celtics are the most successful franchise to date in the major four traditional North American professional sports leagues.  - The point guard (PG), also called the one or point, is one of the five positions in a regulation basketball game. A point guard has perhaps the most specialized role of any position. They are expected to run the team's offense by controlling the ball and making sure that it gets to the right players at the right time. Above all, the point guard must totally understand and accept their coach's game plan; in this way, the position can be compared to a quarterback in American football or a playmaker in association football (soccer).  - Basketball is a sport that is played by two teams of five players on a rectangular court. The objective is to shoot a ball through a hoop in diameter and mounted at a height of to backboards at each end of the court. The game was invented in 1891 by Dr. James Naismith, who would be the first basketball coach of the Kansas Jayhawks, one of the most successful programs in the game's history.     What entity does 'bill sharman' has the relation 'position played on team / speciality' with?

다음 질문에 답해 주십시오. 정보: - 내셔널 하키 리그(NHL)는 현재 31개 회원 클럽으로 구성된 프로 아이스하키 리그입니다. 현재 활동하고 있는 30개 클럽 중 23개는 미국에, 7개는 캐나다에 있습니다. 뉴욕시에 본부를 두고 있는 NHL은 세계 최고의 프로 아이스하키 리그이자 미국과 캐나다의 주요 프로 스포츠 리그 중 하나로 간주됩니다. 북미에서 가장 오래된 프로 스포츠 트로피인 스탠리 컵(Stanley Cup)은 매년 매 시즌이 끝날 때 리그 플레이오프 챔피언에게 수여됩니다. - 윌리엄 월튼 "빌" 샤먼(1926년 5월 25일 - 2013년 10월 25일)은 미국의 프로 농구 선수이자 코치였습니다. 그는 1950년대 보스턴 셀틱스(Boston Celtics)에서 활약한 것으로 가장 잘 알려져 있으며, 밥 쿠지(Bob Cousy)와 협력하여 역대 최고의 백코트 듀오로 여겨지기도 합니다. 코치로서 Sharman은 ABL, ABA 및 NBA에서 타이틀을 획득했으며 아침 슈팅 어라운드를 도입한 공로를 인정 받았습니다. 그는 10번의 NBA 챔피언(셀틱스에서 선수로서 4번의 타이틀, 로스앤젤레스 레이커스의 수석 코치로 1번, 레이커스 임원으로 5번의 타이틀을 획득)이었고 농구 전체에서 12번의 세계 챔피언이었습니다. ABL 및 ABA 타이틀. Sharman은 또한 1976년에 선수로, 2004년에 코치로 입성한 네이스미스 기념 농구 명예의 전당에 두 번이나 헌액된 인물입니다. John Wooden, Lenny Wilkens 및 Tommy Heinsohn만이 이 두 배의 영예를 공유합니다. - TD Garden(이전의 Shawmut Center, FleetCenter 및 TD Banknorth Garden, 별명은 Boston Garden 및 The Garden)은 보스턴의 다목적 경기장입니다. 이 은행의 이름은 후원자인 캐나다 토론토-도미니언 은행(Toronto-Dominion Bank)의 자회사인 TD 은행의 이름을 따서 지어졌습니다. - 로버트 조셉 "밥" 쿠지(Robert Joseph "Bob" Cousy, 1928년 8월 9일 출생)는 미국의 은퇴한 프로 농구 선수이자 네이스미스 기념 농구 명예의 전당 회원입니다. Cousy는 1950년부터 1963년까지 Boston Celtics에서 포인트 가드로 활약했으며 196970 시즌에는 잠시 Cincinnati Royals에서 활약했습니다. 3학년 때 고등학교 대표팀에 합류한 그는 계속해서 홀리 크로스 대학(College of the Holy Cross)에서 장학금을 받았고, 그곳에서 1948년 NCAA 토너먼트와 1950년 NCAA 토너먼트에서 크루세이더스를 이끌었고 NCAA 올 아메리칸(All-American) 선수로 선정되었습니다. 3계절. - 보스턴 셀틱스(Boston Celtics)는 매사추세츠 주 보스턴을 연고로 하는 미국 프로 농구팀입니다. 셀틱스는 리그 동부 컨퍼런스 애틀랜틱 디비전의 회원 클럽으로 미국 농구 협회(NBA)에서 경쟁합니다. 1946년에 설립되었으며 리그의 첫 10년 동안 살아남은 8개의 NBA 팀(총 23개 팀 중) 중 하나인 이 팀은 Boston Basketball Partners LLC가 소유하고 있습니다. Celtics는 NHL(National Hockey League)의 Boston Bruins와 공유하는 TD Garden에서 홈 경기를 치릅니다. 프랜차이즈의 17개 챔피언십은 NBA 프랜차이즈 중 가장 많은 것이며, 1946년 리그 창립 이래 전체 NBA 챔피언십의 24.3%를 차지합니다. 챔피언십 우승 비율로 볼 때, 셀틱스는 현재까지 주요 4대 북부 전통 리그에서 가장 성공적인 프랜차이즈입니다. 미국 프로 스포츠 리그. - 원 또는 포인트라고도 불리는 포인트 가드(PG)는 정규 농구 경기의 다섯 가지 포지션 중 하나입니다. 포인트 가드는 아마도 모든 포지션 중에서 가장 전문적인 역할을 담당할 것입니다. 그들은 공을 제어하고 적시에 적절한 선수에게 전달함으로써 팀의 공격을 실행할 것으로 예상됩니다. 무엇보다도 포인트 가드는 코치의 게임 계획을 완전히 이해하고 받아들여야 합니다. 이런 식으로 그 위치는 미식축구의 쿼터백이나 협회 축구(축구)의 플레이메이커와 비교할 수 있습니다. - 농구는 직사각형 코트에서 5명의 선수로 구성된 두 팀이 플레이하는 스포츠입니다. 목표는 직경이 있고 코트 양쪽 끝에 있는 백보드 높이에 장착된 후프를 통해 공을 쏘는 것입니다. 이 게임은 게임 역사상 가장 성공적인 프로그램 중 하나인 Kansas Jayhawks의 첫 번째 농구 코치였던 James Naismith 박사가 1891년에 발명했습니다. '빌 샤먼'은 '팀에서의 포지션/전문성'과 어떤 관계를 갖고 있나요?

en:
The best order to watch the Star Wars series depends on the preferences of the viewer, but there are a few popular viewing orders that work well in different situations. I will list three of them below:

1. Release Order:
This is the order in which the films were released in theaters, starting with the Original Trilogy followed by the Prequel Trilogy and then the Sequel Trilogy. This order captures the experience of watching the films as they were introduced to the world.

- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode I: The Phantom Menace (1999)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

Additionally, you may insert the standalone movies "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" (2016) after Episode III and "Solo: A Star Wars Story" (2018) after Episode VIII.

2. Chronological Order:
Although not the order in which the films were released, this option follows the timeline of the Star Wars universe.

- Episode I: The Phantom Menace (1999)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

"Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" takes place between Episodes III and IV, while "Solo: A Star Wars Story" occurs between Episodes III and IV but before Rogue One.

3. Machete Order:
This order is designed to maintain the surprise twist in Episode V while incorporating the background from the Prequel Trilogy.

- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

In this order, Episode I is considered optional, and standalone films can be inserted as suggested in the release order.

As for the second question, Orders 1 through 65 refer to a series of contingency orders issued by the Galactic Republic to the clone troopers. These orders were a set of emergency plans designed to address various potential crises, including treason, assassination, and kidnapping. Order 66, specifically, instructed all clone troopers to execute their Jedi commanders in the event the Jedi were ever deemed a threat to the Republic.

These questions do not have the same meaning. The first question inquires about the best viewing order for the Star Wars films, while the second question concerns in-universe contingency plans used by the Galactic Republic within the Star Wars universe.

1. 출시 순서:
이는 영화가 극장에서 개봉된 순서로, 오리지널 3부작을 시작으로 프리퀄 3부작, 후속편 3부작 순입니다. 이 순서는 영화가 세상에 소개되면서 감상한 경험을 포착합니다.

또한 에피소드 III 이후에는 독립형 영화 "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story"(2016)를 삽입하고 에피소드 VIII 이후에는 "Solo: A Star Wars Story"(2018)를 삽입할 수 있습니다.

2. 연대순:
영화가 개봉된 순서는 아니지만 이 옵션은 스타워즈 세계관의 타임라인을 따릅니다.

"Rogue One: A Star Wars Story"는 에피소드 III과 IV 사이에 진행되며, "Solo: A Star Wars Story"는 에피소드 III과 IV 사이, Rogue One 이전에 진행됩니다.

3. 마체테 주문:
이 순서는 프리퀄 3부작의 배경을 통합하면서 에피소드 V의 놀라운 반전을 유지하도록 설계되었습니다.

- 에피소드 IX: 라이즈 오브 스카이워커(2019)

이 순서에서는 에피소드 I이 선택 사항으로 간주되며 개봉 순서에 제시된 대로 독립형 영화를 삽입할 수 있습니다.

두 번째 질문의 경우, 명령 1부터 65까지는 은하 공화국이 클론 병사들에게 내린 일련의 비상 명령을 의미합니다. 이 명령은 반역, 암살, 납치 등 다양한 잠재적 위기에 대처하기 위해 고안된 일련의 비상 계획이었습니다. 특히 명령 66은 제다이가 공화국에 위협이 되는 것으로 간주될 경우 모든 클론 병사들에게 제다이 사령관을 처형하도록 지시했습니다.

이러한 질문은 동일한 의미를 갖지 않습니다. 첫 번째 질문은 스타워즈 영화를 가장 잘 보는 순서에 대해 묻는 반면, 두 번째 질문은 스타워즈 우주 내에서 은하 공화국이 사용하는 우주 내 비상 계획에 관한 것입니다.

Please answer the following question: Information:  - The National Hockey League (NHL) is a professional ice hockey league currently composed of 31 member clubs. Of the 30 clubs currently playing, 23 are in the United States and 7 in Canada. Headquartered in New York City, the NHL is considered to be the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. The Stanley Cup, the oldest professional sports trophy in North America, is awarded annually to the league playoff champion at the end of each season.  - William Walton `` Bill '' Sharman ( May 25 , 1926 -- October 25 , 2013 ) was an American professional basketball player and coach . He is mostly known for his time with the Boston Celtics in the 1950s , partnering with Bob Cousy in what some consider the greatest backcourt duo of all time . As a coach , Sharman won titles in the ABL , ABA , and NBA , and is credited with introducing the morning shootaround . He was a 10 - time NBA Champion ( having won four titles as a player with the Celtics , one as head coach of the Los Angeles Lakers , and five as a Lakers executive ) , and a 12 - time World Champion in basketball overall counting his ABL and ABA titles . Sharman is also a two - time Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame inductee , having been being inducted in 1976 as a player , and in 2004 as a coach . Only John Wooden , Lenny Wilkens and Tommy Heinsohn share this double honor .  - The TD Garden (previously the Shawmut Center, the FleetCenter, and the TD Banknorth Garden; nicknamed the Boston Garden and The Garden) is a multi-purpose arena in Boston. It is named after its sponsor, TD Bank, a subsidiary of Canada's Toronto-Dominion Bank.  - Robert Joseph "Bob" Cousy (born August 9, 1928) is an American retired professional basketball player and member of the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. Cousy played point guard with the Boston Celtics from 1950 to 1963 and briefly with the Cincinnati Royals in the 196970 season. Making his high school varsity squad as a junior, he went on to earn a scholarship to the College of the Holy Cross, where he led the Crusaders to berths in the 1948 NCAA Tournament and 1950 NCAA Tournament and was named an NCAA All-American for 3 seasons.   - The Boston Celtics are an American professional basketball team based in Boston, Massachusetts. The Celtics compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member club of the league's Eastern Conference Atlantic Division. Founded in 1946 and one of eight NBA teams (out of 23 total teams) to survive the league's first decade, the team is owned by Boston Basketball Partners LLC. The Celtics play their home games at the TD Garden, which they share with the National Hockey League (NHL)'s Boston Bruins. The franchise's 17 championships are the most of any NBA franchise, and account for 24.3 percent of all NBA championships since the league's founding in 1946. en:
What is the best order to watch the Star Wars series?
What were orders 1 through 65 in Star Wars?
Do those questions have the same meaning?
The best order to watch the Star Wars series depends on the preferences of the viewer, but there are a few popular viewing orders that work well in different situations. I will list three of them below:

1. Release Order:
This is the order in which the films were released in theaters, starting with the Original Trilogy followed by the Prequel Trilogy and then the Sequel Trilogy. This order captures the experience of watching the films as they were introduced to the world.

- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode I: The Phantom Menace (1999)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

Additionally, you may insert the standalone movies "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" (2016) after Episode III and "Solo: A Star Wars Story" (2018) after Episode VIII.

2. Chronological Order:
Although not the order in which the films were released, this option follows the timeline of the Star Wars universe.

- Episode I: The Phantom Menace (1999)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

"Rogue One: A Star Wars Story" takes place between Episodes III and IV, while "Solo: A Star Wars Story" occurs between Episodes III and IV but before Rogue One.

3. Machete Order:
This order is designed to maintain the surprise twist in Episode V while incorporating the background from the Prequel Trilogy.

- Episode IV: A New Hope (1977)
- Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back (1980)
- Episode II: Attack of the Clones (2002)
- Episode III: Revenge of the Sith (2005)
- Episode VI: Return of the Jedi (1983)
- Episode VII: The Force Awakens (2015)
- Episode VIII: The Last Jedi (2017)
- Episode IX: The Rise of Skywalker (2019)

In this order, Episode I is considered optional, and standalone films can be inserted as suggested in the release order.

As for the second question, Orders 1 through 65 refer to a series of contingency orders issued by the Galactic Republic to the clone troopers. These orders were a set of emergency plans designed to address various potential crises, including treason, assassination, and kidnapping. Order 66, specifically, instructed all clone troopers to execute their Jedi commanders in the event the Jedi were ever deemed a threat to the Republic.

These questions do not have the same meaning. The first question inquires about the best viewing order for the Star Wars films, while the second question concerns in-universe contingency plans used by the Galactic Republic within the Star Wars universe.

이 순서에서는 에피소드 I이 선택 사항으로 간주되며 개봉 순서에 제시된 대로 독립형 영화를 삽입할 수 있습니다.

두 번째 질문의 경우, 명령 1부터 65까지는 은하 공화국이 클론 병사들에게 내린 일련의 비상 명령을 의미합니다. 이 명령은 반역, 암살, 납치 등 다양한 잠재적 위기에 대처하기 위해 고안된 일련의 비상 계획이었습니다. 특히 명령 66은 제다이가 공화국에 위협이 되는 것으로 간주될 경우 모든 클론 병사들에게 제다이 사령관을 처형하도록 지시했습니다.

en:
Queen Victoria took a firm stance on the importance of maintaining and expanding the British Empire in order to secure its position as a top-notch, first-rate power during her reign. She believed that this could be achieved through a combination of aggressive foreign policy, military preparedness, and a sense of humanitarian responsibility towards the native populations under British rule.

Victoria had a strong alliance with her Prime Minister, Benjamin Disraeli, who shared her expansionist views. Together, they pushed for British involvement in global conflicts, such as the Russo-Turkish War, the Anglo-Zulu War, and the Second Anglo-Afghan War. It is crucial to note that during the Russo-Turkish War, Queen Victoria pressured Disraeli to act against Russia and even threatened to abdicate five times, showcasing her unwavering determination to assert British interests.

In her opinion, to maintain Britain's position as a leading power, the country had to be ready for conflicts and wars continually. This militaristic outlook aligned well with the era's prevailing attitude of the "civilizing mission," wherein imperialist nations believed it was their duty to bring progress and enlightenment to the territories they colonized.

Furthermore, Queen Victoria emphasized the protective nature of the British Empire's expansion. She argued that it served as a benign and civilizing force, shielding native populations from aggressive powers or cruel rulers. In this sense, she did not see the annexation of countries as an inherently negative practice but rather as a necessary measure if circumstances demanded it. She claimed that Britain would only annex countries if they were "obliged and forced to do so."

However, her close relationship with Disraeli meant she was not always in step with the broader political context. Victoria was deeply dismayed when he lost the 1880 general election to William Gladstone and later died. In memory of their shared vision for imperial Britain, Queen Victoria erected a memorial tablet in Disraeli's honor.

In summary, Queen Victoria's position for ensuring Britain's success as a top-notch power involved a combination of aggressive and expansionist foreign policy, military preparedness, protection for native populations, and a sense of moral obligation to bring about progress and enlightenment. This approach was firmly tied to the colonial and imperialist attitudes of the 19th century, but it reinforces the importance she placed on asserting Britain's power and influence on the global stage.

빅토리아 여왕은 재위 기간 동안 최고 수준의 일류 세력으로서의 지위를 확보하기 위해 대영제국을 유지하고 확장하는 것이 중요하다는 확고한 입장을 취했습니다. 그녀는 이것이 공격적인 외교 정책, 군사적 준비, 영국 통치 하의 원주민에 대한 인도주의적 책임감의 조합을 통해 달성될 수 있다고 믿었습니다.

빅토리아는 팽창주의적 견해를 공유한 벤저민 디즈레일리 총리와 강력한 동맹을 맺었습니다. 그들은 함께 러시아-터키 전쟁, 영국-줄루 전쟁, ​​제2차 영국-아프가니스탄 전쟁과 같은 글로벌 분쟁에 영국의 개입을 추진했습니다. 러시아-터키 전쟁 중에 빅토리아 여왕은 디즈레일리에게 러시아에 맞서 행동하도록 압력을 가했고 심지어 다섯 번이나 퇴위하겠다고 위협했다는 사실을 주목하는 것이 중요합니다. 이는 영국의 이익을 주장하려는 그녀의 흔들리지 않는 결의를 보여주었습니다.

그녀는 영국이 선두 강대국으로서의 지위를 유지하려면 국가가 지속적으로 갈등과 전쟁에 대비해야 한다고 생각했습니다. 이러한 군사주의적 전망은 제국주의 국가들이 자신들이 식민지화한 영토에 진보와 계몽을 가져오는 것이 자신들의 의무라고 믿었던 시대의 지배적인 '문명화 사명' 태도와 잘 들어맞았습니다.

더욱이 빅토리아 여왕은 대영제국 확장의 보호적 성격을 강조했습니다. 그녀는 그것이 공격적인 세력이나 잔인한 통치자로부터 원주민을 보호하는 자비롭고 문명화적인 힘의 역할을 한다고 주장했습니다. 이런 의미에서 그녀는 국가 합병을 본질적으로 부정적인 관행으로 보지 않고 오히려 상황이 요구할 경우 필요한 조치로 보았습니다. 그녀는 영국이 "의무가 있고 강요된" 경우에만 국가를 합병할 것이라고 주장했습니다.

그러나 그녀와 Disraeli의 긴밀한 관계는 그녀가 항상 더 넓은 정치적 맥락과 조화를 이루는 것은 아니라는 것을 의미했습니다. 빅토리아는 1880년 총선에서 윌리엄 글래드스톤에게 패하고 나중에 사망했을 때 크게 실망했습니다. 빅토리아 여왕은 영국 제국에 대한 공통된 비전을 기념하여 디즈레일리를 기리는 기념비를 세웠습니다.

요약하자면, 최고 강대국으로서 영국의 성공을 보장하기 위한 빅토리아 여왕의 입장에는 공격적이고 팽창주의적인 외교 정책, 군사적 준비, 원주민 보호, 진보와 계몽을 가져오려는 도덕적 의무감이 결합되어 있었습니다. 이러한 접근 방식은 19세기의 식민주의 및 제국주의적 태도와 확고히 연관되어 있지만, 세계 무대에서 영국의 힘과 영향력을 주장하는 데 그녀가 두는 중요성을 더욱 강조합니다.

She believed this could be achieved through a combination of an aggressive foreign policy, military preparedness, and a sense of humanitarian responsibility toward the indigenous peoples under British rule.

Victoria formed a powerful ally with Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli, who shared her expansionist views. Together they pushed for British involvement in global conflicts such as the Russo-Turkish War, the Anglo-Zulu War, and the Second Anglo-Afghan War. It is important to note that during the Russo-Turkish War, Queen Victoria pressured Disraeli to act against Russia and she even threatened to abdicate five times. This demonstrated her unwavering determination to assert British interests.

Moreover, Queen Victoria emphasized the protective nature of the expansion of the British Empire. In this sense, she did not see state mergers as an inherently negative practice, but rather as a necessary measure when circumstances demanded it. She insisted Britain would only annex the country if it was “obliged and forced” to do so.

However, her close relationship with Disraeli meant that she was not always in harmony with the wider political context. She was greatly disappointed when Victoria lost the 1880 general election to William Gladstone and he later died. Queen Victoria erected her monument to Disraeli in commemoration of her shared vision of the British Empire.

In summary, Queen Victoria's position to ensure England's success as her supreme power combined an aggressive, expansionist foreign policy, military preparedness, protection of indigenous peoples, and a sense of moral obligation to bring about progress and enlightenment. Although this approach is firmly associated with the colonialist and imperialist attitudes of the 19th century, it further emphasizes the importance she placed on asserting Britain's power and influence on the world stage.

Between April 1877 and February 1878, she threatened five times to abdicate while pressuring Disraeli to act against Russia during the Russo-Turkish War, but her threats had no impact on the events or their conclusion with the Congress of Berlin. Disraeli's expansionist foreign policy, which Victoria endorsed, led to conflicts such as the Anglo-Zulu War and the Second Anglo-Afghan War. "If we are to maintain our position as a first-rate Power", she wrote, "we must ... be Prepared for attacks and wars, somewhere or other, CONTINUALLY." Victoria saw the expansion of the British Empire as civilising and benign, protecting native peoples from more aggressive powers or cruel rulers: "It is not in our custom to annexe countries", she said, "unless we are obliged & forced to do so." To Victoria's dismay, Disraeli lost the 1880 general election, and Gladstone returned as prime minister. When Disraeli died the following year, she was blinded by "fast falling tears", and erected a memorial tablet "placed by his grateful Sovereign and Friend, Victoria R.I."
