Question: I read this background article a while ago. Huge amounts of chemicals, including fertilizers and pesticides, are used on farms (see picture below). Some chemicals are absorbed into rainwater. Runoff then carries the chemicals to nearby rivers or lakes. Dissolved fertilizers cause excessive growth of aquatic plants and algae. This can create dead zones in lakes and river estuaries where nothing can survive. Some chemicals can leach into groundwater. Contaminated water comes up the well. People can get sick if they drink contaminated water. I face a new situation today. Southern Indiana is home to two lakes that are popular destinations for families from nearby cities to visit for picnics and parties. Lake Maho is right next to a large farm that grows all kinds of crops for the village. The farm owner regularly rents out the barn for people to use for celebrations. Lake Tresco is located near the school, so children often play here during recess. How can you use the knowledge you gained from the background article to correctly answer the following questions about your new situation? Does Lake Maho have more or less chemicals than Lake Tresco?
answer:

en:
Question: The answer to the question: What is the full name of the man who works for a chemical business? is inside the article: Gloria Wandrous wakes up in the apartment of wealthy executive Weston Liggett and finds that he has left her $250. An insulted Gloria, whose dress is torn, takes Liggett's wife Emily's (Dina Merrill) mink coat to cover herself and scrawls "No Sale" in lipstick on the mirror, but she orders her telephone answering service, BUtterfield 8, to put Liggett through if he calls. Gloria visits a childhood friend, pianist Steve Carpenter, who chastises her for wasting her life on one-night stands but agrees to ask his girlfriend Norma to lend her a dress. Gloria leaves, and Norma tells Steve to choose between her and Gloria. Liggett takes a train to the countryside where his wife Emily is caring for her mother. A friend, Bingham Smith, advises him to end his adulterous relationships and return to Bing's law firm instead of working for the chemical business of Emily's father. Meanwhile, Gloria lies to her mother Annie, claiming to have spent the night at Norma's. Liggett returns home. Finding the lipstick and money, he phones Gloria to explain the money was meant for her to buy a new dress, to replace the one that he had torn. While drinking later that night, Liggett advises her to ask a high price for her lovemaking talents. She insists she does not take payment from her dates and claims she has been hired as a model to advertise the dress she is wearing at three bistros that night. Liggett follows Gloria, watching her flirt with dozens of men at several clubs. He then drives her to a run-down motel. After sleeping together, Liggett and Gloria decide to explore their relationship further. Together for five days, they grow closer, falling genuinely in love with one another and parting only upon the return of Liggett's wife., can you guess it ?
Answer:
The full name of the man who works for a chemical business in the provided article is Weston Liggett.

Liggett는 글로리아를 따라가며 여러 클럽에서 수십 명의 남자들과 바람을 피우는 모습을 지켜봅니다. 그런 다음 그는 그녀를 낡은 모텔로 데려갑니다. 함께 자고 난 후 Liggett와 Gloria는 그들의 관계를 더 자세히 탐구하기로 결정합니다. 5일 동안 함께한 그들은 점점 더 가까워지고 서로 진심으로 사랑에 빠지며 리게트의 아내가 돌아오자 헤어지게 됩니다. 짐작할 수 있나요?

제공된 기사에서 화학 사업에 종사하는 사람의 전체 이름은 Weston Liggett입니다.

Lake Mahoe likely has more chemicals in it than Lake Tresco. 

Step 1: Identify sources of chemical contamination.
According to the background article, one of the main sources of chemical contamination in bodies of water is the use of fertilizers and pesticides in farm fields. No information is provided about potential sources of contamination near Lake Tresco.

Step 2: Locate the sources near the lakes.
Lake Mahoe is situated right next to a large farm that grows all kinds of crops. This implies that fertilizers and pesticides are likely applied.

Step 3: Consider chemical runoff.
Rainwater can pick up chemicals from the farm fields and carry them into the lake, causing contamination. There is no mention of any similar process occurring near Lake Tresco.

Step 4: Consider the effects of these chemicals.
The absorbed fertilizer can enhance the growth of water plants and algae, sometimes to detrimental levels, leading to dead zones where nothing can live. Some of the chemicals can also seep into groundwater and contaminate wells from where people draw drinking water.

Step 5: Conclude based on evidence.
Given the background knowledge and the specific situation, it is much more probable that Lake Mahoe is exposed to higher levels of chemical contaminants from the nearby farm when compared to Lake Tresco, which doesn't have an identified source of similar contamination close by.

2단계: 호수 근처에서 수원을 찾습니다.
Lake Mahoe는 모든 종류의 작물을 재배하는 대규모 농장 바로 옆에 위치하고 있습니다. 이는 비료와 살충제가 적용될 가능성이 있음을 의미합니다.

3단계: 화학적 유출을 고려합니다.
빗물은 농장에서 화학 물질을 흡수하여 호수로 운반하여 오염을 일으킬 수 있습니다. Tresco 호수 근처에서 유사한 과정이 발생한다는 언급은 없습니다.

4단계: 이러한 화학물질의 영향을 고려하십시오.
흡수된 비료는 수생식물과 조류의 성장을 촉진할 수 있으며, 때로는 해로운 수준까지 증가하여 아무것도 살 수 없는 데드존으로 이어질 수 있습니다. 일부 화학물질은 지하수로 스며들어 사람들이 식수를 끌어오는 우물을 오염시킬 수도 있습니다.

5단계: 증거를 바탕으로 결론을 내립니다.
배경 지식과 특정 상황을 고려할 때, 근처에 유사한 오염원이 확인되지 않은 Tresco 호수와 비교할 때 Mahoe 호수는 인근 농장에서 더 높은 수준의 화학 오염 물질에 노출되었을 가능성이 훨씬 더 높습니다.

Q:The U.S. Congress is one step closer to averting a government shutdown Thursday after the U.S. House easily passed a $1.3 trillion spending plan that would end months of the government operating under short-term spending bills. The measure, approved by a 256-167 vote, now goes to the Senate, which has until midnight Friday to approve it and avert the year’s third government closure. The massive bipartisan bill would keep the government funded until the end of September. Lawmakers had just hours to read the nearly 2,200-page bill released Wednesday night. Under Senate rules, a single senator can delay the vote but not stop it entirely. Senator Rand Paul has objected to the short time given to members to read the lengthy legislation. As of Thursday afternoon, the Senate was waiting to see how the vote would proceed, raising the prospect of another brief government shutdown.  With midterm elections looming in November, the bill likely marks the final time Capitol Hill will consider major legislation this year. The measure would fulfill President Donald Trump’s vow to boost military funding but provides funding for limited parts of his immigration agenda. The bill, which the White House said Trump supports, would give Trump a huge budget increase for the military, including a 2.4 percent pay raise for military personnel. “Today marks the beginning of a new era for the United States military,” House Speaker Paul Ryan said in a statement Thursday. “This legislation fulfills our pledge to rebuild the United States military.” After extensive negotiations between Republicans and Democrats, the bill also provides $1.6 billion for physical barriers and 150 kilometers (93 miles) of a wall at the U.S.-Mexico border, short of the $25 billion Trump requested for the project he repeatedly touted on the campaign trail while pledging Mexico would pick up the cost. Who's immigration agenda has funding for limited parts of it? Pick the correct answer from the following options: - Trump - Mexicans - Lawmakers - not enough information

질문: 미 하원이 단기 지출 법안에 따라 수개월 동안 운영되는 정부를 종료하는 1조 3천억 달러 규모의 지출 계획을 쉽게 통과시킨 후 미국 의회는 목요일 정부 폐쇄를 막는 데 한 걸음 더 가까워졌습니다. 256 대 167 투표로 승인된 이 법안은 이제 상원으로 넘어가며 금요일 자정까지 이를 승인하고 올해 세 번째 정부 폐쇄를 방지해야 합니다. 대규모 초당적 법안은 9월 말까지 정부 자금을 계속 지원하게 될 것입니다. 국회의원들은 수요일 밤 발표된 약 2,200페이지에 달하는 법안을 단 몇 시간만에 읽을 수 있었습니다. 상원 규정에 따르면 한 명의 상원의원이 투표를 연기할 수는 있지만 완전히 중단할 수는 없습니다. Rand Paul 상원의원은 의원들이 긴 법안을 읽을 수 있는 짧은 시간을 갖는 것에 반대했습니다. 목요일 오후 현재 상원은 투표가 어떻게 진행될지 기다리고 있어 또 다른 단기 정부 폐쇄 가능성이 제기되고 있습니다. 11월 중간선거가 다가오고 있는 가운데, 이 법안은 국회의사가 올해 주요 법안을 고려하는 마지막 시기가 될 가능성이 높습니다. 이 법안은 군사 자금을 늘리겠다는 도널드 트럼프 대통령의 공약을 이행하지만 그의 이민 의제 중 제한된 부분에 자금을 제공합니다. 백악관이 트럼프 대통령이 지지한다고 밝힌 이 법안은 트럼프 대통령에게 군인 급여 2.4% 인상을 포함해 군대 예산을 대폭 늘리는 내용을 담고 있다. 폴 라이언 하원의장은 목요일 성명을 통해 “오늘은 미군의 새로운 시대가 시작되는 날”이라고 말했다. “이 법안은 미군을 재건하겠다는 우리의 약속을 이행합니다.” 공화당과 민주당 간의 광범위한 협상 끝에 이 법안은 또한 미국-멕시코 국경의 물리적 장벽과 150킬로미터(93마일)의 장벽에 16억 달러를 제공합니다. 이는 트럼프가 캠페인에서 반복적으로 선전한 프로젝트에 대해 트럼프가 요청한 250억 달러에 미치지 못하는 금액입니다. 멕시코가 비용을 부담할 것이라고 약속하면서 트레일을 이어갑니다. 이민 의제 중 제한된 부분에 자금을 지원하는 사람은 누구입니까? 다음 옵션 중에서 정답을 선택하세요. - 트럼프 - 멕시코인 - 국회의원 - 정보가 충분하지 않음

Q: Congress moved a step closer to preventing a government shutdown Thursday after the U.S. House of Representatives easily passed a $1.3 trillion spending plan that would end the government running for months under a short-term spending bill. The bill, approved by a vote of 256 to 167, now goes to the Senate, which has until midnight Friday to approve it and prevent a third government shutdown this year. The massive, bipartisan bill would continue to fund the government through the end of September. Lawmakers were able to read the nearly 2,200-page bill released Wednesday night in just a few hours. Senate rules allow one senator to postpone a vote, but not stop it entirely. Senator Rand Paul objected to lawmakers having a short period of time to read long bills. As of Thursday afternoon, the Senate was waiting to see how the vote would proceed, raising the possibility of another short-term government shutdown. With midterm elections approaching in November, this will likely be the last time lawmakers consider major legislation this year. The bill fulfills President Donald Trump's pledge to increase military funding but provides funding for limited parts of his immigration agenda. The bill, which the White House said President Trump supports, would significantly increase the military budget, including a 2.4% pay raise for military personnel. “Today marks the beginning of a new era for the American military,” House Speaker Paul Ryan said in a statement Thursday. “This bill fulfills our promise to rebuild the American military.” After extensive negotiations between Republicans and Democrats, the bill also provides $1.6 billion for a physical barrier and 150 kilometers (93 miles) of wall along the U.S.-Mexico border. That's less than the $25 billion Trump requested for projects he repeatedly touted during his campaign. Mexico continues the trail, promising to cover the costs. Who funds limited parts of the immigration agenda? Choose the correct answer from the following options: - Trump - Mexicans - Congressmen - Not enough information

en:
Please answer the following question: Read the following paragraph and extract the answer for the question: Whose decision to leave causes Alise to be left in the care of Queen Uberta, Lord Rodgers and animal friends?  Inhabited on a mysterious island are strange creatures called Boggs who love meat. Unbeknownst to them, it is also inhabited by a shipwrecked boy. He scavenges for some food by distracting the Boggs with animal noises. Far away from the island, Odette and Derek are on their way to help the people by building a bridge leaving Alise in the care of Queen Uberta, Lord Rodgers, and their animals friends: Speed, Jean-Bob, Puffin and the Scullions. Queen Uberta begins to prepare Alise to learn how to be and act like a princess. But Alise doesn't want to be a princess in this way but to be a modern princess. Lord Rogers says that Alise needs adventure but Queen Uberta disagrees. While fighting once again, Alise uses her chance to swim in the lake with her friends but she was quickly sent back to the palace to learn to be proper. Queen Uberta is very strict with Alise, trying to teach her everything, but instead she falls asleep and sent to bed. That same night, Lord Rogers, Jean-Bob, and Speed sneak Alise out of her room to go on an adventure. The next morning, before Queen Uberta enters Alise's room with yoga lessons, she notices that Alise has gone with Lord Rogers. Queen Uberta chases after the group all the way to the port but they escape on a ship. Queen Uberta is furious but nervous about Alise so she sent Puffin and the Scullions after them. On the ship, Alise changes into a pirate costume, making Lord Rogers realize that Uberta was right; he turned Alise into a pirate just when Alise wanted to have fun. On the first night they see the Polar Star and Lord Rogers says that sailors always used this star to guide the way back home.
A:
Odette and Derek's decision to leave and help the people by building a bridge causes Alise to be left in the care of Queen Uberta, Lord Rodgers, and their animal friends: Speed, Jean-Bob, Puffin, and the Scullions.

Rogers 경은 Alise에게 모험이 필요하다고 말하지만 Uberta 여왕은 동의하지 않습니다. 다시 한 번 싸우는 동안 Alise는 친구들과 함께 호수에서 수영할 기회를 이용했지만 올바른 법을 배우기 위해 빨리 궁전으로 다시 보내졌습니다. 우베르타 여왕은 알리스에게 매우 엄격하여 모든 것을 가르치려고 노력하지만, 대신 그녀는 잠이 들고 침대로 보내집니다. 그날 밤, Lord Rogers, Jean-Bob, Speed는 Alise를 방에서 몰래 빠져나와 모험을 떠납니다. 다음날 아침, 우베르타 여왕이 요가 강습을 받으러 알리스의 방에 들어가기 전에, 그녀는 알리스가 로저스 경과 함께 갔다는 것을 알아차립니다. 우베르타 여왕은 일행을 항구까지 쫓아오지만 그들은 배를 타고 탈출한다. 우버타 여왕은 알리스에 대해 분노하면서도 불안해하여 퍼핀과 스컬리온들을 뒤쫓게 했습니다. 배에서 Alise는 해적 의상으로 변신하여 Rogers 경이 Uberta가 옳았다는 것을 깨닫게 만듭니다. 그는 Alise가 재미를 원했을 때 Alise를 해적으로 만들었습니다. 첫날 밤 그들은 북극성을 보았고 로저스 경은 선원들이 집으로 돌아가는 길을 안내하기 위해 항상 이 별을 사용했다고 말했습니다.

en:
Q:The U.S. Congress is one step closer to averting a government shutdown Thursday after the U.S. House easily passed a $1.3 trillion spending plan that would end months of the government operating under short-term spending bills. The measure, approved by a 256-167 vote, now goes to the Senate, which has until midnight Friday to approve it and avert the year’s third government closure. The massive bipartisan bill would keep the government funded until the end of September. Lawmakers had just hours to read the nearly 2,200-page bill released Wednesday night. Under Senate rules, a single senator can delay the vote but not stop it entirely. Senator Rand Paul has objected to the short time given to members to read the lengthy legislation. As of Thursday afternoon, the Senate was waiting to see how the vote would proceed, raising the prospect of another brief government shutdown.  With midterm elections looming in November, the bill likely marks the final time Capitol Hill will consider major legislation this year. The measure would fulfill President Donald Trump’s vow to boost military funding but provides funding for limited parts of his immigration agenda. The bill, which the White House said Trump supports, would give Trump a huge budget increase for the military, including a 2.4 percent pay raise for military personnel. “Today marks the beginning of a new era for the United States military,” House Speaker Paul Ryan said in a statement Thursday. “This legislation fulfills our pledge to rebuild the United States military.” After extensive negotiations between Republicans and Democrats, the bill also provides $1.6 billion for physical barriers and 150 kilometers (93 miles) of a wall at the U.S.-Mexico border, short of the $25 billion Trump requested for the project he repeatedly touted on the campaign trail while pledging Mexico would pick up the cost. Who's immigration agenda has funding for limited parts of it? Pick the correct answer from the following options: - Trump - Mexicans - Lawmakers - not enough information
A:
The immigration agenda with funding for limited parts of it belongs to President Donald Trump.
google-ko:
질문: 미 하원이 단기 지출 법안에 따라 수개월 동안 운영되는 정부를 종료하는 1조 3천억 달러 규모의 지출 계획을 쉽게 통과시킨 후 미국 의회는 목요일 정부 폐쇄를 막는 데 한 걸음 더 가까워졌습니다. 256 대 167 투표로 승인된 이 법안은 이제 상원으로 넘어가며 금요일 자정까지 이를 승인하고 올해 세 번째 정부 폐쇄를 방지해야 합니다. 대규모 초당적 법안은 9월 말까지 정부 자금을 계속 지원하게 될 것입니다. 국회의원들은 수요일 밤 발표된 약 2,200페이지에 달하는 법안을 단 몇 시간만에 읽을 수 있었습니다. 상원 규정에 따르면 한 명의 상원의원이 투표를 연기할 수는 있지만 완전히 중단할 수는 없습니다. Rand Paul 상원의원은 의원들이 긴 법안을 읽을 수 있는 짧은 시간을 갖는 것에 반대했습니다. 목요일 오후 현재 상원은 투표가 어떻게 진행될지 기다리고 있어 또 다른 단기 정부 폐쇄 가능성이 제기되고 있습니다. 11월 중간선거가 다가오고 있는 가운데, 이 법안은 국회의사가 올해 주요 법안을 고려하는 마지막 시기가 될 가능성이 높습니다. 이 법안은 군사 자금을 늘리겠다는 도널드 트럼프 대통령의 공약을 이행하지만 그의 이민 의제 중 제한된 부분에 자금을 제공합니다. 백악관이 트럼프 대통령이 지지한다고 밝힌 이 법안은 트럼프 대통령에게 군인 급여 2.4% 인상을 포함해 군대 예산을 대폭 늘리는 내용을 담고 있다. 폴 라이언 하원의장은 목요일 성명을 통해 “오늘은 미군의 새로운 시대가 시작되는 날”이라고 말했다. “이 법안은 미군을 재건하겠다는 우리의 약속을 이행합니다.” 공화당과 민주당 간의 광범위한 협상 끝에 이 법안은 또한 미국-멕시코 국경의 물리적 장벽과 150킬로미터(93마일)의 장벽에 16억 달러를 제공합니다. 이는 트럼프가 캠페인에서 반복적으로 선전한 프로젝트에 대해 트럼프가 요청한 250억 달러에 미치지 못하는 금액입니다. 멕시코가 비용을 부담할 것이라고 약속하면서 트레일을 이어갑니다. 이민 의제 중 제한된 부분에 자금을 지원하는 사람은 누구입니까? 다음 옵션 중에서 정답을 선택하세요. - 트럼프 - 멕시코인 - 국회의원 - 정보가 충분하지 않음
ㅏ:
제한된 부분에 대한 자금 지원이 포함된 이민 의제는 도널드 트럼프 대통령의 몫입니다.

The bill, approved by a vote of 256 to 167, now goes to the Senate, which has until midnight Friday to approve it and prevent a third government shutdown this year. The massive, bipartisan bill would continue to fund the government through the end of September. Lawmakers were able to read the nearly 2,200-page bill released Wednesday night in just a few hours. Senate rules allow one senator to postpone a vote, but not stop it entirely. Senator Rand Paul objected to lawmakers having a short period of time to read long bills. As of Thursday afternoon, the Senate was waiting to see how the vote would proceed, raising the possibility of another short-term government shutdown. With midterm elections approaching in November, this will likely be the last time lawmakers consider major legislation this year. The bill fulfills President Donald Trump's pledge to increase military funding but provides funding for limited parts of his immigration agenda. The bill, which the White House said President Trump supports, would significantly increase the military budget, including a 2.4% pay raise for military personnel. “Today marks the beginning of a new era for the American military,” House Speaker Paul Ryan said in a statement Thursday. “This bill fulfills our promise to rebuild the American military.” After extensive negotiations between Republicans and Democrats, the bill also provides $1.6 billion for a physical barrier and 150 kilometers (93 miles) of wall along the U.S.-Mexico border. en:
Please answer the following question: On a scale of 1-5 (with 1 being least favorable and 5 being most favorable), how would you rate this review? "ya ya ya"
Answer:
Based on the limited information provided in the review, I would rate this review a 1 on the scale of 1-5, with 1 being the least favorable and 5 being the most favorable.

There are a few reasons for this rating:

1. Lack of specificity: A helpful review provides specific and clear feedback on the product or service being reviewed. The comment "ya ya ya" lacks any context or details about the user's experience, making it difficult for other users to understand the basis of the reviewer's opinion.

2. No elaboration: A substantial review should include information about what the reviewer liked or disliked, and why. This helps other users to make an informed decision based on the reviewer's experiences. The phrase "ya ya ya" is vague and does not provide any insight into the reviewer's thoughts.

3. Ambiguity: The review should convey the reviewer's stance - whether positive, negative, or neutral - to provide a clear interpretation of their experience. The reviewer's intended tone with "ya ya ya" is unclear. Are they expressing enthusiasm and satisfaction (a positive rating) or sarcasm and dissatisfaction (a negative rating)? This lack of clarity leaves potential customers unsure of the review's intended meaning.

In conclusion, this review is not helpful or informative for those seeking an understanding of other users' experiences with the product or service in question. To be more favorable and beneficial, the reviewer would need to provide specific details about their experience, offer constructive feedback, and clearly convey their overall opinion.
google-ko:
다음 질문에 답해 주십시오. 1~5점(1점은 가장 호감도가 낮고 5점은 가장 호감도)으로 이 리뷰를 어떻게 평가하시겠습니까? "야야야"
답변:
리뷰에 제공된 제한된 정보를 바탕으로 저는 이 리뷰를 1~5점 척도로 1점으로 평가하겠습니다. 1은 가장 선호도가 낮고 5는 가장 선호도가 높습니다.

이 등급에는 몇 가지 이유가 있습니다.

1. 구체성 부족: 유용한 리뷰는 리뷰 중인 제품이나 서비스에 대해 구체적이고 명확한 피드백을 제공합니다. "ya ya ya"라는 댓글에는 사용자 경험에 대한 맥락이나 세부 정보가 부족하여 다른 사용자가 리뷰어 의견의 근거를 이해하기 어렵습니다.

2. 상세 설명 없음: 실질적인 리뷰에는 리뷰어가 무엇을 좋아하고 싫어하는지, 그리고 그 이유에 대한 정보가 포함되어야 합니다. 이는 다른 사용자가 리뷰어의 경험을 바탕으로 현명한 결정을 내리는 데 도움이 됩니다. "ya ya ya"라는 표현은 모호하며 리뷰어의 생각을 전혀 알 수 없습니다.

3. 모호함: 리뷰는 리뷰어의 입장(긍정적이든, 부정적이든, 중립적이든)을 전달하여 리뷰어의 경험에 대한 명확한 해석을 제공해야 합니다. "ya ya ya"에 대한 리뷰어의 의도된 어조가 불분명합니다. 그들은 열정과 만족(긍정적 평가)을 표현하고 있습니까, 아니면 빈정거림과 불만(부정적 평가)을 표현하고 있습니까? 이러한 명확성 부족으로 인해 잠재 고객은 리뷰의 의도된 의미를 확신할 수 없게 됩니다.

결론적으로, 이 리뷰는 문제의 제품이나 서비스에 대한 다른 사용자의 경험을 이해하려는 사람들에게 도움이 되거나 유익하지 않습니다. 보다 호의적이고 유익하려면 리뷰어는 자신의 경험에 대한 구체적인 세부 정보를 제공하고 건설적인 피드백을 제공하며 전반적인 의견을 명확하게 전달해야 합니다.

en:
A tweet is a message posted on the social media platform Twitter, limited to 280 characters, which allows users to share their thoughts, opinions, news, or updates with their followers. Tweets can include hashtags (#), mentions (@), images, GIFs, and videos. Here's a detailed example of a tweet that one might see on Twitter:

Username: @JaneDoeTraveler
Display Name: Jane Doe | Globe Trotter

Tweet: 

"Finally made it to #Paris after years of dreaming about this trip! 🇫🇷 Here's a picture of the iconic Eiffel Tower at sunset. Breathtaking and truly a sight to behold! 🌇🗼 Next stop: trying some authentic #croissant and #escargot at a local patisserie! 😋 Bon appétit! 🥐🐌 #travel #bucketlist"

In this example, the user, whose handle is @JaneDoeTraveler, has traveled to Paris and wants to share her experience with her followers. She includes a personal anecdote along with relevant hashtags in her tweet to engage fellow travelers and make her post more discoverable. The hashtags are used to categorize the topic of her tweet. In this case, her hashtags are #Paris, #croissant, #escargot, #travel, and #bucketlist. These hashtags can exponentially expand her tweet's reach and connect her to other people who might be interested in the same topics.

Moreover, Jane has included emoticons and reactions typical of a casual social media post to better convey her emotions and connect with her followers on a personal level. She has also mentioned trying French cuisine and expressed excitement about her upcoming culinary adventure.

The tweet incorporates various elements that reflect a typical tweet example: personal experiences, hashtags, relevant emoticons, and a blend of text and media components to effectively convey the message and emotions behind the user's experience.
google-ko:
트윗은 소셜 미디어 플랫폼인 트위터에 게시되는 메시지로, 280자로 제한되어 사용자가 자신의 생각, 의견, 뉴스 또는 업데이트를 팔로어와 공유할 수 있습니다. 트윗에는 해시태그(#), 멘션(@), 이미지, GIF 및 동영상이 포함될 수 있습니다. 다음은 트위터에서 볼 수 있는 트윗의 자세한 예입니다.

사용자 이름: @JaneDoeTraveler
표시 이름: Jane Doe | 글로브 트로터

트위터:

"수년간 꿈꿔왔던 여행 끝에 드디어 #파리에 도착했습니다! 🇫🇷 해질녘의 상징적인 에펠탑 사진입니다. 숨이 멎을 만큼 아름답고 정말 멋진 광경입니다! 🌇🗼 다음 목적지: 정통 #크로아상과 #에스카르고 맛보기 로컬 파티세리! 😋 맛있게 드세요! 🥐🐌 #여행 #버킷리스트"

이 예에서 핸들이 @JaneDoeTraveler인 사용자는 파리를 여행했으며 자신의 경험을 팔로어와 공유하고 싶어합니다. 그녀는 트윗에 관련 해시태그와 함께 개인적인 일화를 포함시켜 동료 여행자의 참여를 유도하고 자신의 게시물이 더 쉽게 검색되도록 합니다. 해시태그는 그녀의 트윗 주제를 분류하는 데 사용됩니다. 이 경우 그녀의 해시태그는 #Paris, #croissant, #escargot, #travel, #bucketlist입니다. 이러한 해시태그는 그녀의 트윗 도달 범위를 기하급수적으로 확장하고 동일한 주제에 관심이 있는 다른 사람들과 연결해 줄 수 있습니다.

또한 Jane은 자신의 감정을 더 잘 전달하고 개인적인 차원에서 팔로어와 소통하기 위해 일반적인 소셜 미디어 게시물에 전형적인 이모티콘과 반응을 포함했습니다. 그녀는 또한 프랑스 요리를 맛본다고 언급했으며 다가오는 요리 모험에 대한 설렘을 표현했습니다.

트윗에는 일반적인 트윗 사례를 반영하는 다양한 요소(개인 경험, 해시태그, 관련 이모티콘, 텍스트와 미디어 구성 요소의 혼합)가 포함되어 있어 사용자 경험 이면에 있는 메시지와 감정을 효과적으로 전달합니다.

Jane also included typical emojis and reactions in her typical social media posts to better convey her own feelings and connect with her followers on a personal level. She also mentioned tasting French cuisine and expressed her excitement about her upcoming culinary adventure.

Tweets contain a variety of elements that reflect typical tweet practices (personal experiences, hashtags, relevant emojis, and a mix of text and media components) to effectively convey the message and emotion behind the user experience.

en:
Please answer the following question by reasoning step-by-step. Given the sentence "A tractor loaded with parts is moving across a barren area outside." can we conclude that "An empty tractor parked inside a garage."?
Options:
- yes
- it is not possible to tell
- no. Step-by-step reasoning:
- no.

Step-by-step reasoning:

1. The given sentence describes a tractor that is "loaded with parts," while the conclusion statement refers to an "empty tractor." These two descriptions are contradictory; thus, we cannot conclude an empty tractor when it is stated to be loaded with parts.

2. The given sentence states that the tractor is "moving across a barren area outside." Contrary to this, the conclusion statement claims that the tractor is "parked inside a garage." The statements describe two different locations and situations for the tractor. One is outside and moving, and the other is inside and parked.

Based on these discrepancies, we cannot conclude that "An empty tractor parked inside a garage" from the given sentence.

A tweet is a message posted on the social media platform Twitter, limited to 280 characters, which allows users to share their thoughts, opinions, news, or updates with their followers. Username: @JaneDoeTraveler
Display Name: Jane Doe | Globe Trotter

In this example, the user, whose handle is @JaneDoeTraveler, has traveled to Paris and wants to share her experience with her followers. She includes a personal anecdote along with relevant hashtags in her tweet to engage fellow travelers and make her post more discoverable. The hashtags are used to categorize the topic of her tweet. In this case, her hashtags are #Paris, #croissant, #escargot, #travel, and #bucketlist. These hashtags can exponentially expand her tweet's reach and connect her to other people who might be interested in the same topics.

Moreover, Jane has included emoticons and reactions typical of a casual social media post to better convey her emotions and connect with her followers on a personal level. She has also mentioned trying French cuisine and expressed excitement about her upcoming culinary adventure.

The tweet incorporates various elements that reflect a typical tweet example: personal experiences, hashtags, relevant emoticons, and a blend of text and media components to effectively convey the message and emotions behind the user's experience.

Megan had much thicker skin than Rebecca so 
Possible answers: A). Megan was saddened by people's vile insults.; B). Rebecca was saddened by people's vile insults.;
B). Rebecca was saddened by people's vile insults.

Here's why: "Thicker skin" is a way to say that someone is better at not letting mean words or actions upset them. So if Megan has "thicker skin" than Rebecca, that means Megan is better at not getting upset by mean words. So, Rebecca, who doesn't have as "thick skin" as Megan, would be the one who is more likely to be saddened by people's mean or nasty comments.

en:
Based on the limited information provided in the review, I would rate this review a 1 on the scale of 1-5, with 1 being the least favorable and 5 being the most favorable.

There are a few reasons for this rating:

1. Lack of specificity: A helpful review provides specific and clear feedback on the product or service being reviewed. The comment "ya ya ya" lacks any context or details about the user's experience, making it difficult for other users to understand the basis of the reviewer's opinion.

2. No elaboration: A substantial review should include information about what the reviewer liked or disliked, and why. This helps other users to make an informed decision based on the reviewer's experiences. The phrase "ya ya ya" is vague and does not provide any insight into the reviewer's thoughts.

3. Ambiguity: The review should convey the reviewer's stance - whether positive, negative, or neutral - to provide a clear interpretation of their experience. The reviewer's intended tone with "ya ya ya" is unclear. Are they expressing enthusiasm and satisfaction (a positive rating) or sarcasm and dissatisfaction (a negative rating)? This lack of clarity leaves potential customers unsure of the review's intended meaning.

In conclusion, this review is not helpful or informative for those seeking an understanding of other users' experiences with the product or service in question. To be more favorable and beneficial, the reviewer would need to provide specific details about their experience, offer constructive feedback, and clearly convey their overall opinion.
google-ko:
리뷰에 제공된 제한된 정보를 바탕으로 저는 이 리뷰를 1~5점 척도로 1점으로 평가하겠습니다. 1은 가장 선호도가 낮고 5는 가장 선호도가 높습니다.

이 등급에는 몇 가지 이유가 있습니다.

1. 구체성 부족: 유용한 리뷰는 리뷰 중인 제품이나 서비스에 대해 구체적이고 명확한 피드백을 제공합니다. "ya ya ya"라는 댓글에는 사용자 경험에 대한 맥락이나 세부 정보가 부족하여 다른 사용자가 리뷰어 의견의 근거를 이해하기 어렵습니다.

2. 상세 설명 없음: 실질적인 리뷰에는 리뷰어가 무엇을 좋아하고 싫어하는지, 그리고 그 이유에 대한 정보가 포함되어야 합니다. 이는 다른 사용자가 리뷰어의 경험을 바탕으로 현명한 결정을 내리는 데 도움이 됩니다. "ya ya ya"라는 표현은 모호하며 리뷰어의 생각을 전혀 알 수 없습니다.

3. 모호함: 리뷰는 리뷰어의 입장(긍정적이든, 부정적이든, 중립적이든)을 전달하여 리뷰어의 경험에 대한 명확한 해석을 제공해야 합니다. "ya ya ya"에 대한 리뷰어의 의도된 어조가 불분명합니다. 그들은 열정과 만족(긍정적 평가)을 표현하고 있습니까, 아니면 빈정거림과 불만(부정적 평가)을 표현하고 있습니까? 이러한 명확성 부족으로 인해 잠재 고객은 리뷰의 의도된 의미를 확신할 수 없게 됩니다.

결론적으로, 이 리뷰는 문제의 제품이나 서비스에 대한 다른 사용자의 경험을 이해하려는 사람들에게 도움이 되거나 유익하지 않습니다. 보다 호의적이고 유익하려면 리뷰어는 자신의 경험에 대한 구체적인 세부 정보를 제공하고 건설적인 피드백을 제공하며 전반적인 의견을 명확하게 전달해야 합니다.
google-en:
Based on the limited information provided in the review, I would rate this review a 1 on a scale of 1-5. 1 is the least preferred and 5 is the most preferred.

There are several reasons for this rating.

1. Lack of specificity: Useful reviews provide specific, clear feedback about the product or service being reviewed. “ya ya ya” comments lack context or details about the user’s experience, making it difficult for other users to understand the basis for the reviewer’s opinion.

2. No details: A substantive review should include information about what the reviewer likes and dislikes and why. This helps other users make informed decisions based on the reviewer's experience. The expression "ya ya ya" is ambiguous and gives no indication of what the reviewer was thinking.

3. Ambiguity: Reviews should convey the reviewer's position (whether positive, negative, or neutral) and provide a clear interpretation of the reviewer's experience. The reviewer's intended tone of "ya ya ya" is unclear. Are they expressing enthusiasm and satisfaction (positive evaluation) or sarcasm and frustration (negative evaluation)? This lack of clarity leaves potential customers unsure of the intended meaning of the review.

In conclusion, this review is not helpful or informative to those who are trying to understand other users' experiences with the product or service in question. To be more favorable and informative, reviewers should provide specific details about their experience, provide constructive feedback, and clearly communicate their overall opinions.

en:
Juzo Murasaki arrives at a work construction area to take on his new job as a construction worker .  To his quiet dismay , his supervising boss turns out to be Toru Akai , who with his gang had made Juzo's middle school life a living hell .  Akai , however , does n't recognize Juzo .  Juzo's more disconcerted when he discovers that Akai lives with his wife , Nozomi Akai and their toddler son above Juzo's new apartment .  As Juzo emotionally struggles to handle these unexpected developments , a mysterious and seemingly malicious hooded figure appears .  It calls itself Number 13 .  As Juzo attempts to control increasing number of flashbacks and a spiral fall into psychological darkness , Akai constantly picks on Juzo and other work colleagues including Seki Hajime , a former middle school student who becomes Juzo's casual friend in spite of Juzo's anti-social tendencies , at work .  Meanwhile Akai's wife , Nozomi , attempts to make friends with Juzo and entrusting the care of her toddler son to Juzo .  She proudly shows Juzo her husband's school photos .  In one class photo , Juzo's space is marked with an X to show he was absent .  Juzo suffers a severe flashback to explain his absence that day : in their school's science room , Akai and his friends have thrown acid at Juzo's face .  Seki becomes suspicious about Juzo's increasingly odd behavior and goes to inform Arai at the work site , but Arai dismisses him without giving him a chance to speak .  During this incident , Seki does n't realize he's being watched by Number 13 , but as soon as he does , Number 13 kills him . 

Question: "What is Seki's relationship with Juzo?"

Answer: "Lozu's child"

en:
In June 1916, the British sent out a number of officials to assist the revolt in the Hejaz, most notably Colonel Cyril Wilson, Colonel Pierce C. Joyce, and Lt-Colonel Stewart Francis Newcombe. Herbert Garland was also involved. In addition, a French military mission commanded by Colonel Edouard Brémond was sent out. The French enjoyed an advantage over the British in that they included a number of Muslim officers such as Captain Muhammand Ould Ali Raho, Claude Prost, and Laurent Depui . Captain Rosario Pisani of the French Army, though not a Muslim, also played a notable role in the revolt as an engineering and artillery officer with the Arab Northern Army. The British government in Egypt sent a young officer, Captain T. E. Lawrence, to work with the Hashemite forces in the Hejaz in October 1916. The British historian David Murphy wrote that though Lawrence was just one out of many British and French officers serving in Arabia, historians often write as though it was Lawrence alone who represented the Allied cause in Arabia. David Hogarth credited Gertrude Bell for much of the success of the Arab Revolt. She had travelled extensively in the Middle East since 1888, after graduating from Oxford with a First in Modern History. Bell had met Sheikh Harb of the Howeitat in January 1914 and thus was able to provide a "mass of information" which was crucial to the success of Lawrence's occupation of Aqaba covering the "tribal elements ranging between the Hejaz Railway and the Nefud, particularly about the Howeitat group." It was this information, Hogarth emphasized, which "Lawrence, relying on her reports, made signal use of in the Arab campaigns of 1917 and 1918."

E. 로렌스(T. E. Lawrence) 대위를 파견했습니다. 영국 역사가 데이비드 머피(David Murphy)는 로렌스가 아라비아에서 복무하는 많은 영국 및 프랑스 장교 중 한 명일 뿐이라고 썼습니다. 역사가들은 종종 아라비아에서 연합군의 대의를 대표한 사람이 로렌스 혼자인 것처럼 글을 씁니다. David Hogarth는 아랍 반란의 성공에 대해 거트루드 벨의 공로를 인정했습니다. 그녀는 옥스포드에서 현대사를 처음으로 졸업한 후 1888년부터 중동을 광범위하게 여행했습니다. Bell은 1914년 1월 Howeitat의 Sheikh Harb를 만났고 따라서 "Hejaz Railway와 Nefud 사이에 있는 부족 요소, 특히 Howeitat 그룹." Hogarth는 "로렌스는 자신의 보고서에 의존하여 1917년과 1918년의 아랍 캠페인에서 신호를 활용한" 정보가 바로 이 정보라고 강조했습니다.

google-ko: Perijá 타파쿨로의 수컷 표본은 다리 뒤쪽이 갈색이고 앞쪽이 희끄무레합니다.

en:
Please answer the following question: Read the following paragraph and extract the answer for the question: What gender of the Perijá tapaculo have brown on the back of their legs and whitish on the front?  The Perijá tapaculo is a small bird, 10 to 12 cm (3.9 to 4.7 in) in length with an average mass of 17 to 18 grams (around 0.6 oz). The bill averages 6.8 millimetres (0.27 inches) long, 2.9 mm (0.11 in) wide, and 3.5 mm (0.14 in) high. The legs are about 21 mm (0.83 in) long. The Perijá tapaculo's tarsus averages 21.1 millimetres (0.83 in) long. The wings measure 57.4 mm (2.26 in) on average and the tail is about 40 mm (1.6 in) long with between 8 and 12 rectrices.The forehead, lores, crown, mantle, and scapular area are a neutral grey colour. There is a brown spot on the nape. The top of the tail is brown, and the bottom is faintly striped brown. The bird's back and rump are striped brown-sepia, and the throat, breast, and belly are grey-white. Its lower belly and flanks are tawny. The iris is dark brown. Male specimens are distinguished by having less sharp brown spots on their napes, and the bottom of their breasts are mixed with a pale buff colour. The legs are brown on the back and whitish on the front. Young birds have a yellowish appearance with striped brown flanks.The bird's plumage colouration is most similar to the pale-bellied tapaculo. The S. g. morenoi subspecies of the pale-bellied tapaculo can be differentiated from the Perijá tapaculo by its entirely brown back and nape, and its different calls. Juveniles of this subspecies have a dull ventral plumage, while the Perijá tapaculo has a more yellow plumage. It also resembles the Caracas tapaculo but has a duller ventral colour.
A:

다음 질문에 답하십시오. 다음 단락을 읽고 질문에 대한 답을 추출하십시오. Perijá 타파쿨로의 어떤 성별이 다리 뒤쪽이 갈색이고 앞쪽이 희끄무레합니까? Perijá 타파쿨로는 길이가 10~12cm(3.9~4.7인치)이고 평균 질량이 17~18g(약 0.6온스)인 작은 새입니다. 부리의 평균 길이는 6.8mm(0.27인치), 너비는 2.9mm(0.11인치), 높이는 3.5mm(0.14인치)입니다. 다리 길이는 약 21mm(0.83인치)입니다. Perijá 타파쿨로의 부절의 평균 길이는 21.1mm(0.83인치)입니다. 날개의 길이는 평균 57.4mm(2.26인치)이고 꼬리의 길이는 약 40mm(1.6인치)이며 직근은 8~12개입니다. 이마, 전승, 정수리, 맨틀 및 견갑골 부분은 중간 회색입니다. 목덜미에 갈색 반점이 있다. 꼬리 윗부분은 갈색이고, 아랫부분은 희미한 줄무늬가 있는 갈색이다. 새의 등과 엉덩이는 갈색-세피아 줄무늬가 있고 목, 가슴, 배는 회백색입니다. 아랫배와 옆구리는 황갈색이다. 홍채는 짙은 갈색입니다. 수컷은 목덜미에 덜 선명한 갈색 반점이 있는 것으로 구별되며, 가슴 밑 부분은 옅은 담황색이 섞여 있습니다. 다리는 뒷면이 갈색이고 앞면이 흰색입니다. 어린 새는 옆구리에 갈색 줄무늬가 있고 노란색을 띠는 외양을 가지고 있습니다. 새의 깃털 색깔은 창백한 배 타파쿨로와 가장 유사합니다. S.g. 창백한 배 타파쿨로의 모레노이 아종은 등 전체가 갈색이고 목덜미가 갈색이며 울음소리가 다르다는 점에서 페리자 타파쿨로와 구별될 수 있습니다. 이 아종의 청소년은 둔한 복부 깃털을 가지고 있는 반면 Perijá 타파쿨로는 더 노란색 깃털을 가지고 있습니다. 또한 카라카스 타파쿨로(Caracas tapaculo)와 유사하지만 복부 색상이 더 흐릿합니다.

en:
In June 1916, the British sent out a number of officials to assist the revolt in the Hejaz, most notably Colonel Cyril Wilson, Colonel Pierce C. Joyce, and Lt-Colonel Stewart Francis Newcombe. Herbert Garland was also involved. In addition, a French military mission commanded by Colonel Edouard Brémond was sent out. The French enjoyed an advantage over the British in that they included a number of Muslim officers such as Captain Muhammand Ould Ali Raho, Claude Prost, and Laurent Depui . Captain Rosario Pisani of the French Army, though not a Muslim, also played a notable role in the revolt as an engineering and artillery officer with the Arab Northern Army. The British government in Egypt sent a young officer, Captain T. E. Lawrence, to work with the Hashemite forces in the Hejaz in October 1916. The British historian David Murphy wrote that though Lawrence was just one out of many British and French officers serving in Arabia, historians often write as though it was Lawrence alone who represented the Allied cause in Arabia. David Hogarth credited Gertrude Bell for much of the success of the Arab Revolt. She had travelled extensively in the Middle East since 1888, after graduating from Oxford with a First in Modern History. Bell had met Sheikh Harb of the Howeitat in January 1914 and thus was able to provide a "mass of information" which was crucial to the success of Lawrence's occupation of Aqaba covering the "tribal elements ranging between the Hejaz Railway and the Nefud, particularly about the Howeitat group." It was this information, Hogarth emphasized, which "Lawrence, relying on her reports, made signal use of in the Arab campaigns of 1917 and 1918."

Answer this question based on the article: Which army had more Mulim officer, the English or the French?
Based on the article, the French army had more Muslim officers than the English army during the Arab Revolt in the Hejaz. Notable Muslim officers in the French military mission included Captain Muhammand Ould Ali Raho, Claude Prost, and Laurent Depui.

1916년 6월, 영국군은 헤자즈의 반란을 지원하기 위해 여러 관리들을 파견했는데, 그중 가장 유명한 사람은 시릴 윌슨 대령, 피어스 C. 조이스 대령, 스튜어트 프랜시스 뉴컴 중령이었습니다. 허버트 갈랜드(Herbert Garland)도 참여했습니다. 또한 Edouard Brémond 대령이 지휘하는 프랑스 군사 임무가 파견되었습니다. 프랑스군은 Muhammand Ould Ali Raho 대위, Claude Prost, Laurent Depui 등 다수의 무슬림 장교를 포함했다는 점에서 영국군에 비해 이점을 누렸습니다. 무슬림은 아니지만 프랑스군 대위 로사리오 피사니(Rosario Pisani)도 아랍 북부군의 공병 및 포병 장교로서 반란에 중요한 역할을 했습니다. 이집트의 영국 정부는 1916년 10월 헤자즈에서 하셰미트 군대와 협력하기 위해 젊은 장교 T. E. 로렌스(T. E. Lawrence) 대위를 파견했습니다. 영국 역사가 데이비드 머피(David Murphy)는 로렌스가 아라비아에서 복무하는 많은 영국 및 프랑스 장교 중 한 명일 뿐이라고 썼습니다. 역사가들은 종종 아라비아에서 연합군의 대의를 대표한 사람이 로렌스 혼자인 것처럼 글을 씁니다. David Hogarth는 아랍 반란의 성공에 대해 거트루드 벨의 공로를 인정했습니다. 그녀는 옥스포드에서 현대사를 처음으로 졸업한 후 1888년부터 중동을 광범위하게 여행했습니다. Bell은 1914년 1월 Howeitat의 Sheikh Harb를 만났고 따라서 "Hejaz Railway와 Nefud 사이에 있는 부족 요소, 특히 Howeitat 그룹." Hogarth는 "로렌스는 자신의 보고서에 의존하여 1917년과 1918년의 아랍 캠페인에서 신호를 활용한" 정보가 바로 이 정보라고 강조했습니다.

다음 기사를 바탕으로 이 질문에 답해 보세요. 영국군과 프랑스군 중 물림 장교가 더 많은 군대는 어디입니까?
기사에 따르면 헤자즈 지역의 아랍 반란 당시 프랑스군에는 영국군보다 무슬림 장교가 더 많았습니다. 프랑스 군사 임무의 주목할만한 무슬림 장교로는 Muhammand Ould Ali Raho 대위, Claude Prost 및 Laurent Depui가 있습니다.

en:
Juzo Murasaki arrives at a work construction area to take on his new job as a construction worker .  To his quiet dismay , his supervising boss turns out to be Toru Akai , who with his gang had made Juzo's middle school life a living hell .  Akai , however , does n't recognize Juzo .  Juzo's more disconcerted when he discovers that Akai lives with his wife , Nozomi Akai and their toddler son above Juzo's new apartment .  As Juzo emotionally struggles to handle these unexpected developments , a mysterious and seemingly malicious hooded figure appears .  It calls itself Number 13 .  As Juzo attempts to control increasing number of flashbacks and a spiral fall into psychological darkness , Akai constantly picks on Juzo and other work colleagues including Seki Hajime , a former middle school student who becomes Juzo's casual friend in spite of Juzo's anti-social tendencies , at work .  Meanwhile Akai's wife , Nozomi , attempts to make friends with Juzo and entrusting the care of her toddler son to Juzo .  She proudly shows Juzo her husband's school photos .  In one class photo , Juzo's space is marked with an X to show he was absent .  Juzo suffers a severe flashback to explain his absence that day : in their school's science room , Akai and his friends have thrown acid at Juzo's face .  Seki becomes suspicious about Juzo's increasingly odd behavior and goes to inform Arai at the work site , but Arai dismisses him without giving him a chance to speak .  During this incident , Seki does n't realize he's being watched by Number 13 , but as soon as he does , Number 13 kills him . 

Question: "What is Seki's relationship with Juzo?"

Answer: "Lozu's child"

Is this answer correct?
No, the answer is not correct. 

The correct answer would be: Seki Hajime is a former middle school student who becomes Juzo's casual friend at the construction site despite Juzo's anti-social tendencies.

무라사키 쥬조는 건설 노동자로 새로운 일을 시작하기 위해 공사 현장에 도착한다. 놀랍게도 그의 감독 상사는 그의 갱단과 함께 주조의 중학교 생활을 살아있는 지옥으로 만든 아카이 토루로 밝혀졌습니다. 그러나 아카이는 주조를 알아보지 못한다. 주조는 아카이가 그의 아내 아카이 노조미와 어린 아들과 함께 주조의 새 아파트 위에 살고 있다는 사실을 알고 더욱 당황합니다. Juzo가 예상치 못한 상황에 대처하기 위해 감정적으로 고군분투하는 동안, 신비롭고 악의적인 것처럼 보이는 두건을 쓴 인물이 나타납니다. 그것은 스스로를 Number 13이라고 부릅니다. Juzo가 점점 늘어나는 회상 횟수와 나선형이 심리적 어둠에 빠지는 것을 통제하려고 시도하는 동안 Akai는 Juzo의 반사회적 경향에도 불구하고 Juzo의 우연한 친구가 된 전 중학생 Seki Hajime를 포함한 다른 직장 동료를 끊임없이 선택합니다. 일하다 . 한편 아카이의 아내 노조미는 주조와 친구가 되려고 노력하고 어린 아들의 보살핌을 주조에게 맡긴다. 그녀는 남편의 학교 사진을 주조에게 자랑스럽게 보여줍니다. 한 수업 사진에서는 주조가 결석한 공간을 X로 표시해 놓았습니다. Juzo는 그날 자신의 결석을 설명하기 위해 심각한 회상을 겪습니다. 학교 과학실에서 Akai와 그의 친구들은 Juzo의 얼굴에 염산을 던졌습니다. 세키는 점점 이상해지는 주조의 행동을 의심하고 아라이에게 작업장으로 알리러 가지만 아라이는 말할 기회도 주지 않고 그를 무시한다. 이 사건 동안 세키는 자신이 13번의 감시를 받고 있다는 사실을 깨닫지 못하지만, 그 순간 13번이 그를 죽인다.

Randy's lack of contribution to housework puts additional responsibilities on his wife, who is already raising two children. This increase in her workload could lead to stress, both physical and emotional. Let's analyze the options:

1. Asthma: Asthma is generally not caused by stress. It is a chronic lung disease and results from a combination of genetic and environmental factors. While stress can potentially trigger asthma symptoms in some cases, it is not a direct consequence of the given situation.

2. More: It seems this option is incomplete or unclear. Without any context, we cannot determine what "more" may refer to.

3. Boredom: Boredom would be unlikely in this situation, as the wife is dealing with a heavier workload and increased responsibilities. This would leave her with little time to feel bored, as most of her time would be occupied with housework and childcare.

4. Headache: Stress can indeed lead to headaches, which can be caused by tension, muscle strain, or hormonal changes. In the given situation, the wife's increased stress and workload may contribute to the development of headaches.

5. Arguments: The imbalance in shared responsibilities between Randy and his wife could likely lead to arguments and tension in their relationship. The wife may feel overwhelmed and resentful due to the unfair distribution of housework, leading to disagreements and strife in the family.

Based on this analysis, the most plausible outcomes of Randy not doing housework while his wife raises two children are headaches and arguments. These issues could arise from the increased stress, tension, and the unfair division of labor within their household.

en:
To translate the given sentence into Russian, I'll analyze the sentence structure and words, identify the Russian counterparts, and then construct the Russian sentence while following the correct grammar and syntax rules. 

English sentence: Would you completely bet that it couldn't usurp Google, given time?

Translation process:
- "Would you" is a question construction that, in Russian, translates as "Вы бы" or "Ты бы" (the formal and informal ways to address "you," respectively; I'll go with the formal version)
- "completely bet" can be translated as "полностью поспорили"
- "that" as a conjunction introducing a clause can be translated as "что"
- "it" can be translated as "он" or "она" (masculine and feminine; in this case, I'll use the neuter form for an object or idea: "оно")
- "couldn't" is a contraction of "could not," which translates as "не смогло бы"
- "usurp" can be translated as "свергнуть" or "заменить"; I'll go with " заменить," which means "replace" and captures the idea of gaining power or supremacy
- "Google" remains the same since it's a proper noun
- "given time" can be translated as "со временем"

Now, I'll construct the Russian sentence while following correct grammar and syntax rules.

Russian sentence: Вы бы полностью поспорили, что оно не смогло бы заменить Google со временем?

The sentence has now been translated into Russian.

영어 문장: 시간이 주어진다면, 구글을 능가할 수 없을 것이라고 전적으로 장담하시겠습니까?

번역 과정:
- "Would you"는 러시아어에서 "Вы бы" 또는 "Ты бы"로 번역되는 질문 구성입니다(각각 "당신"을 지칭하는 공식적 및 비공식적 방법. 저는 공식적인 버전을 사용하겠습니다).
- "완전히 베팅하다"는 "полностьу поспорили"로 번역될 수 있습니다.
-절을 소개하는 접속사인 "that"은 "что"로 번역될 수 있습니다.
- "it"는 "он" 또는 "она"로 번역될 수 있습니다(남성 및 여성; 이 경우에는 대상이나 아이디어에 중성형을 사용하겠습니다: "оно")
- "할 수 없었다"는 "할 수 없었다"의 축약형으로 "не смогло бы"로 번역됩니다.
- "usurp"는 "свергнуть" 또는 "заменить"로 번역될 수 있습니다. 저는 "대체"를 의미하는 " заменить"를 선택하겠습니다. 이 단어는 권력이나 패권을 얻으려는 개념을 담고 있습니다.
- 'Google'은 고유명사이므로 그대로 유지됩니다.
- "주어진 시간"은 "со временем"으로 번역될 수 있습니다.

이제 올바른 문법과 구문 규칙을 지키면서 러시아어 문장을 구성하겠습니다.

러시아어 문장: Вы бы полностьу поспорили, что оно не смогло бы заменить Google со временем?

During an argument at the dinner table between Drake and Crispian, Tariq and Drake are shot by crossbow bolts from outside the house, Tariq fatally and Drake moderately wounded. With their cell phone signals jammed by the attackers, Aimee runs out the front door to get help, but runs into a garrote wire which slashes her throat. Crispian leaves the house to find help. Aubrey is brought upstairs to her bedroom by Paul; when Paul leaves the room, Fox Mask appears from under the bed and kills Aubrey. The rest of the family rushes upstairs to find Aubrey dead with the words "You're next" scrawled on the wall in blood. Erin begins securing the house and texts 911. She encounters Tiger Mask and evades his attack, wounding him in the process. Kelly returns to the bedroom and discovers Fox Mask still hiding under the bed. She panics and runs to the neighboring home. After pounding on the window for help, she gets inside but discovers the murdered couple and is soon killed by a maul-wielding Lamb Mask. Back at the house, Tiger Mask once again fails to murder Erin and is in turn killed by her with a meat tenderizer; it is later revealed that Tiger Mask is actually Lamb Mask's brother. Lamb Mask finds Drake, but Erin stabs him with a screwdriver and he retreats. While exploring the house, Paul finds evidence that the killers had been staying in the house for a while. He tries to tell Zee and Felix, but Fox Mask appears from behind and slashes his throat. It is revealed that Felix and Zee hired the assassins to murder the family and collect their inheritance. Question: Where does the policeman shoot Erin? Movie title: You're Next Movie plot: The film opens with a couple being murdered in their house by assailants wearing various animal masks. Erin accompanies her boyfriend Crispian Davison to his family reunion at their rural Missouri vacation home, adjacent to the property of the murdered couple. Present are Crispian's parents Aubrey and Paul, his older brother Drake and Drake's wife Kelly, his younger siblings Felix and Aimee, Felix's girlfriend Zee, and Aimee's boyfriend Tariq. During an argument at the dinner table between Drake and Crispian, Tariq and Drake are shot by crossbow bolts from outside the house, Tariq fatally and Drake moderately wounded. With their cell phone signals jammed by the attackers, Aimee runs out the front door to get help, but runs into a garrote wire which slashes her throat. Crispian leaves the house to find help. Aubrey is brought upstairs to her bedroom by Paul; when Paul leaves the room, Fox Mask appears from under the bed and kills Aubrey. The rest of the family rushes upstairs to find Aubrey dead with the words "You're next" scrawled on the wall in blood. Erin begins securing the house and texts 911. She encounters Tiger Mask and evades his attack, wounding him in the process. Kelly returns to the bedroom and discovers Fox Mask still hiding under the bed. She panics and runs to the neighboring home. After pounding on the window for help, she gets inside but discovers the murdered couple and is soon killed by a maul-wielding Lamb Mask. Back at the house, Tiger Mask once again fails to murder Erin and is in turn killed by her with a meat tenderizer; it is later revealed that Tiger Mask is actually Lamb Mask's brother. Lamb Mask finds Drake, but Erin stabs him with a screwdriver and he retreats. While exploring the house, Paul finds evidence that the killers had been staying in the house for a while. He tries to tell Zee and Felix, but Fox Mask appears from behind and slashes his throat. It is revealed that Felix and Zee hired the assassins to murder the family and collect their inheritance. Felix lures Drake to...

en:
Translate the following sentence to Russian:
Would you completely bet that it couldn't usurp Google, given time?
To translate the given sentence into Russian, I'll analyze the sentence structure and words, identify the Russian counterparts, and then construct the Russian sentence while following the correct grammar and syntax rules. 

English sentence: Would you completely bet that it couldn't usurp Google, given time?

Translation process:
- "Would you" is a question construction that, in Russian, translates as "Вы бы" or "Ты бы" (the formal and informal ways to address "you," respectively; I'll go with the formal version)
- "completely bet" can be translated as "полностью поспорили"
- "that" as a conjunction introducing a clause can be translated as "что"
- "it" can be translated as "он" or "она" (masculine and feminine; in this case, I'll use the neuter form for an object or idea: "оно")
- "couldn't" is a contraction of "could not," which translates as "не смогло бы"
- "usurp" can be translated as "свергнуть" or "заменить"; I'll go with " заменить," which means "replace" and captures the idea of gaining power or supremacy
- "Google" remains the same since it's a proper noun
- "given time" can be translated as "со временем"

Now, I'll construct the Russian sentence while following correct grammar and syntax rules.

Russian sentence: Вы бы полностью поспорили, что оно не смогло бы заменить Google со временем?

The sentence has now been translated into Russian.
google-ko:
다음 문장을 러시아어로 번역하세요.
시간이 주어진다면 구글이 구글을 능가할 수 없을 것이라고 전적으로 장담하시겠습니까?
주어진 문장을 러시아어로 번역하기 위해 문장 구조와 단어를 분석하고 러시아어 대응어를 식별한 다음 올바른 문법과 구문 규칙을 따르면서 러시아어 문장을 구성하겠습니다.

영어 문장: 시간이 주어진다면, 구글을 능가할 수 없을 것이라고 전적으로 장담하시겠습니까?

번역 과정:
- "Would you"는 러시아어에서 "Вы бы" 또는 "Ты бы"로 번역되는 질문 구성입니다(각각 "당신"을 지칭하는 공식적 및 비공식적 방법. 저는 공식적인 버전을 사용하겠습니다).
- "완전히 베팅하다"는 "полностьу поспорили"로 번역될 수 있습니다.
-절을 소개하는 접속사인 "that"은 "что"로 번역될 수 있습니다.
- "it"는 "он" 또는 "она"로 번역될 수 있습니다(남성 및 여성; 이 경우에는 대상이나 아이디어에 중성형을 사용하겠습니다: "оно")
- "할 수 없었다"는 "할 수 없었다"의 축약형으로 "не смогло бы"로 번역됩니다.
- "usurp"는 "свергнуть" 또는 "заменить"로 번역될 수 있습니다. 저는 "대체"를 의미하는 " заменить"를 선택하겠습니다. 이 단어는 권력이나 패권을 얻으려는 개념을 담고 있습니다.
- 'Google'은 고유명사이므로 그대로 유지됩니다.
- "주어진 시간"은 "со временем"으로 번역될 수 있습니다.

이제 올바른 문법과 구문 규칙을 지키면서 러시아어 문장을 구성하겠습니다.

러시아어 문장: Вы бы полностьу поспорили, что оно не смогло бы заменить Google со временем?

이제 문장이 러시아어로 번역되었습니다.

- “Could not” is a contraction of “could not” and is translated as “не смогло бы”.
- "usurp" can be translated as "свергнуть" or "заменить". I'll choose " заменить ", which means "replacement". This word carries the idea of ​​gaining power or supremacy.
- 'Google' is a proper noun, so it will remain as is.
- “Given time” can be translated as “со временем”.

A two-story hyphen joins an early-19th century kitchen wing to the main block. The property also includes a post-Civil War frame tenant house and a 19th-century Coulbourne family cemetery. en:
Randy was not doing housework.  His wife was raising two children, and this only increased her workload. It put her under a lot of stress. What might this lead to?
Options:
- asthma
- more
- boredom
- headache
- arguments Let's think step by step:
Randy's lack of contribution to housework puts additional responsibilities on his wife, who is already raising two children. This increase in her workload could lead to stress, both physical and emotional. Let's analyze the options:

1. Asthma: Asthma is generally not caused by stress. It is a chronic lung disease and results from a combination of genetic and environmental factors. While stress can potentially trigger asthma symptoms in some cases, it is not a direct consequence of the given situation.

2. More: It seems this option is incomplete or unclear. Without any context, we cannot determine what "more" may refer to.

3. Boredom: Boredom would be unlikely in this situation, as the wife is dealing with a heavier workload and increased responsibilities. This would leave her with little time to feel bored, as most of her time would be occupied with housework and childcare.

4. Headache: Stress can indeed lead to headaches, which can be caused by tension, muscle strain, or hormonal changes. In the given situation, the wife's increased stress and workload may contribute to the development of headaches.

5. Arguments: The imbalance in shared responsibilities between Randy and his wife could likely lead to arguments and tension in their relationship. The wife may feel overwhelmed and resentful due to the unfair distribution of housework, leading to disagreements and strife in the family.

Based on this analysis, the most plausible outcomes of Randy not doing housework while his wife raises two children are headaches and arguments. These issues could arise from the increased stress, tension, and the unfair division of labor within their household.

2. 더보기: 이 옵션은 불완전하거나 불분명한 것 같습니다. 어떤 맥락도 없이는 "more"가 무엇을 의미하는지 판단할 수 없습니다.

3. 지루함: 아내가 더 많은 업무량과 증가된 책임을 처리하고 있기 때문에 이 상황에서는 지루함이 없을 것입니다. 그녀는 대부분의 시간을 집안일과 육아에 전념하게 되므로 지루함을 느낄 시간이 거의 없게 됩니다.

4. 두통: 스트레스는 실제로 두통을 유발할 수 있으며, 이는 긴장, 근육 긴장 또는 호르몬 변화로 인해 발생할 수 있습니다. 주어진 상황에서 아내의 스트레스와 업무량이 증가하면 두통이 발생할 수 있습니다.

While these elements are commonly associated with Chinese New Year celebrations, we cannot conclusively determine that the people are celebrating Chinese New Year for several reasons:

1. Chinese dragon costumes and red lanterns are symbolic representations used during various cultural and traditional events in China, not just Chinese New Year. For example, they may appear in Mid-Autumn Festival celebrations, weddings, or even business openings.

2. The Chinese dragon costume could be part of a performance or dance that is not explicitly related to Chinese New Year. The dragon dance, for instance, is performed in several other occasions to bring good fortune and chase away evil spirits. Similarly, red lanterns are considered a symbol of happiness and prosperity and can be used as decorations throughout the year.

3. The context of the event or location isn't provided. For example, the scenario could take place at a multicultural festival or a theme park, where costumes and decorations from various cultures are showcased regardless of the time of year.

4. Even if the event seems to include elements that are traditionally associated with Chinese New Year, the people might still be part of a cultural performance or using the decorations for other purposes, such as an art exhibition, photoshoot, or a stage play.

In summary, while the scenario described provides certain hints towards Chinese New Year celebration, we cannot decisively conclude that the people are celebrating it without additional information or context. Thus, the best answer is "it is not possible to tell."

en: D: advise people about safe driving in winter
google-ko: D: 겨울철 안전 운전에 대해 사람들에게 조언합니다.
google-en: D: Advise people about safe driving during winter.

en:
Given the question: I'm taking a test and have to guess the right answer to the question after the article. Article: Winter is dangerous because it's so difficult to know what is going to happen and accidents take place so easily. Fog can be waiting to meet you over the top of a hill. Ice might be hiding under the melting snow, waiting ahead to send you off the road. The car coming to you may suddenly slip across the road. Rule Number One for driving on icy roads is to drive smoothly . Sudden movements can make a car very difficult to control. So every time you either start or stop your car, increase or reduce your speed, you must be as gentle and slow as possible. Suppose you are driving with a full cup of hot coffee on the seat next to you. Drive so that you wouldn't spill  it. Rule Number Two is to pay attention to what might happen. The more ice there is, the further down the road you have to look. Test how long it takes to gently stop your car. Remember that you may be driving more quickly than you think. Generally, allow twice of your usual stopping distance when the road is wet, three times this distance on snow, and even more on ice. Try to stay in control of your car at all times and you will not get into trouble. Question: The writer tries to  _  in this passage. Options: A: show his dislikes about bad winter weather B: give information about winter weather C: ask people not to drive in winter D: advise people about safe driving in winter
The answer is:

B: 겨울 날씨에 대한 정보를 제공합니다. C: 사람들에게 겨울에 운전하지 말라고 요청합니다. D: 사람들에게 겨울철 안전 운전에 대해 조언합니다.

Title: Next to useless if you actually want to learn to use VTK Product review: If you're looking for a book to learn to use VTK, this is practically useless. The language is explained only incidentally, and in very little detail. the book mostly concentrates on computer graphics theory (which is done much better in other books) and visualisation, which it treats fairly well. Would you say this review depicts the product in a flattering or unflattering light?
Answer:
This review depicts the product in an unflattering light.

Step 1: Identifying the overall tone of the review
The reviewer uses phrases such as "practically useless," "very little detail," and "done much better in other books." These phrases indicate a negative tone.

Step 2: Analyzing the content of the review
The reviewer mentions that the book does not effectively teach how to use VTK and lacks detail in explaining the language. They also say that while computer graphics theory and visualization are covered, they are done better in other books.

Step 3: Conclusion
Based on the negative tone and critical content of the review, it is clear that the review depicts the product in an unflattering light.

en:
Single/multi-select question: If "Two people are wearing a Chinese dragon costume in front of an ornate Chinese gazebo with red pillars and the gazebo has two large red lanterns hanging from the roof.", can we conclude "The people are celebrating Chinese New Year."?

 a). yes. b). it is not possible to tell. c). no.
b). It is not possible to tell.

The given scenario mentions that two people are wearing a Chinese dragon costume in front of an ornate Chinese gazebo with red pillars, and there are two large red lanterns hanging from the roof. While these elements are commonly associated with Chinese New Year celebrations, we cannot conclusively determine that the people are celebrating Chinese New Year for several reasons:

1. Chinese dragon costumes and red lanterns are symbolic representations used during various cultural and traditional events in China, not just Chinese New Year. For example, they may appear in Mid-Autumn Festival celebrations, weddings, or even business openings.

2. The Chinese dragon costume could be part of a performance or dance that is not explicitly related to Chinese New Year. The dragon dance, for instance, is performed in several other occasions to bring good fortune and chase away evil spirits. Similarly, red lanterns are considered a symbol of happiness and prosperity and can be used as decorations throughout the year.

3. The context of the event or location isn't provided. For example, the scenario could take place at a multicultural festival or a theme park, where costumes and decorations from various cultures are showcased regardless of the time of year.

4. Even if the event seems to include elements that are traditionally associated with Chinese New Year, the people might still be part of a cultural performance or using the decorations for other purposes, such as an art exhibition, photoshoot, or a stage play.

In summary, while the scenario described provides certain hints towards Chinese New Year celebration, we cannot decisively conclude that the people are celebrating it without additional information or context. Thus, the best answer is "it is not possible to tell."

1. 중국의 용복과 홍등은 설날뿐만 아니라 중국의 다양한 문화, 전통 행사에서 사용되는 상징적 표현이다. 예를 들어, 중추절 축하 행사, 결혼식, 심지어 개업식에도 나타날 수 있습니다.

2. 중국 용 의상은 중국 설날과 명시적으로 관련되지 않은 공연이나 춤의 일부일 수 있습니다. 예를 들어, 용춤은 행운을 불러오고 악령을 쫓아내기 위해 여러 차례 공연됩니다. 마찬가지로 붉은 등불은 행복과 번영의 상징으로 간주되며 일년 내내 장식으로 사용할 수 있습니다.

3. 행사의 맥락이나 장소가 제공되지 않습니다. 예를 들어, 연중 시간에 관계없이 다양한 문화의 의상과 장식이 전시되는 다문화 축제나 테마파크에서 시나리오가 진행될 수 있습니다.

Step 1: Identify the number of votes Mark received in the first area.
We know that Mark won 70% of the votes in the first area with 100,000 voters. To determine the number of votes, we can multiply the percentage by the total number of voters.

Step 2: Calculate the number of votes Mark received in the first area.
To find the number of votes Mark received in the first area, we can perform the following calculation:
(70 / 100) * 100,000 = 70,000 votes

Step 3: Determine the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area.
According to the given information, Mark received twice as many total votes in the remaining area as he did in the first area. To calculate this number, we multiply the votes Mark received in the first area by 2.

Step 4: Calculate the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area.
To find the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area, we can perform the following calculation:
70,000 votes * 2 = 140,000 votes

Step 5: Calculate the total number of votes Mark received.
To find the total number of votes Mark received, we add the number of votes he received in both areas:
70,000 votes + 140,000 votes = 210,000 votes

Therefore, Mark received a total of 210,000 votes in both areas.

In spite, of Brosnan's detached, grunting style, in the end he comes through convincingly as a passionate, dedicated man. The plot is a little weak in demostrating his conversion from trapper to animal coservationist. Good film, highly recommended.
This is a positive sentiment. The person might have had some doubts at the beginning, especially about P. Brosnan playing an American Indian, but in the end, they found the film fascinating and very good. They enjoyed the performances of the actors, especially Annie Galipeau, and appreciated the movie's portrayal of native peoples. Even though they thought the plot could have done a better job showing the character's change from a trapper to an animal conservationist, they still highly recommend the film. It's like when you try a new flavor of ice cream, even if you weren't sure about it at first, you end up really liking it and want your friends to try it too!

en:
Given the question: I'm taking a test and have to guess the right answer to the question after the article. Article: Winter is dangerous because it's so difficult to know what is going to happen and accidents take place so easily. Fog can be waiting to meet you over the top of a hill. Ice might be hiding under the melting snow, waiting ahead to send you off the road. The car coming to you may suddenly slip across the road. Rule Number One for driving on icy roads is to drive smoothly . Sudden movements can make a car very difficult to control. So every time you either start or stop your car, increase or reduce your speed, you must be as gentle and slow as possible. Suppose you are driving with a full cup of hot coffee on the seat next to you. Drive so that you wouldn't spill  it. Rule Number Two is to pay attention to what might happen. The more ice there is, the further down the road you have to look. Test how long it takes to gently stop your car. Remember that you may be driving more quickly than you think. Generally, allow twice of your usual stopping distance when the road is wet, three times this distance on snow, and even more on ice. Try to stay in control of your car at all times and you will not get into trouble. Question: The writer tries to  _  in this passage. Options: A: show his dislikes about bad winter weather B: give information about winter weather C: ask people not to drive in winter D: advise people about safe driving in winter
The answer is:
D: advise people about safe driving in winter
google-ko:
주어진 질문: 저는 시험을 치르고 있으며 기사가 끝난 후 질문에 대한 정답을 추측해야 합니다. 기사: 겨울은 무슨 일이 일어날지 알기 어렵고, 사고도 쉽게 일어나기 때문에 위험합니다. 안개가 언덕 꼭대기에서 당신을 만나기를 기다리고 있을 수도 있습니다. 녹는 눈 아래 얼음이 숨어서 당신을 길에서 벗어나게 하려고 기다리고 있을지도 모릅니다. 당신에게 다가오는 차가 갑자기 도로를 가로질러 미끄러질 수도 있습니다. 빙판길 운전의 첫 번째 규칙은 원활하게 운전하는 것입니다. 갑작스러운 움직임으로 인해 자동차를 제어하기가 매우 어려워질 수 있습니다. 따라서 자동차의 시동을 걸거나 멈출 때, 속도를 높이거나 줄일 때마다 최대한 부드럽고 천천히 움직여야 합니다. 당신이 옆 좌석에 뜨거운 커피 한 잔을 얹고 운전하고 있다고 가정해 보세요. 흘리지 않도록 운전하십시오. 두 번째 규칙은 일어날 수 있는 일에 주의를 기울이는 것입니다. 얼음이 많을수록 길 아래로 더 멀리 살펴보아야 합니다. 차를 부드럽게 멈추는 데 걸리는 시간을 테스트해 보세요. 생각보다 더 빠르게 운전할 수 있다는 점을 기억하세요. 일반적으로 도로가 젖어 있을 때는 평소 정지 거리의 2배, 눈길에서는 이 거리의 3배, 빙판길에서는 그보다 더 긴 정지 거리를 허용하십시오. 항상 차를 통제하려고 노력하면 문제가 발생하지 않을 것입니다. 질문: 작가는 이 구절에서 _을 시도합니다. 옵션: A: 나쁜 겨울 날씨에 대한 싫어함을 보여줍니다. B: 겨울 날씨에 대한 정보를 제공합니다. C: 사람들에게 겨울에 운전하지 말라고 요청합니다. D: 사람들에게 겨울철 안전 운전에 대해 조언합니다.
정답은:
D: 겨울철 안전 운전에 대해 사람들에게 조언합니다.

Article: Winter is dangerous because it is difficult to know what will happen and accidents can easily happen. The fog may be waiting to meet you at the top of the hill.
