en:
What is a one-sentence summary of the following article?
You could go directly into the confessional (provided there's no one else in there or waiting outside), but sometimes it's nice to take a minute in the pew by yourself beforehand. You have this beautiful church probably almost all to yourself. Can you feel its energy resonating through you? Can you feel the majesty of the Lord's kingdom and how you're a part of it? Take a moment to kneel and pray with your head down and hands clasped together. Reflect on your faith and how you feel currently. Think about how you've been responding to God's call and how you've been living in the light of his love. When the priest is ready for you, of course. You'll probably see him there by his lonesome or someone else walk out just before you. Sit down either across from him or behind the screen -- it's totally up to you whether or not you prefer to remain anonymous. He won't treat you any differently either way. Make the sign of the cross upon his prompt, saying, "Bless me, Father, for I have sinned.  It has been (blank) since my last confession." This is your standard, traditional phrasing. However, if you just sit down and say hello, that's fine, too. The priest knows what he's doing. The Byzantine Rite is a bit different. The priest may sit to your side and put his epitrachelion on your head. He may then also do the Prayer of Absolution. But the idea remains the exact same -- just go wherever he takes you. Once you sit down and you've made the sign of the cross, just sit back and follow the priest's lead. He'll ask you how long it's been since your last confession (if you don't voluntarily offer that information), how you are feeling, maybe how your faith is going, and then ask you what sins you would like to talk about with him and God. It's just a casual conversation! Do not fret. There is absolutely zero pressure on your part. Again, as long as you come there with the intention of leaving with a clean heart, you're more than welcome in the church. There is no wrong way to go about confession! This part is intimidating, but think about it this way: the priest you're talking to has probably heard just about everything before. Whatever you have to say will not blow his mind. So when he asks, start rattling them off, from the most serious to the least. If he asks any questions, answer them, but do not feel the need to go into detail. A simple, "I did so and so," will suffice. Your priest is going to be very understanding. If you don't remember the exact timeframe, that's fine. If you don't remember your motivation, that's fine. All your priest cares about is that you're being as honest as possible and that your heart is in the right place. He'll talk you through everything, possibly asking about your intentions, but mainly just letting you know that God loves you, sin and all. If he has any ideas to bring you closer to God, he may suggest them at this juncture. He's there to help, after all. He will then ask you to make an Act of Contrition. That goes like this:  My God, I am sorry for my sins with all my heart.In choosing to do wrong and failing to do good,I have sinned against You whom I should loveabove all things. I firmly intend, with your help,to do penance, to sin no more, andto avoid whatever leads me to sin.Our Savior Jesus Christ suffered and died for us.In his name, my God, have mercy  (If you are a Roman Catholic, your act of contrition will go like this: Oh my God, I am very sorry for having offended thee. I detest all of my sins because of thy just punishment. But most of all, because they offend you, my God, who is all good and deserving of all my love. I firmly resolve with the help of thy grace, to sin no more, and to avoid the near occasion of sin. Amen. Don't worry! It won't be anything huge. You may even walk away just having to say a few meaningful prayers. Take the absolution to heart -- you now have a brand new, clean slate to work with. It'll feel so uplifting! Just to clarify, "absolution" means your sins are washed away. "Penance" is your expression of regret and repentance, showing God that you're truly sorry for what you've done and that you wish for nothing more than to be forgiven.

Summary:
google-ko:
다음 기사를 한 문장으로 요약하면 무엇입니까?
고해소에 직접 들어갈 수도 있지만(그 안에 다른 사람이 없거나 밖에서 기다리고 있는 경우) 때로는 미리 혼자 신도석에 잠시 시간을 내는 것도 좋습니다. 당신은 아마도 이 아름다운 교회를 거의 혼자 소유하고 있을 것입니다. 그 에너지가 당신을 통해 공명하는 것을 느낄 수 있습니까? 주님 왕국의 위대함과 여러분이 그 왕국의 일부라는 것을 느낄 수 있습니까? 잠시 무릎을 꿇고 머리를 숙이고 두 손을 모으고 기도하는 시간을 가지십시오. 당신의 믿음과 현재의 느낌을 생각해보십시오. 당신이 하나님의 부르심에 어떻게 응답해 왔는지, 그분의 사랑의 빛 가운데 어떻게 살아왔는지 생각해 보십시오. 물론, 신부님이 당신을 맞이할 준비가 되어 있을 때 말이죠. 당신은 아마도 그가 혼자 있는 모습을 보거나 다른 사람이 당신보다 먼저 걸어 나가는 것을 보게 될 것입니다. 그 사람의 맞은편이나 화면 뒤에 앉으십시오. 익명을 유지하고 싶은지 여부는 전적으로 귀하에게 달려 있습니다. 그는 어느 쪽이든 당신을 다르게 대하지 않을 것입니다. 그의 재촉에 따라 “아버지, 제가 죄를 지었사오니 저를 축복해 주십시오. 제가 마지막으로 고백한 이후로 그 자리는 비어 있었습니다.”라고 말하면서 십자 성호를 그으십시오. 이것은 귀하의 표준적이고 전통적인 표현입니다. 하지만 그냥 앉아서 인사만 하면 그것도 괜찮습니다. 목사님은 자기가 무슨 일을 하고 있는지 알고 계십니다. 비잔틴 의식은 조금 다릅니다. 신부는 당신 옆에 앉아서 그의 상피를 당신의 머리에 올려 놓을 수 있습니다. 그런 다음 그는 또한 사죄의 기도를 바칠 수도 있습니다. 그러나 아이디어는 여전히 동일합니다. 그가 데려가는 곳이면 어디든 가십시오. 일단 자리에 앉아 십자성호를 긋고 나면, 그냥 앉아서 사제의 인도를 따르십시오. 그는 당신이 마지막 고백을 한 지 얼마나 됐는지(자발적으로 그 정보를 제공하지 않는 경우), 기분이 어떤지, 어쩌면 당신의 믿음이 어떻게 진행되고 있는지 묻고, 어떤 죄에 대해 이야기하고 싶은지 물어볼 것입니다. 그와 신. 그냥 일상적인 대화에요! 걱정하지 마세요. 귀하의 입장에서는 전혀 압력이 없습니다. 다시 한 번 말하지만, 깨끗한 마음으로 떠나려는 의도를 갖고 그곳에 오는 한, 교회에서는 여러분을 더욱 환영할 것입니다. 고백에는 잘못된 방법이 없습니다! 이 부분은 두렵지만 이렇게 생각해보세요. 당신이 대화하고 있는 신부는 아마도 이전에 모든 것에 대해 들어봤을 것입니다. 당신이 무슨 말을 하든 그의 마음을 사로잡지는 못할 것이다. 따라서 그가 물으면 가장 심각한 것부터 가장 적은 것까지 덜컥 덜컥 울리기 시작하십시오. 그가 질문을 하면 대답하되 자세히 설명할 필요는 없습니다. 간단히 말해서, "나는 그렇게 했다"고 충분할 것입니다. 신부님께서 매우 이해해 주실 것입니다. 정확한 기간을 기억하지 못하더라도 괜찮습니다. 동기를 기억하지 못한다면 괜찮습니다. 당신의 신부가 관심을 갖는 것은 당신이 가능한 한 정직하고 당신의 마음이 올바른 곳에 있는지입니다. 그분은 당신의 의도에 대해 물으시면서 모든 것에 대해 말씀하실 것입니다. 그러나 주로 하나님은 당신과 죄와 모든 것을 사랑하신다는 것을 알려 주실 것입니다. 만약 그 사람이 당신을 하나님께 더 가까이 데려갈 아이디어가 있다면 이 시점에 제안할 수도 있습니다. 결국 그는 도움을 주기 위해 거기 있는 것입니다. 그런 다음 그는 당신에게 통회 행위를 하도록 요청할 것입니다. 그 내용은 이렇습니다. 나의 하나님, 나는 온 마음을 다해 나의 죄를 후회합니다. 나는 잘못된 일을 선택하고 선을 행하지 않음으로 무엇보다도 사랑해야 할 당신께 죄를 지었습니다. 나는 당신의 도우심으로 참회하고 더 이상 죄를 짓지 아니하며 나를 죄에 빠지게 하는 모든 것을 멀리하기로 굳게 작정하였나이다 우리 구주 예수 그리스도께서 우리를 위하여 고난을 받으시고 죽으셨으니 나의 하나님 그의 이름으로 자비를 베푸소서 (만일 로마 사람이거든 가톨릭인이여, 당신의 통회 행위는 다음과 같을 것입니다: 오 하느님, 당신을 화나게 해서 매우 죄송합니다. 나는 당신의 정당한 형벌로 인해 나의 모든 죄를 미워합니다. 그러나 무엇보다도, 나의 하느님, 모든 것이 선하고 나의 모든 사랑을 받기에 합당하오니 주의 은혜로 굳게 결심하오니 더 이상 죄를 짓지 아니하며 죄의 기회를 면하게 되리이다 아멘 걱정하지 마 큰 일이 아니리이다 몇 가지 의미 있는 기도만 하고 떠날 수도 있습니다. 사죄를 마음에 새기세요. 이제 작업할 수 있는 완전히 새롭고 깨끗한 상태가 되었습니다. 정말 기분이 좋아질 것입니다! 명확히 말하면, "사죄"는 당신의 죄를 의미합니다. "참회"는 후회와 회개의 표현으로, 자신이 행한 일에 대해 진심으로 뉘우치고 용서받는 것 외에는 아무것도 원하지 않는다는 것을 하나님께 보여드리는 것입니다.

요약:
google-en:
How would you summarize the following article in one sentence?
You can go into the confessional yourself (if no one else is there or waiting outside), but sometimes it's a good idea to spend some time alone in the pew beforehand. You will probably have this beautiful church almost to yourself. Can you feel that energy resonating through you? Can you feel the greatness of the Lord's kingdom and that you are a part of it? Take a moment to kneel, bow your head, put your hands together and pray. Think about your beliefs and how you feel right now. Think about how you have responded to God's call and how you have lived in the light of His love. Of course, when the bride is ready for you. You will probably see him alone or someone else walking out before you. Sit across from the person or behind the screen. It's entirely up to you whether you want to remain anonymous or not. He won't treat you any differently either way. At his urging, he said, “Father, bless me, for I have sinned. “The place has been empty since I last confessed,” and make the sign of the cross. This is your standard, traditional expression. But if you just sit down and say hello, that's okay too. The pastor knows what he is doing. The Byzantine ritual is a little different. The priest may sit next to you and place his epithet on your head. He may then also offer a prayer of forgiveness. But the idea is still the same. Go wherever he takes you. Once you are seated and have made the sign of the cross, simply sit back and follow the priest’s lead. He'll ask you how long it's been since your last confession (if you don't volunteer that information), how you're feeling, maybe how your faith is going, and what sins you'd like to talk about. Him and God. It's just a normal conversation! Do not worry. There is absolutely no pressure on your part. Again, the church will make you more welcome as long as you come there with the intention of leaving with a clean heart. There is no wrong way to confess! This part may be scary, but think of it this way. The bride you are talking to has probably heard about it all before. No matter what you say, you won't win his heart. So when he asks, start rattling off things from most serious to least serious. If he asks a question, answer it, but you don't need to elaborate. In short, “I did so” will suffice. The priest will be very understanding. It's okay if you don't remember the exact time period. If you don't remember your motivation, that's okay. All your bride cares about is that you are as honest as possible and that your heart is in the right place. He will tell you everything, asking you about your intentions. But mainly, God will let you know that He loves you, sin, and all. If the person has an idea that would bring you closer to God, he or she may offer it at this point. After all, he is there to help. He will then ask you to perform an act of contrition. The contents are as follows. My God, I regret my sin with all my heart. By choosing to do wrong and not doing good, I have sinned against You, whom I am supposed to love above all else. With your help I have decided to repent and sin no more and to abstain from everything that leads me into sin. Our Savior Jesus Christ suffered and died for us. Have mercy on me, my God, in His name (if Rome) If you are a man, Catholic, your act of contrition will be this: O God, I am very sorry for offending you. I hate all my sins for your just punishment. But above all, my God, all I am good and worthy of all my love. By Your grace I am determined. I will sin no more and I will be spared the opportunity to sin. Amen. Don't worry. It won't be a big deal. You can leave after saying a few meaningful prayers. Take your apology to heart. Now you have a completely new, clean slate to work with. It'll make you feel so good! To be clear, "absolution" means your sins. "Repentance" is an expression of remorse and repentance. , showing God that you are truly sorry for what you have done and that you want nothing more than to be forgiven.

summary:

en:
Lizzy: Tree Elementary School is raising money for a new playground. Mrs. Johnson’s class raised $2300, which is twice the amount that Mrs. Sutton’s class raised. Mrs. Sutton’s class raised 8 times less than Miss Rollin’s class. Miss Rollin’s class raised a third of the total amount raised by the school. How much money did the school raise for the playground if 2% will be deducted for administration fees?.
Me: Hmmm, let me think. I think this is the detailed solution:
Step 1: Find out how much Mrs. Sutton's class raised. Since Mrs. Johnson's class raised $2300, and that is twice the amount that Mrs. Sutton's class raised, we can divide $2300 by 2 to find the amount Mrs. Sutton's class raised:
2300 ÷ 2 = $1150

Step 2: Find out how much Miss Rollin's class raised. Since Mrs. Sutton's class raised 8 times less than Miss Rollin's class, we can multiply the amount Mrs. Sutton's class raised by 8 to find the amount Miss Rollin's class raised:
1150 × 8 = $9200

Step 3: Find the total amount raised by the school before deducting the administration fees. Since Miss Rollin's class raised a third of the total amount, we can multiply the amount Miss Rollin's class raised by 3 to find the total amount raised by the school before deducting the fees:
9200 × 3 = $27,600

Step 4: Calculate the amount of administration fees that need to be deducted. Since 2% of the total amount raised will be deducted for administration fees, we multiply the total amount by 0.02 (2% as a decimal):
27,600 × 0.02 = $552

Step 5: Subtract the administration fees from the total amount raised to find the final amount raised for the playground:
27,600 - 552 = $27,048

So, Tree Elementary School raised a total of $27,048 for the new playground after deducting the 2% administration fees.
google-ko:
리지: 트리 초등학교는 새 놀이터를 위한 기금을 모으고 있어요. Johnson 선생님 수업에서는 $2300를 모금했는데, 이는 Sutton 선생님 수업에서 모금한 금액의 두 배입니다. Sutton 선생님 수업은 Miss Rollin 수업보다 8배나 적은 금액을 모금했습니다. Miss Rollin의 학급에서는 학교에서 모금한 총액의 3분의 1을 모금했습니다. 관리비로 2%를 공제한다면 학교가 운동장을 위해 모은 돈은 얼마입니까?
나: 흠, 생각해 보겠습니다. 나는 이것이 자세한 해결책이라고 생각합니다.
1단계: Sutton 선생님의 수업료가 얼마나 올랐는지 알아보세요. Johnson 선생님 반에서 모금한 금액은 $2300이고 이는 Sutton 선생님 반에서 모금한 금액의 두 배이므로 $2300를 2로 나누어 Sutton 선생님 반에서 모금한 금액을 찾을 수 있습니다.
2300 ¼ 2 = $1150

2단계: 미스 롤린의 수업이 얼마나 올랐는지 알아보세요. Sutton 선생님의 반이 Miss Rollin 반의 모금 금액보다 8배 적었기 때문에 Mrs. Sutton 반의 모금액에 8을 곱하여 Miss Rollin 반의 모금 금액을 구할 수 있습니다.
1150 × 8 = $9200

3단계: 관리비를 공제하기 전에 학교에서 모금한 총액을 구합니다. Miss Rollin의 반이 모금한 금액의 3분의 1을 Miss Rollin의 반에서 모금한 금액에 3을 곱하여 비용을 공제하기 전에 학교에서 모금한 총액을 구할 수 있습니다.
9200 × 3 = $27,600

4단계: 공제해야 할 관리비 금액을 계산합니다. 모금된 총 금액의 2%가 관리비로 공제되므로 총 금액에 0.02(소수점 2%)를 곱합니다.
27,600 × 0.02 = $552

5단계: 모금된 총액에서 관리비를 빼서 놀이터의 최종 모금 금액을 찾습니다.
27,600 - 552 = $27,048

그래서 Tree 초등학교는 관리비 2%를 공제한 후 새 놀이터를 위해 총 27,048달러를 모금했습니다.

en: Alexander Kanoldt is related to the object entity 'New Objectivity' through the relation of 'movement'. New Objectivity was a movement in German art during the 1920s that was a reaction against Expressionism, and it focused on depicting objective reality rather than the emotional and introspective approach of Expressionism. Kanoldt was a German magic realist painter and one of the artists associated with the New Objectivity movement. His work included still lifes, portraits, and landscapes, which he rendered in a precise and geometric style, characteristic of the movement.
google-ko: 알렉산더 카놀트는 '움직임'의 관계를 통해 '새로운 객관성'이라는 객체 실체와 관계를 맺는다. 신객관성(New Objectivity)은 표현주의에 대한 반동으로 1920년대 독일 미술에 나타난 운동으로, 표현주의의 감정적이고 성찰적인 접근보다는 객관적인 현실을 묘사하는 데 중점을 두었습니다. Kanoldt는 독일의 마술적 사실주의 화가이자 New Objectivity 운동과 관련된 예술가 중 한 명이었습니다. 그의 작품에는 정물화, 초상화, 풍경화가 포함되어 있는데, 그는 이 작품을 운동의 특징인 정확하고 기하학적인 스타일로 표현했습니다.
google-en: Alexander Canault establishes a relationship with the object entity called ‘new objectivity’ through the relationship of ‘movement’. New Objectivity was a movement that appeared in German art in the 1920s as a reaction to Expressionism, focusing on depicting objective reality rather than the emotional and introspective approach of Expressionism. Kanoldt was a German magic realist painter and one of the artists associated with the New Objectivity movement. His work included still lifes, portraits, and landscapes, which he rendered in the precise, geometric style that was characteristic of the movement.

en:
Mark is running for an election and wins 70% of the votes in an area with 100,000 voters. He got twice as many total votes in the remaining area. How many votes did he get in total? Let's think first. Chain of thought:
Step 1: Identify the number of votes Mark received in the first area.
We know that Mark won 70% of the votes in the first area with 100,000 voters. To determine the number of votes, we can multiply the percentage by the total number of voters.

Step 2: Calculate the number of votes Mark received in the first area.
To find the number of votes Mark received in the first area, we can perform the following calculation:
(70 / 100) * 100,000 = 70,000 votes

Step 3: Determine the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area.
According to the given information, Mark received twice as many total votes in the remaining area as he did in the first area. To calculate this number, we multiply the votes Mark received in the first area by 2.

Step 4: Calculate the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area.
To find the number of votes Mark received in the remaining area, we can perform the following calculation:
70,000 votes * 2 = 140,000 votes

Step 5: Calculate the total number of votes Mark received.
To find the total number of votes Mark received, we add the number of votes he received in both areas:
70,000 votes + 140,000 votes = 210,000 votes

Therefore, Mark received a total of 210,000 votes in both areas.

Mark는 선거에 출마하여 유권자 100,000명이 있는 지역에서 70%의 득표율을 얻었습니다. 그는 나머지 영역에서 총 표의 두 배를 얻었습니다. 그는 총 몇 표를 얻었나요? 먼저 생각해 봅시다. 생각의 사슬:
1단계: Mark가 첫 번째 영역에서 받은 표 수를 확인합니다.
우리는 Mark가 100,000명의 유권자로 첫 번째 지역에서 70%의 표를 얻었다는 것을 알고 있습니다. 투표 수를 결정하려면 백분율에 총 투표자 수를 곱하면 됩니다.

2단계: Mark가 첫 번째 영역에서 받은 표 수를 계산합니다.
Mark가 첫 번째 영역에서 받은 투표 수를 찾으려면 다음 계산을 수행할 수 있습니다.
(70 / 100) * 100,000 = 70,000표

3단계: 마크가 나머지 영역에서 받은 표 수를 결정합니다.
제공된 정보에 따르면 Mark는 첫 번째 영역에서 얻은 것보다 나머지 영역에서 총 2배의 표를 얻었습니다. 이 숫자를 계산하기 위해 Mark가 첫 번째 영역에서 받은 표에 2를 곱합니다.

4단계: 마크가 나머지 영역에서 받은 표 수를 계산합니다.
나머지 영역에서 Mark가 받은 표 수를 찾으려면 다음 계산을 수행할 수 있습니다.
70,000표 * 2 = 140,000표

5단계: Mark가 받은 총 투표 수를 계산합니다.
Mark가 받은 총 투표 수를 찾기 위해 두 영역에서 받은 투표 수를 더합니다.
70,000표 + 140,000표 = 210,000표

따라서 마크는 두 영역 모두에서 총 21만 표를 얻었다.

(70 / 100) * 100,000 = 70,000 votes

en:
Summarize this article:

They have said they want to honour "the most charismatic actor of his generation" whose "dazzling talent" means he belongs "in the pantheon of legendary actors".
Clooney will be bestowed with the Honorary Cesar Award from the Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema later this month at the French equivalent of the Oscars.
The Academie said it had chosen the Ocean's Eleven and Gravity star because of his "dazzling talent as an actor, director, scriptwriter and producer - and above all, his artistic and spiritual generosity".
He "embodies Hollywood glamour", their effusive statement went on, adding: "His charm, humour, personality and engagement stand at the heart of our perpetual and eternal admiration."
And they predicted that Clooney's name "will forever be inscribed in the pantheon of legendary actors".
That should be enough to make sure he turns up to the Cesar Awards ceremony in Paris on 24 February.
Others to have won the honorary Cesar in the past include Scarlett Johansson, Quentin Tarantino, Kate Winslet and Michael Douglas.
Follow us on Facebook, on Twitter @BBCNewsEnts, or on Instagram at bbcnewsents. If you have a story suggestion email entertainment.news@bbc.co.uk.

Summary:
This article is about a famous actor named George Clooney. He is going to receive a special award called the Honorary Cesar Award in France later this month. This award is for his amazing work as an actor, director, scriptwriter, and producer. The people who chose him for this award say that he is very talented and generous, and they think his name will be remembered with other legendary actors. Other famous people have also won this award like Scarlett Johansson, Quentin Tarantino, Kate Winslet, and Michael Douglas.

그들은 "눈부신 재능"으로 "전설적인 배우들의 전당"에 속한다는 것을 의미하는 "그 세대의 가장 카리스마 넘치는 배우"를 기리고 싶다고 말했습니다.
클루니는 이번 달 말 프랑스의 오스카상과 동등한 아카데미 데 예술 및 기술 뒤 시네마(Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema)로부터 명예 세자르 상을 받게 됩니다.
아카데미는 "배우, 감독, 각본가, 프로듀서로서의 눈부신 재능, 그리고 무엇보다도 그의 예술적, 정신적 관대함" 때문에 오션스 일레븐과 그래비티 스타를 선택했다고 말했습니다.
그는 "할리우드의 매력을 구현한다"며 "그의 매력, 유머, 개성, 헌신은 우리의 영속적이고 영원한 존경의 중심에 있다"고 덧붙였다.
그리고 클루니의 이름은 "전설적인 배우들의 판테온에 영원히 새겨질 것"이라고 예측했다.
이는 그가 2월 24일 파리에서 열리는 세자르 시상식에 참석하기에 충분할 것입니다.
과거에 명예 세자르상을 수상한 다른 사람들로는 스칼렛 요한슨, 쿠엔틴 타란티노, 케이트 윈슬렛, 마이클 더글러스 등이 있습니다.
Facebook, Twitter @BBCNewsEnts 또는 Instagram(bbcnewsents)에서 우리를 팔로우하세요. 기사 제안이 있으면 entertainment.news@bbc.co.uk로 이메일을 보내주세요.

요약:
이 문서는 조지 클루니(George Clooney)라는 유명한 배우에 관한 것입니다. 그는 이달 말 프랑스에서 세자르 명예상(Honorary Cesar Award)이라는 특별상을 받을 예정이다. 이 상은 배우, 감독, 각본가, 프로듀서로서 그의 놀라운 업적에 대한 것입니다. 그를 이 상으로 선택한 사람들은 그가 매우 재능 있고 관대하며 그의 이름이 다른 전설적인 배우들과 함께 기억될 것이라고 말했다. 스칼렛 요한슨, 쿠엔틴 타란티노, 케이트 윈슬렛, 마이클 더글라스 등 다른 유명 인사들도 이 상을 받았습니다.

To summarize this article:

They said they wanted to honor "the most charismatic actor of his generation," whose "dazzling talent" meant he belonged to the "panel of legendary actors."
Clooney will receive an honorary César award later this month from the Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema, France's equivalent of the Oscars.
The Academy said it chose the Ocean's Eleven and Gravity star because of his "dazzling talent as an actor, director, writer and producer, and most of all, his artistic and spiritual generosity."
He "embodies Hollywood glamour," he said, adding, "His charm, humor, personality and dedication are at the center of our enduring and everlasting respect."
And he predicted that Clooney's name "will forever be engraved in the pantheon of legendary actors."
This will be enough for him to attend the César Awards in Paris on February 24th.
Other past recipients of the Honorary César Award include Scarlett Johansson, Quentin Tarantino, Kate Winslet, and Michael Douglas.

en:
Given the task definition and input, reply with output. In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head is located or can be found at/in/on the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.

Head: PersonX abolishes ___ altogether<sep>Tail: to have a plan

작업 정의와 입력이 주어지면 출력으로 응답합니다. 이 작업에서는 <sep>으로 구분된 Head와 Tail이라는 두 개의 구문이 제공됩니다. 머리와 꼬리 이벤트는 참가자와 관련된 짧은 문구입니다. 특정 인물의 이름은 일반적인 단어(예: PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ)로 대체되었습니다. PersonX는 항상 이벤트의 주제입니다. Head가 Tail에/안/에 위치하거나 찾을 수 있는지 여부를 결정해야 합니다. 답변을 "예"와 "아니요"로 분류하세요. 문구에는 개체, 사람 및/또는 동작이 될 수 있는 자리 표시자 "___"도 포함될 수 있습니다.

머리: PersonX는 ___을(를) 완전히 폐지합니다<sep>꼬리: 계획을 가지고 있습니다

Title: The Financial Landscape of Football Management: An Overview of Managerial Salaries and Diversity in English Football

Introduction:

The world of football management is a fascinating one, filled with unique challenges, high stakes, and the ever-present potential for glory or heartbreak. Over the years, the landscape of football management has undergone massive changes, not only in terms of tactics and style but also in the financial aspects of the profession. The money involved in football has skyrocketed, and the wages of the individuals in charge of guiding their teams to success have seen a similar rise. However, diversity in these managerial positions remains a challenge that must be addressed. This article seeks to provide a comprehensive overview of the financial landscape of football management in England, while also discussing the importance of increasing diversity in the sport.

Income Disparity Among Managers Across Different Tiers:

When discussing the financial aspect of football management, it's crucial to recognize the significant income disparities that exist across the different tiers of English football. At the top of the pyramid, the Premier League is undoubtedly the most lucrative, with managers raking in an average of £3 million per year. Among these Premier League managers, Jose Mourinho leads the pack with an annual salary of £8.37 million.

In stark contrast, managers in the lower leagues of English football earn significantly less. In League One, the average manager earns £75,000 per year – a mere fraction of the wages made by their Premier League counterparts. For those in League Two, the financial situation is even more modest, with average yearly earnings of £50,000.

These vast differences in salary can be attributed to a variety of factors, such as club revenue, size of fan base, and the financial prowess of the club's ownership. Nevertheless, this disparity in earnings highlights the vast gulf that exists between the footballing elite and the lower tiers - a divide that persists not only in wages but also in the resources available to clubs, playing staff, and facilities.

Diversity Challenges: Underrepresentation of Black Managers

While a discussion of the financial landscape of football management is of great interest, it's essential not to overlook the matter of diversity within the profession. As it stands, only 4.4% of managers appointed since the 1992-93 season are black, a figure that is troublingly low.

The underrepresentation of black managers may be attributed to numerous factors, such as unconscious bias or the crippling effects of systemic racism. However, regardless of the reasons, this lack of representation poses a significant problem for both the sport and society as a whole. The lack of diversity within football management sends a disheartening message to black and minority coaches, potentially discouraging them from pursuing careers in this field. Moreover, it perpetuates the disturbing trend of racial inequality that has long plagued football and other areas of society.

The Need for Change:

Addressing these issues - both the financial disparity amongst managers and the underrepresentation of black individuals in managerial roles - is of paramount importance for the continued development and progress of English football. By fostering a more equitable and diverse environment within football management, clubs can not only uncover previously untapped talent pools but also work towards creating a more inclusive atmosphere within the sport.

In conclusion, the landscape of football management is a complex and ever-changing one. While the financial aspects of the profession grab headlines and dominate discourse, it's essential to maintain a focus on the importance of promoting inclusivity, diversity, and equality within the sport. Only by acknowledging and addressing these shortcomings can the world of football grow and develop into a truly representative and inclusive realm for all who participate in it.

제목: 축구 경영의 금융 환경: 잉글랜드 축구의 감독 급여 및 다양성 개요

소개:

축구 경영의 세계는 독특한 도전, 큰 위험, 영광이나 비통함을 향한 항상 존재하는 잠재력으로 가득 찬 매혹적인 세계입니다. 수년에 걸쳐 축구 감독의 환경은 전술과 스타일 측면뿐만 아니라 직업의 재정적 측면에서도 엄청난 변화를 겪었습니다. 축구에 관련된 돈이 급등했고, 팀을 성공으로 이끄는 책임자의 임금도 비슷하게 올랐습니다. 그러나 이러한 관리직의 다양성은 해결해야 할 과제로 남아 있습니다. 이 기사에서는 영국 축구 경영의 재정 상황에 대한 포괄적인 개요를 제공하는 동시에 스포츠에서 다양성을 높이는 것의 중요성에 대해서도 논의합니다.

계층별 관리자 간 소득 격차:

축구 관리의 재정적인 측면을 논의할 때 영국 축구의 다양한 계층에 걸쳐 존재하는 심각한 소득 격차를 인식하는 것이 중요합니다. 피라미드의 꼭대기에 있는 프리미어 리그는 의심할 여지 없이 가장 수익성이 높은 곳으로, 감독들은 연간 평균 300만 파운드를 벌어들입니다. 이들 프리미어 리그 감독들 중에서 조세 무리뉴(Jose Mourinho)는 연봉 837만 파운드로 선두를 달리고 있습니다.

이와는 대조적으로 영국 축구 하위 리그의 감독들은 훨씬 적은 수입을 얻습니다. 리그 1의 평균 감독은 연간 £75,000를 벌어들입니다. 이는 프리미어 리그 감독이 받는 임금의 극히 일부에 불과합니다. 리그 2에 속한 사람들의 재정 상황은 훨씬 더 온건하여 평균 연간 수입이 £50,000입니다.

급여의 이러한 엄청난 차이는 클럽 수익, 팬 기반 규모, 클럽 소유권의 재정적 능력과 같은 다양한 요인에 기인할 수 있습니다. 그럼에도 불구하고 이러한 소득 격차는 축구 엘리트와 하위 계층 사이에 존재하는 엄청난 격차, 즉 임금뿐만 아니라 클럽, 선수단, 시설에 사용할 수 있는 자원에서도 지속되는 격차를 강조합니다.

다양성 문제: 흑인 관리자의 과소대표

축구 경영의 재정적 환경에 대한 논의가 큰 관심을 끄는 반면, 직업 내 다양성 문제를 간과하지 않는 것이 중요합니다. 현재로서는 1992-93 시즌 이후 임명된 감독 중 흑인이 차지하는 비율은 4.4%에 불과하며, 이는 심각할 정도로 낮은 수치입니다.

흑인 관리자의 대표성이 과소 대표되는 것은 무의식적인 편견이나 체계적인 인종 차별의 심각한 영향과 같은 수많은 요인에 기인할 수 있습니다. 그러나 이유에 관계없이 이러한 대표성 부족은 스포츠와 사회 전체에 심각한 문제를 야기합니다. 축구 경영진의 다양성 부족은 흑인 및 소수 코치들에게 실망스러운 메시지를 전달하여 잠재적으로 그들이 이 분야에서 경력을 추구하는 것을 방해하게 됩니다. 더욱이 이는 오랫동안 축구와 사회의 다른 영역을 괴롭혀온 인종 불평등의 불안한 추세를 영속시킵니다.

변화의 필요성:

이러한 문제(감독 간의 재정적 격차와 관리직에서 흑인 개인의 과소 대표성)를 해결하는 것은 영국 축구의 지속적인 발전과 발전을 위해 가장 중요합니다. 축구 경영 내에서 보다 공평하고 다양한 환경을 조성함으로써 클럽은 이전에 개발되지 않은 인재 풀을 발굴할 수 있을 뿐만 아니라 스포츠 내에서 보다 포용적인 분위기를 조성하기 위해 노력할 수 있습니다.

결론적으로, 축구 관리의 환경은 복잡하고 끊임없이 변화하는 환경입니다. 직업의 재정적 측면이 헤드라인을 장식하고 담론을 지배하는 동안, 스포츠 내에서 포용성, 다양성 및 평등을 촉진하는 것의 중요성에 초점을 유지하는 것이 필수적입니다. 이러한 단점을 인정하고 해결함으로써만 축구계는 참여하는 모든 사람을 위한 진정으로 대표적이고 포용적인 영역으로 성장하고 발전할 수 있습니다.

Title: The financial landscape of football management: An overview of managerial pay and diversity in English football.

introduction:

The world of football management is a fascinating world filled with unique challenges, great risks and the ever-present potential for glory or heartbreak. Over the years, the landscape of football managers has undergone enormous changes, not only in terms of tactics and style, but also in the financial aspects of the profession. The money involved in soccer has soared, and the wages of those responsible for leading the team to success have similarly risen. However, diversity in these management positions remains a challenge. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the financial situation of English football management, while also discussing the importance of increasing diversity in the sport.

Income gap between managers by class:

When discussing the financial aspects of football management, it is important to recognize the significant income gap that exists across the different tiers of English football. The Premier League, at the top of the pyramid, is undoubtedly the most lucrative, with managers earning an average of £3 million a year. Among these Premier League managers, Jose Mourinho leads the way with a salary of £8.37 million.

In contrast, managers in the lower leagues of English football earn much less. The average manager in League One earns £75,000 a year. This is just a fraction of what a Premier League manager is paid. The financial situation of those in League Two is much more moderate, with an average annual income of £50,000.

This huge difference in salaries can be attributed to a variety of factors such as club revenue, size of fan base and financial strength of club ownership. Nonetheless, this income gap highlights the enormous gap that exists between football's elite and its lower classes - a gap that persists not only in wages, but also in the resources available to clubs, squads and facilities.

Diversity Issues: Underrepresentation of Black Managers

While discussions about the financial climate of football management are of great interest, it is important not to overlook the issue of diversity within the profession. Currently, only 4.4% of coaches appointed since the 1992-93 season are black, a woefully low figure.

The underrepresentation of Black managers can be attributed to a number of factors, such as unconscious bias or the severe effects of systemic racism. But regardless of the reason, this lack of representation poses serious problems for sport and society as a whole. The lack of diversity in football management sends a discouraging message to black and minority coaches, potentially discouraging them from pursuing a career in the field. Moreover, it perpetuates the disturbing trends of racial inequality that have long plagued football and other areas of society.

The need for change:

Addressing these issues – the financial gap between managers and the under-representation of black individuals in management positions – is paramount to the continued development and development of English football. By creating a more equitable and diverse environment within football management, clubs can not only tap into previously untapped talent pools, but also work to create a more inclusive atmosphere within the sport.

In conclusion, the landscape of football management is a complex and constantly changing environment. While the financial aspects of the profession dominate the headlines and discourse, it is essential to maintain focus on the importance of promoting inclusion, diversity and equality within sport. Only by acknowledging and addressing these shortcomings can the world of football grow and develop into a truly representative and inclusive sphere for all who participate.

결론적으로, 축구 관리의 환경은 복잡하고 끊임없이 변화하는 환경입니다. 직업의 재정적 측면이 헤드라인을 장식하고 담론을 지배하는 동안, 스포츠 내에서 포용성, 다양성 및 평등을 촉진하는 것의 중요성에 초점을 유지하는 것이 필수적입니다. 이러한 단점을 인정하고 해결함으로써만 축구계는 참여하는 모든 사람을 위한 진정으로 대표적이고 포용적인 영역으로 성장하고 발전할 수 있습니다.

Use the following highlights to write your article:

Premier League managers earn an average of 3 million pounds (about 3 billion won) per year. However, Jose Mourinho leads the way with the highest fee of £8.37m. Managers in League Two earn an average of £50,000 per year. League One bosses earn an average of £75,000 per year. Only 4.4% of managers appointed since 1992-93 are black.
Title: The financial landscape of football management: An overview of managerial pay and diversity in English football.

introduction:

The world of football management is a fascinating world filled with unique challenges, great risks and the ever-present potential for glory or heartbreak. Over the years, the landscape of football managers has undergone enormous changes, not only in terms of tactics and style, but also in the financial aspects of the profession. The money involved in soccer has soared, and the wages of those responsible for leading the team to success have similarly risen. However, diversity in these management positions remains a challenge. This article provides a comprehensive overview of the financial situation of English football management, while also discussing the importance of increasing diversity in the sport.

Income gap between managers by class:

When discussing the financial aspects of football management, it is important to recognize the significant income gap that exists across the different tiers of English football. The Premier League, at the top of the pyramid, is undoubtedly the most lucrative, with managers earning an average of £3 million a year. Among these Premier League managers, Jose Mourinho leads the way with a salary of £8.37 million.

In contrast, managers in the lower leagues of English football earn much less. The average manager in League One earns £75,000 a year. This is just a fraction of what a Premier League manager is paid. The financial situation of those in League Two is much more moderate, with an average annual income of £50,000.

This huge difference in salaries can be attributed to a variety of factors such as club revenue, size of fan base and financial strength of club ownership. Nonetheless, this income gap highlights the enormous gap that exists between football's elite and its lower classes - a gap that persists not only in wages, but also in the resources available to clubs, squads and facilities.

Diversity Issues: Underrepresentation of Black Managers

While discussions about the financial climate of football management are of great interest, it is important not to overlook the issue of diversity within the profession. Currently, only 4.4% of coaches appointed since the 1992-93 season are black, a woefully low figure.

The underrepresentation of Black managers can be attributed to a number of factors, such as unconscious bias or the severe effects of systemic racism. But regardless of the reason, this lack of representation poses serious problems for sport and society as a whole. The lack of diversity in football management sends a discouraging message to black and minority coaches, potentially discouraging them from pursuing a career in the field. Moreover, it perpetuates the disturbing trends of racial inequality that have long plagued football and other areas of society.

The need for change:

Addressing these issues – the financial gap between managers and the under-representation of black individuals in management positions – is paramount to the continued development and development of English football. By creating a more equitable and diverse environment within football management, clubs can not only tap into previously untapped talent pools, but also work to create a more inclusive atmosphere within the sport.

In conclusion, the landscape of football management is a complex and constantly changing environment. While the financial aspects of the profession dominate the headlines and discourse, it is essential to maintain focus on the importance of promoting inclusion, diversity and equality within sport. Only by acknowledging and addressing these shortcomings can the world of football grow and develop into a truly representative and inclusive sphere for all who participate.

en:
Summarize this article:

They have said they want to honour "the most charismatic actor of his generation" whose "dazzling talent" means he belongs "in the pantheon of legendary actors".
Clooney will be bestowed with the Honorary Cesar Award from the Academie des Arts et Techniques du Cinema later this month at the French equivalent of the Oscars.
The Academie said it had chosen the Ocean's Eleven and Gravity star because of his "dazzling talent as an actor, director, scriptwriter and producer - and above all, his artistic and spiritual generosity".
He "embodies Hollywood glamour", their effusive statement went on, adding: "His charm, humour, personality and engagement stand at the heart of our perpetual and eternal admiration."
And they predicted that Clooney's name "will forever be inscribed in the pantheon of legendary actors".
That should be enough to make sure he turns up to the Cesar Awards ceremony in Paris on 24 February.
Others to have won the honorary Cesar in the past include Scarlett Johansson, Quentin Tarantino, Kate Winslet and Michael Douglas.
Follow us on Facebook, on Twitter @BBCNewsEnts, or on Instagram at bbcnewsents. If you have a story suggestion email entertainment.news@bbc.co.uk.

en: Information:  - Max Beckmann (February 12, 1884  December 27, 1950) was a German painter, draftsman, printmaker, sculptor, and writer. Although he is classified as an Expressionist artist, he rejected both the term and the movement. In the 1920s, he was associated with the New Objectivity ("Neue Sachlichkeit"), an outgrowth of Expressionism that opposed its introverted emotionalism.  - Alexander Kanoldt ( 29 September 1881 -- 24 January 1939 ) was a German magic realist painter and one of the artists of the New Objectivity . Kanoldt was born in Karlsruhe . His father was the painter Edmond Kanoldt , a late practitioner of the Nazarene style . After studies at the Academy of Fine Arts Karlsruhe in Karlsruhe he went to Munich in 1908 , where he met a number of modernists such as Alexei Jawlensky , Wassily Kandinsky and Gabriele Münter . He became a member of the Munich New Secession in 1913 , with Jawlensky and Paul Klee . After military service in World War I from 1914 to 1918 , the still lifes Kanoldt painted show the influence of Derain and an adaptation of cubist ideas . By the early 1920s Kanoldt developed the manner for which he is best known , a magic realist rendering of potted plants , angular tins , fruit and mugs on tabletops . He also painted portraits in the same severe style , as well as geometrical landscapes . In 1925 he was made a professor at Breslau Academy , a post he held until 1931 . During this time he came into conflict with the Bauhaus faction at the Academy , and he was increasingly at odds with the avant garde . From 1933 until his resignation in 1936 he was the director of the State School of Art in Berlin . With the rise of the Nazi regime in 1933 Kanoldt attempted accommodation , painting in a romantic style , but nonetheless many of his works were seized by the authorities as degenerate art in 1937 . He died in Berlin in 1939 .  - George Grosz (July 26, 1893  July 6, 1959) was a German artist known especially for his caricatural drawings and paintings of Berlin life in the 1920s. He was a prominent member of the Berlin Dada and New Objectivity group during the Weimar Republic. He emigrated to the United States in 1933, and became a naturalized citizen in 1938. Abandoning the style and subject matter of his earlier work, he exhibited regularly and taught for many years at the Art Students League of New York. In 1956 he returned to Berlin where he died.  - The New Objectivity (in ) was a movement in German art that arose during the 1920s as a reaction against expressionism. The term was coined by Gustav Friedrich Hartlaub, the director of the in Mannheim, who used it as the title of an art exhibition staged in 1925 to showcase artists who were working in a post-expressionist spirit.  As these artistswho included Max Beckmann, Otto Dix, and George Groszrejected the self-involvement and romantic longings of the expressionists, Weimar intellectuals in general made a call to arms for public collaboration, engagement, and rejection of romantic idealism.    'alexander kanoldt' is related to which object entity through the relation of 'movement'?  Choices: - expressionism  - new objectivity

Kanoldt는 Karlsruhe에서 태어났습니다. 그의 아버지는 나사렛 양식의 후기 실천가인 화가 에드몬드 카놀트(Edmond Kanoldt)였습니다. 카를스루에 미술 아카데미 카를스루에에서 공부한 후 1908년 뮌헨으로 가서 Alexei Jawlensky, Wassily Kandinsky, Gabriele Münter와 같은 많은 모더니스트를 만났습니다. 그는 1913년 Jawlensky, Paul Klee와 함께 뮌헨 신분리파의 회원이 되었습니다. 1914년부터 1918년까지 제1차 세계 대전에서 군복무를 마친 후 Kanoldt가 그린 정물화는 Derain의 영향과 입체파 사상의 적용을 보여줍니다. 1920년대 초에 Kanoldt는 자신이 가장 잘 알려진 방식인 화분, 각진 통, 과일 및 테이블 위에 머그잔을 마법처럼 사실적으로 렌더링하는 방식을 개발했습니다. 그는 또한 기하학적 풍경화뿐만 아니라 동일한 엄격한 스타일로 초상화를 그렸습니다. 1925년에 그는 브레슬라우 아카데미(Breslau Academy)의 교수가 되었고, 1931년까지 그 직책을 맡았습니다. 이 기간 동안 그는 아카데미의 바우하우스 파벌과 충돌하게 되었고, 아방가르드와는 점점 더 사이가 나빠졌다. 1933년부터 1936년 사임할 때까지 그는 베를린 국립예술학교의 교장을 역임했다. 1933년 나치 정권이 등장하자 Kanoldt는 낭만적인 스타일로 그림을 그리려고 시도했지만 그럼에도 불구하고 그의 작품 중 다수는 1937년 퇴폐적 예술로 간주되어 당국에 의해 압류되었습니다. 그는 1939년 베를린에서 사망했다. - 조지 그로스(George Grosz, 1893년 7월 26일 ~ 1959년 7월 6일)는 1920년대 베를린 생활을 풍자화로 그린 그림으로 특히 유명한 독일 예술가였습니다. 그는 바이마르 공화국 시절 베를린 다다와 신객관성 그룹의 저명한 회원이었습니다. 그는 1933년에 미국으로 이주했고, 1938년에 귀화 시민이 되었습니다. 이전 작품의 스타일과 주제를 버리고, 그는 정기적으로 전시하고 뉴욕 미술 학생 연맹에서 수년 동안 가르쳤습니다. 1956년에 그는 베를린으로 돌아와 그곳에서 사망했다. - 신객관성(New Objectivity)은 1920년대 표현주의에 대한 반동으로 일어난 독일 미술 운동이다. 이 용어는 만하임의 관장인 구스타프 프리드리히 하르트라우브(Gustav Friedrich Hartlaub)가 1925년 후기 표현주의 정신으로 작업한 예술가들을 전시하기 위해 개최한 미술 전시회의 제목으로 사용하여 만들어졌습니다. 막스 베크만(Max Beckmann), 오토 딕스(Otto Dix), 조지 그로스(George Grosz)를 포함한 이들 예술가들이 표현주의의 자기 참여와 낭만적인 갈망을 거부함에 따라, 바이마르 지식인들은 일반적으로 공공 협력, 참여, 낭만적 이상주의 거부를 위해 무기를 동원했습니다. Although he is classified as an expressionist artist, he rejected both the term and the movement. In the 1920s he became associated with the new objectivity ("Neue Sachlichkeit"), an offshoot of expressionism opposed to introverted emotionalism. - Alexander Kanoldt (September 29, 1881 - January 24, 1939) was a German magic realist painter and one of the Neo-Objectivist artists. Kanoldt was born in Karlsruhe. His father was the painter Edmond Kanoldt, a later practitioner of the Nazarene style. He studied at the Karlsruhe Academy of Fine Arts in Karlsruhe and then went to Munich in 1908, where he met many modernists such as Alexei Jawlensky, Wassily Kandinsky and Gabriele Münter. He became a member of the Munich New Isolationist group in 1913 along with Jawlensky and Paul Klee. The still lifes painted by Kanoldt after his military service in World War I from 1914 to 1918 show the influence of Derain and his application of Cubist ideas. In the early 1920s, Kanoldt developed the method for which he is best known: magically realistic renderings of flower pots, angular barrels, fruit, and tabletop mugs. He also painted portraits in the same rigorous style as well as geometric landscapes. In 1925 he became professor at the Breslau Academy, a position he held until 1931. During this period he came into conflict with the Bauhaus faction of the Academy and became increasingly at odds with the avant-garde. From 1933 until his resignation in 1936, he served as director of the Berlin State Academy of Arts. With the rise of the Nazi regime in 1933, Kanoldt attempted to paint in a romantic style, but many of his works were nonetheless confiscated by the authorities in 1937 as they were deemed decadent art. He died in Berlin in 1939. - George Grosz (July 26, 1893 – July 6, 1959) was a German artist particularly famous for his satirical paintings of life in Berlin in the 1920s. He was a prominent member of the Berlin Dada and New Objectivity groups during the Weimar Republic. He immigrated to the United States in 1933 and became a naturalized citizen in 1938. Abandoning the style and subject matter of his previous work, he exhibited regularly and taught for many years at the Art Students League of New York. In 1956 he returned to Berlin and died there. - New Objectivity is a German art movement that arose as a reaction against Expressionism in the 1920s. Kanoldt는 Karlsruhe에서 태어났습니다. 그의 아버지는 나사렛 양식의 후기 실천가인 화가 에드몬드 카놀트(Edmond Kanoldt)였습니다. 카를스루에 미술 아카데미 카를스루에에서 공부한 후 1908년 뮌헨으로 가서 Alexei Jawlensky, Wassily Kandinsky, Gabriele Münter와 같은 많은 모더니스트를 만났습니다. 그는 1913년 Jawlensky, Paul Klee와 함께 뮌헨 신분리파의 회원이 되었습니다. 1914년부터 1918년까지 제1차 세계 대전에서 군복무를 마친 후 Kanoldt가 그린 정물화는 Derain의 영향과 입체파 사상의 적용을 보여줍니다. 1920년대 초에 Kanoldt는 자신이 가장 잘 알려진 방식인 화분, 각진 통, 과일 및 테이블 위에 머그잔을 마법처럼 사실적으로 렌더링하는 방식을 개발했습니다. 그는 또한 기하학적 풍경화뿐만 아니라 동일한 엄격한 스타일로 초상화를 그렸습니다. 1925년에 그는 브레슬라우 아카데미(Breslau Academy)의 교수가 되었고, 1931년까지 그 직책을 맡았습니다. 이 기간 동안 그는 아카데미의 바우하우스 파벌과 충돌하게 되었고, 아방가르드와는 점점 더 사이가 나빠졌다. 1933년부터 1936년 사임할 때까지 그는 베를린 국립예술학교의 교장을 역임했다. 1933년 나치 정권이 등장하자 Kanoldt는 낭만적인 스타일로 그림을 그리려고 시도했지만 그럼에도 불구하고 그의 작품 중 다수는 1937년 퇴폐적 예술로 간주되어 당국에 의해 압류되었습니다. 그는 1939년 베를린에서 사망했다. - 조지 그로스(George Grosz, 1893년 7월 26일 ~ 1959년 7월 6일)는 1920년대 베를린 생활을 풍자화로 그린 그림으로 특히 유명한 독일 예술가였습니다. 그는 바이마르 공화국 시절 베를린 다다와 신객관성 그룹의 저명한 회원이었습니다. 그는 1933년에 미국으로 이주했고, 1938년에 귀화 시민이 되었습니다. 이전 작품의 스타일과 주제를 버리고, 그는 정기적으로 전시하고 뉴욕 미술 학생 연맹에서 수년 동안 가르쳤습니다. 1956년에 그는 베를린으로 돌아와 그곳에서 사망했다. - 신객관성(New Objectivity)은 1920년대 표현주의에 대한 반동으로 일어난 독일 미술 운동이다. 이 용어는 만하임의 관장인 구스타프 프리드리히 하르트라우브(Gustav Friedrich Hartlaub)가 1925년 후기 표현주의 정신으로 작업한 예술가들을 전시하기 위해 개최한 미술 전시회의 제목으로 사용하여 만들어졌습니다. 막스 베크만(Max Beckmann), 오토 딕스(Otto Dix), 조지 그로스(George Grosz)를 포함한 이들 예술가들이 표현주의의 자기 참여와 낭만적인 갈망을 거부함에 따라, 바이마르 지식인들은 일반적으로 공공 협력, 참여, 낭만적 이상주의 거부를 위해 무기를 동원했습니다. '알렉산더 카놀트'는 '움직임'의 관계를 통해 어떤 객체 실체와 관련되어 있는가? 선택: - 표현주의 - 새로운 객관성

알렉산더 카놀트는 '움직임'의 관계를 통해 '새로운 객관성'이라는 객체 실체와 관계를 맺는다. 신객관성(New Objectivity)은 표현주의에 대한 반동으로 1920년대 독일 미술에 나타난 운동으로, 표현주의의 감정적이고 성찰적인 접근보다는 객관적인 현실을 묘사하는 데 중점을 두었습니다. Kanoldt는 독일의 마술적 사실주의 화가이자 New Objectivity 운동과 관련된 예술가 중 한 명이었습니다. 그의 작품에는 정물화, 초상화, 풍경화가 포함되어 있는데, 그는 이 작품을 운동의 특징인 정확하고 기하학적인 스타일로 표현했습니다.
google-en:
Information: - Max Beckmann (February 12, 1884 – December 27, 1950) was a German painter, draftsman, printmaker, sculptor, and writer. Although he is classified as an expressionist artist, he rejected both the term and the movement. In the 1920s he became associated with the new objectivity ("Neue Sachlichkeit"), an offshoot of expressionism opposed to introverted emotionalism. - Alexander Kanoldt (September 29, 1881 - January 24, 1939) was a German magic realist painter and one of the Neo-Objectivist artists. Kanoldt was born in Karlsruhe. His father was the painter Edmond Kanoldt, a later practitioner of the Nazarene style. He studied at the Karlsruhe Academy of Fine Arts in Karlsruhe and then went to Munich in 1908, where he met many modernists such as Alexei Jawlensky, Wassily Kandinsky and Gabriele Münter. He became a member of the Munich New Isolationist group in 1913 along with Jawlensky and Paul Klee. The still lifes painted by Kanoldt after his military service in World War I from 1914 to 1918 show the influence of Derain and his application of Cubist ideas. In the early 1920s, Kanoldt developed the method for which he is best known: magically realistic renderings of flower pots, angular barrels, fruit, and tabletop mugs. He also painted portraits in the same rigorous style as well as geometric landscapes. In 1925 he became professor at the Breslau Academy, a position he held until 1931. During this period he came into conflict with the Bauhaus faction of the Academy and became increasingly at odds with the avant-garde. From 1933 until his resignation in 1936, he served as director of the Berlin State Academy of Arts. With the rise of the Nazi regime in 1933, Kanoldt attempted to paint in a romantic style, but many of his works were nonetheless confiscated by the authorities in 1937 as they were deemed decadent art. He died in Berlin in 1939. - George Grosz (July 26, 1893 – July 6, 1959) was a German artist particularly famous for his satirical paintings of life in Berlin in the 1920s. He was a prominent member of the Berlin Dada and New Objectivity groups during the Weimar Republic. He immigrated to the United States in 1933 and became a naturalized citizen in 1938. Abandoning the style and subject matter of his previous work, he exhibited regularly and taught for many years at the Art Students League of New York. In 1956 he returned to Berlin and died there. - New Objectivity is a German art movement that arose as a reaction against Expressionism in the 1920s. The term was coined by Gustav Friedrich Hartlaub, director of Mannheim, as the title of an art exhibition held in 1925 to showcase artists working in the spirit of late expressionism. As these artists, including Max Beckmann, Otto Dix, and George Grosz, rejected the self-involvement and romantic longings of Expressionism, Weimar intellectuals generally promoted public cooperation, participation, and romantic ideals. They took up arms to deny the state. What object entity is 'Alexander Canault' related to through the relationship of 'movement'? Selection: - Expressionism - New Objectivity

Alexander Canault establishes a relationship with the object entity called ‘new objectivity’ through the relationship of ‘movement’. New Objectivity was a movement that appeared in German art in the 1920s as a reaction to Expressionism, focusing on depicting objective reality rather than the emotional and introspective approach of Expressionism. Kanoldt was a German magic realist painter and one of the artists associated with the New Objectivity movement. His work included still lifes, portraits, and landscapes, which he rendered in the precise, geometric style that was characteristic of the movement.

en:
Given the task definition and input, reply with output. In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head is located or can be found at/in/on the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.

Head: PersonX abolishes ___ altogether<sep>Tail: to have a plan

Step 1: Identify the Head and Tail phrases.
Head: PersonX abolishes ___ altogether
Tail: to have a plan

Step 2: Determine if the Head is in the Tail or not.
In this case, the Head is about PersonX abolishing something, while the Tail is about having a plan. These are two separate concepts, and the Head is not located in or found within the Tail.

Output: No
google-ko:
작업 정의와 입력이 주어지면 출력으로 응답합니다. 이 작업에서는 <sep>으로 구분된 Head와 Tail이라는 두 개의 구문이 제공됩니다. 머리와 꼬리 이벤트는 참가자와 관련된 짧은 문구입니다. 특정 인물의 이름은 일반적인 단어(예: PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ)로 대체되었습니다. PersonX는 항상 이벤트의 주제입니다. Head가 Tail에/안/에 위치하거나 찾을 수 있는지 여부를 결정해야 합니다. 답변을 "예"와 "아니요"로 분류하세요. 문구에는 개체, 사람 및/또는 동작이 될 수 있는 자리 표시자 "___"도 포함될 수 있습니다.

머리: PersonX는 ___을(를) 완전히 폐지합니다<sep>꼬리: 계획을 가지고 있습니다

1단계: 머리 문구와 꼬리 문구를 식별합니다.
머리: PersonX는 ___을(를) 완전히 폐지합니다.
꼬리: 계획을 세우다

2단계: 머리가 꼬리에 있는지 확인합니다.
이 경우 Head는 PersonX가 무언가를 폐지하는 것에 관한 것이고 Tail은 계획을 세우는 것에 관한 것입니다. 이는 두 가지 별도의 개념이며 머리는 꼬리에 위치하거나 꼬리에서 발견되지 않습니다.

출력: 아니요

Names of specific people have been replaced with common words (e.g. PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the topic of the event. We need to determine whether the Head can be located/located in/in the Tail. Sort your answers into “yes” and “no.” The phrase may also contain the placeholder "___", which can be an object, person, and/or action.

Head: PersonX will completely abolish ___<sep>Tail: We have a plan

Step 1: Identify head and tail phrases.
Head: PersonX completely abolishes ___.
Tails: make a plan

Step 2: Make sure the head is in the tail.
In this case, Head is about PersonX abolishing something and Tail is about making plans. These are two separate concepts and the head is either located in the tail or not found in the tail.

Output: No

en:
To determine the sentiment of this review, I will consider the positive and negative statements made throughout the text.

Step 1: Identify positive statements
- The movie shows love.
- Strong performances from everyone.
- The suspense makes it worthwhile to watch on a rainy night.

Step 2: Identify negative statements
- The budget is low, especially in comparison to "Waterworld".
- The film never really tapped into its full potential.

Step 3: Weigh the positive and negative statements
- There are more positive statements than negative ones.
- The negative statements mainly focus on the production aspects, while the positive statements emphasize the performances and overall enjoyment of the movie.

Conclusion: The sentiment of this review is overall positive. The reviewer acknowledges some shortcomings regarding the budget and untapped potential, but ultimately, they find the movie enjoyable due to its strong performances and suspense.

- 부정적인 진술보다 긍정적인 진술이 더 많습니다.
- 부정적인 진술은 주로 제작적인 측면에 초점을 맞추고 있는 반면, 긍정적인 진술은 영화의 연기와 전반적인 즐거움을 강조합니다.
